loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Grace has a business of a restaurant, which she has had for over 10 years.          

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more food and stocks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Grace hopes to construct her own restaurant and stop renting.

loans.use: buying food and stocks

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith forma parte del banco comunal “Prieto Cruz” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella vende flores y comida rápida, como sopaipillas, hot dogs, sándwiches y empanadas, en un carrito frente al cementerio. Estas actividades las desarrolla hace 23 años, pero en esa ubicación trabaja hace 10 años. 
Su familia, es decir sus 3 hijas y sus yernos, también venden sus productos en ese mismo sector. Sus hijas también trabajan con Fondo Esperanza y sus negocios consisten en la venta de confites, helados y mote con huesillo.  
Con este préstamo Judith quiere comprar una máquina congeladora, para guardar sus productos comestibles. Su meta es apoyar y motivar a sus hijas para que crezcan en sus negocios y así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Durante la tragedia del terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, Judith perdió toda su mercadería, y afortunadamente su casa no tuvo daños. Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo que les dio Fondo Esperanza, haciéndose presente con ollas comunes (repartiendo comida a los emprendedores afectados) y tomando medidas de emergencia con respecto a los pagos de los préstamos. Judith ha sentido también un gran apoyo de parte de Fondo Esperanza, en relación a su negocio y a los de sus hijas, ya que gracias a los créditos y la educación, sus negocios han podido crecer. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Judith is part of the “Prieto Cruz” communal bank, in the city of Concepción. She sells flowers and fast food such as sopaipillas (deepfried pumpkin pastries), hot dogs, sandwiches and empanadas, from a stall in front of the cemetery. She has developed these activities over 23 years, although she has been in this location for 10 years. 

Her family - which is to say her three daughters and their children, also sell products in the same sector. Her daughters also work with [the field partner] Fondo Esperanza, and their businesses consist of selling sweets, icecreams, and mote con huesillo (a sweet drink / dessert made with peaches). With this loan, Judith wants to buy a freezer, to store her perishable foods. Her goal is to support and motivate her daughters in their businesses, so that they can grow and improve their quality of life. 

In the terrible earthquake that happened on 27th February, Judith lost all her stock, though fortunately her house was not damaged. She is very grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza has given them, being there with communal cooking pots (sharing food among businesspeople affected), and putting in place emergency measures in respect of loan repayments. Judith has also had great support from Fondo Esperanza in relation to her business and those of her daughters, as it is thanks to their loans and training that their businesses have been able to grow. 

Concepción sits at the mouth of the Río Biobío, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile. It has played an important part in our history, being the site of important battles and settlements, especially duiring the Arauco War, thanks to its location on the edge of mapuche territory. Today the city is economically and demographically important. It is starting to be considered as one of the most important urban centres in Chile - in administrative, financial, and comercial terms - after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: Freezer

loans.name: Dinay Onyango

texts.en:
Dinah Anyango is 59 years old and from the from Sondu area. She is married to Walter and they have four children who are adults. The first born is 30 years old and the last is 18 years old.

Dinah runs a butcher shop which has lasted for the past 15 years. Her monthly income is Kshs 10,000. She has applied for a loan of Kshs 10,000 which she wants to use to buy more meat and add to her stock. Her clients consist mostly of the people who live around her butcher shop and also the local hotels.

Her desire is to see her business expand and be able to employ one person to help her run the butcher shop.

loans.use: Buy meat supplies for her butcher shop

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José  O. P. tiene 70 años. Es casado  vive la esposa, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el campo y comprar un terreno.

Le gusta salir a ver el ganado vacuno, y festejar las fiestas del pueblo.
texts.en:
José O. P. is 70 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. He has five children who are all adults.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group work in agriculture and the group is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. The group consists of approximately 10 members, all of whom live in the same area and the majority work growing corn, wheat and potatoes.

José works in agriculture growing corn, wheat and potatoes. He makes his purchases in the San Pablo parish and makes his sales at the San Pablo market.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. His dream is to continue working in the fields and to purchase a piece of land.

He likes to go see cattle and also likes to participate in the area celebrations.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson M. is 35 years old and married with 4 children ages 12 – 1 year. He is in the produce buying and selling business mainly dealing in maize, ground nuts and beans from Rukizi. In his business, He and  his wife  also have a waragi (local gin) selling business. Most of Wilson’s customers are grocery store owners. Wilson  needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale to his customers. Wilson has had the business for 10 years and he used the profit from his previous textile business to buy the first stock of produce for sale. So far he has paid school fees for his children, expanded his business and also bought a piece of land.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josefa also raises ducks and sells duck eggs in their community. 

Josefa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs and duck feed.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and duck feed.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 12 añitos la que acaba de culminar su primaria, habita en la Zona # 7 en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea junto a sus padres quienes dependen de ella y a su vez le cuidan a su niña cuando ella sale a trabajar.  la Señora Cristina labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Miguel Larreynaga ubicada en la Colonia el Serrano desde hace 6 años de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para el sustento de su Familia, Ha venido creando sus propios activos por ser una mujer esforzada y muy trabajadora.  

Solicita su tercer crédito para invertirlo en remodelación de una habitación misma que construyo con credito anterior mediante Kiva, por tanto agradece mucho este apoyo que le ha permitido dar mejores condiciones en su vivienda y a la vez a su familia.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goce de salud y mejorar sus condiciones de vida .
texts.en:
Cristina is 42 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 12 year-old daughter who has just finished elementary school.  She lives in Area #7 of the town of Nueva Guinea together with her parents who are dependent on her.  Her parents help to look after her daughter when she goes out to work.

Cristina works as an elementary school teacher in Miguel Larreynaga School which is located in El Serrano district.  She has worked there for 6 years and makes a monthly wage with which she supports her family.  She has been creating her own assets as she is a very dedicated and hard-working woman.

Cristina is requesting her third loan to invest in remodeling a room that she built with a previous Kiva loan.  She is very grateful for this support which has allowed her to provide her home and family with better conditions.

Cristina's biggest dream in life is for her family to enjoy good health and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To remodel a room

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with four children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her family with the help of her husband and her dream is to educate her children. She has been a hairdresser for two years and the business is still growing amidst challenges of lack of enough skilled labor and limited finances. Juliet needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
L. socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia es L. Sra. Maritza Elizabeth; elL. tiene 23 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; L. socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. transporte, elL. tiene un carro que hace servicio D. taxi, su esposo es el que trabaja en este negocio y elL. es cobradora D. servicio urbano en una combi, L. socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. transporte. L. socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento D. su carro.

 L. socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "El Molinito II". The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.
The member's name is Maritza. She is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She alternates her household work with a transportation business. She has a car that she puts to service as a taxi. Her husband drives the taxi for her business and she is also the fare-collector in an urban mini-van taxi service. The member wants to improve her transportation business and so she is requesting a loan for the maintenance of her car.
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to abiD. by the repayment scheme.

loans.use: To maintain her taxi.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and selling food. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable and improving her cash flow. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 16,000 to purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Magdalena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Jaime De Jesus

texts.es:
Desde hace 30 años Jaime se dedica la producción de buñuelos, sin embargo hasta hace poco inició su negocio aquí en Medellín, ya que hacía un tiempo estaba buscando suerte en Cali, pero después de mucho buscar decidió que lo mejor era regresar a su tierra.

Jaime trabaja haciendo buñuelos en horas de la mañana y en la tarde hace comidas rápidas, es por esto que necesita un carro para las comidas rápidas ya que el que tiene no el suficiente para atender a sus clientes y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime has been making donuts for 30 years but he has only recently set up his business here in Medellin. For some time he was looking for luck in Cali but he later decided that it would be best to come back to his roots.

Jaime makes donuts in the mornings and in the afternoons he makes fast foods. For this reason he needs a cart to sell fast foods. He doesn't have enough to attend to his clients and he will be able to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: To purchase a fast food cart.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Samuel Antonio es un señor trabajador que cuenta con un negocio de que es ofrecer el servicio de nintendo, en donde él tiene una gran variedad de juegos que sus pequeños clientes le solicitan. Desde hace 17 años que se mantiene en este medio de vida. Este negocio lo atiende el a pesar de tener ciertos problemas, porque alguna veces no tiene energía eléctrica no se desanima para seguir adelante. El motivo por el cual realiza este financiamiento es para la compra de controles, discos y reparar un televisor que está en mal estado. Samuel quiere comprar mercancía para ofrecer un buen servicio y así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor Samuel Antonio is a hardworking man who runs a business renting Nintendo games. He has a wide variety of games that his young customers ask for. He’s had his business for 17 years, and in spite of having problems such as an occasional lack of electricity, he is keen to carry on.

Samuel is seeking a loan to buy controls, DVDs, and to repair a TV screen which isn’t working properly. With this new merchandise he will be able to offer better service and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy controls, DVDs, and to repair a TV screen

loans.name: Twelwaneku Development Group

texts.en: Betty G. is 43 years old and has four children.  She operates a beauty salon business at her home along Amber Court Road in Jinja. She has been running this business for 10 years. She took root in this business with paltry start-up capital of 50,000 shillings. At the threshold of her business, she had to come to grips with a lot of financial hardships but with her tenacity and determination, she was able to continue. Betty's salon earns a profit of 50,000 shillings a week. Betty will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics and other essential items for her salon and also use the remaining proceeds to pay fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and other essential beauty salon items

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas lives in Uganda, is 33 years old and is applying for this loan to buy items to sell in the clothing shop he runs in the town of Kyenjojo. It's important for him to buy new items now, because business in his shop always picks up before and during the Easter season. Thomas is married and has six children. He lives in a home which he shares with nine people who he also cares for, and dreams of buying land so that he can run a tea plantation and provide all of his children with a good education. His wife makes a living by running a hotel.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom graduated from school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 12 years, she has operated a poultry business, sold doughnuts, and operated a food stall. In addition she also operates a farming business which contributes another source of income. Fatuma faces a major challenge in the price fluctuation of the market. She dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting she wants to purchase chicks, and chicken feed, as well as bundles of wheat flour and rice for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed, as well as wheat flour and rice

loans.name: John Mungai

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 29 years old, married to Lucy Wanjiru and they have 3 children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his 1st loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor.

In future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Enrique Michael

texts.es:
Enrique de 42 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Tiene una lavadora de autos.

Comenzó hace 6 meses atrás y fue por iniciativa propia para poder solventar los gastos del hogar. Labora diariamente con ayuda de una persona contratada. Le afecta las competencia ya que por el lugar hay mas que lavan carros. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas bombas u lubricantes para su negocio y aumentar mas su productividad. En un futuro desea incrementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Enrique, 42, lives in the Primavera de Duran (city outskirts that used to be undeveloped, with some hills, creeks, and lagoons that still seem like a decaying natural area). He has a car wash.


He began 6 years ago on his own initiative to be able to cover  household expenses.  He works every day with the help of a contracted laborer.  There is a lot of competition and that affects his business.  He will use the loan to buy more hyrdaulic pump fluid and lubricants for his business so he can increase his productivity.  In the future he would like his business to grow.

loans.use: To buy hydraulic pump fluid and lubricants

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Pilar has been raising livestock  for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Pilar is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional animals to raise, as well as feed and vitamins.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Arlinda has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She also sells detergents. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell. Arlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

In the future, Arlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.en:
Mahabat is a 44-year-old villager. She lives in the village of Kyzylbulak, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She works in the local administration of a nearby area and is characterized by her colleagues as a very positive and open-hearted person. Currently, her salary is too low to support her family, which is why she began to breed livestock and cultivate the land.

Mahabat began her business using 6,000 Kyrgyzstani som (KGS) in capital and, over time, managed to generate a profit of 3,000 KGS per month. She was able to establish a farm, which is in need of development. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenue she expects to generate from the loan, she plans to expand her business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the area's especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which in turn leads to increased employment and meets the needs of clients and lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is 50 years old. He a farmer; he is married to Jacinta who is a housewife. They are blessed with ten children. He has been in the farming business for the past eleven years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and watering pipes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children up to university level. His hope and dream is to export his farm produce which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and watering pipes.

loans.name: Doris Alcantar

texts.es: La señora Doris vive en la zona de Pampahasi central que esta ubicada a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad de la paz. Ella vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija. Doris se dedica a vender ropa de  segunda mano en su puesto de venta en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad del alto. Esta feria tiene lugar los días jueves y domingo y es la feria más grande de esta ciudad. Su esposo, juan trabaja con su minibús de once pasajeros en servicio público. Él presta sus servicios en el sindicato de transportes que esta compuesta por varios grupos y cinco líneas de transporte de minibuses pequeños. La señora Doris trabaja con préstamos en emprender desde el año 2005 y durante todo este tiempo siempre ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual y responsable con sus pagos. En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa para la temporada de frio.  El mayor anhelo de Doris y juan es ampliar sus negocios y comprar otro minibús.
texts.en: Doris lives in the central Pampahasi area that is located 20 minutes from the center of the city of La Paz. She lives in her parents' house along with her husband and their small daughter. Doris is dedicated to selling second-hand clothing from her stall in the July 16 market in the city of Alto.This market takes places on Thursdays and Sundays and is the biggest market in this city. Her husband, Juan, works with his 11-passenger minibus for public service. He loans his services in the transportation syndicate that is made up of various groups and five lines of small minibus transportation. Doris has worked with loans from Emprender since the year 2005 and during all this time she has always proven to be a very punctual and responsible customer with her payments. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of clothing for the cold season. Doris' and Juan's greatest dream is to expand their businesses and buy another minibus.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of winter clothes.

loans.name: Magno

texts.en:
Magno lives in Dugayung, Amulung, together with his wife and three children. As head of the family, he raises crops to generate income. He goes in to the field every day, either sunny or rainy day season. He plants and harvests rice twice a year in May and November. He sells to traders in the village. He usually earns about 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each crop season. According to him, his profits are not enough to sustain his family and educate his children.

Magno needs to produce an abundant harvest to earn more income. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to have additional capital to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With his perseverance and determination, the loans that will be given to him will help increase his yield. In the future, he hopes to earn consistent profits for home improvement.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Glendy Siomara

texts.es:
GLENDY  SIOMARA

Doña  GLENDY SIOMARA  quien desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta productos comestibles de consumo diario, ahora viendo la necesidad  de aprovechar los recursos de su  casa donde tiene su local, ahora ha  incluido la venta de pan, por la mañana y tarde, también agrego la venta de peluches  y regalos, como así mismo  los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de papas fritas,y pollo, entre otros  ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y gracias a Dios cuenta con la ayuda en todo tiempo de su hija, quien atiende el negocio mientras ella vende refacciones de forma ambulante en su localidad,  tiene varias ideas en su mente que quiere  implementar pero para ello necesita de mas capital,  gracias a Dios los clientes la visita todos los días y su propósito es servirles y ofrecerles lo que ellos necesitan, es así como ella logra ayudar a su esposo en la crianza de sus 4 hijos ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad.
texts.en:
Doña Glendy Siomara has been selling everyday consumer food products for several years. Now she sees the need to take advantage of the resources in her house where she has her store. She currently has added the sale of bread, both in the mornings and the afternoons. Glendy has also added plush toys and gifts to her inventory. On the weekends, she sells French fries, chicken, and other foods. She is an extremely hardworking woman.

Thanks to God, she has the full-time help of her daughter who manages the business while she sells snacks as a street vendor in town. Glendy has several ideas on her mind that she wants to implement, but she needs more capital. Thanks to God, her customers visit her every day. Her goal is to serve them and offer them what they need. In this manner, she is able to help her husband with raising their four children.

She is requesting a loan to buy food products that are basic staples.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Nemelyn

texts.en:
Nemelyn is 31 years old and is married with two children. With her children in school, Nemelyn works very hard to provide for them. For the past five years, she has run a variety store in the Philippines where she sells items such as soft-drinks, rice, canned goods, and other products. 

Nemelyn is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en: Emelinda is 51 years old and blessed with six children. She wants her children to pursue an education so they can become professionals. But because of life's difficulties, four of her children are already married and unable to continue their education. Despite that, she remains strong and engaged in her hog-fattening business in order to provide for every need of her remaining children who are studying. Her hogs usually lack food and for this reason Emelinda is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy enough feed and vitamins to provide them with better nourishment. She hopes this will increaser her income and help her to provide better living conditions for her family. She wants to have a comfortable life and doesn’t want her children to experience the same difficulties she has faced.

loans.use: to buy enough feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel y su esposa la señora Miriam tienen ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de invierno que son (Conjuntos deportivos, sudaderas, suéteres, abrigos y zapatos para dama, hombres y niños) por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la familia. 
Desean  mejorar la calidad de vida y que su hijo tenga todo lo necesario para una su futuro.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel and his wife, Miriam, have been selling new and used clothes for over 8 years in various parts of the city.  He’s asking for a loan to buy winter clothes like sports ensembles, sweatshirts, sweaters, coats and women’s, men’s and children’s shoes.  For the moment, he does not have sufficient funds available to be able to invest in his business.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the profits he earns in his business since this is his family’s source of income.  They wish to improve their quality of life and that their son has everything he needs for the future.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is aged 21 and  married though not yet blessed with any child. He has been in farming in Kitale for the last 4 years producing and selling milk, maize and eggs to the local market. He runs a motorcycle transport business besides farming.

David  has requested for a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.He says the dairy cow purchase will provide milk for the family consumption and improve the family living standards. He says he will buy more dairy cows for better business.

He however states dairy animal diseases are limiting farmers income significantly.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 27 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children between two and 7 years old. All of her children are currently in school and live at home. For twelve years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the community market. She now makes a larger profit and has more customers than before, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business. She hopes to change her business to a bar and restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda started her general store after she married Martin. The couple is blessed with six children, and five of them are in school. Their eldest is already working in Manila as a factory worker. Erlinda and her family live in the village of San Ignacio province of Isabela. Their main dialect is Ybanag, the local language in their place. 

Erlinda wants to borrow PHP 15,000 as additional business capital for her store. She plans to use the loan to buy additional merchandise to meet the demands of her customers. Although her business is not that big, it contributes a lot to sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, noodles and spices for her store.

loans.name: Sara Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Sara Liliana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 31 años y 1 hija de 11 meses de nacida.
Cuando terminaba de estudiar su mamá le habló sobre los  banquitos comunales que daban oportunidades a mujeres para generar sus propios ingresos, ella muy joven y emocionada decidió ingresar a Manuela Ramos. 
Inició con un capital de S/. 400.00, que lo  invirtió en la compra de mercadería (ropa  para adultos), desde entonces se dedica a este negocio, muy a parte de las labores que realiza como técnica contable esto le ha servido para poder ahorrar, es así como viene asegurando el futuro de sus pequeña hija. 
Actualmente viene exhibiendo su mercadería en la bodega de su mamá y espera pronto tener su propio local.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00,  comprará  ropa para niños y adultos, zapatos para sus clientes fijos que son sus amigos de su oficina, y lo demás para ofrecer a sus parientes y vecinos por campaña Navideña.
Sara Liliana  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio de venta de abarrotes  y otro de ropa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de crecer y hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sara Liliana belongs to the community bank "Virgen de la Inmaculada" in the district of Tarapoto, in the province and department of San Martín. She is married, 31 years old, and has an 11 month old daughter.
When she was finishing studying, her mother talked to her about the community banks that give opportunities to women to generate their own income. She was very young and excited and decided to join one of the Manuela Ramos community banks. 
She began with S/. 400 of capital which she invested in buying merchandise (adult's clothes). Since then, she has run this business and, thanks to her labors in accounting, has been able to save and this is how she is securing a good future for her little girl.
She currently displays her merchandise in her mother's store and hopes to have her own stall soon.
She will use this new loan of $750 to buy clothes for children and adults and shoes for her established clients. Her clients are her friends from her office and she also sells to her family and neighbors before Christmas. 
Sara Liliana is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have her own business selling groceries as well as a clothes store. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering her the opportunity to grow and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy clothes for adults.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is a hardworking businessman, aged 26. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last seven years, he has been running a retail shop in order to support his family. He also runs a grocery business to supplement his income. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. 
Nicholus has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy salt, sugar and milk for resale. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. In the next five years, he plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Fattouma

texts.en:
Fattouma is a 55-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her three siblings. They are all joining forces and working really hard to cover the heavy living expenses. Fattouma opened her own mini-market in 2001 and has ten years of experience in this domain. She’s really satisfied with the results she has attained so far. 

Today, she’s looking for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the required quantities of groceries including sugar, soft drinks, cigarettes and many other items. She notes that this Kiva loan will increase her sales thus her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase the required quantities of groceries such as sugar, soft drinks, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawavi est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 1 enfant.
Yawavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des boissons pour tous clients dans son bar. Elle achète les produits à la brasserie de Lomé. Elle est aidée par une personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.
Yawavi a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons à la brasserie du bénin. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawavi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawavi, age 29, is married to a mason and has one child. Since 2008, she's been selling beverages to a diverse clientele in her bar.

She gets her supplies from a brewery in Lomé, and has one person to help her. At this time, her main difficulty is not being able to meet customer demand.

Yawavi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchases beverages from a Beninese brewery. She wants to reinvest in her business.  

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Papa Saliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Papa Saliou âgé de 56 ans, est marié avec deux épouses .Il exerce le métier de menuisier ébéniste depuis  trente ans : il l’a démarré dès le bas âge.
Avec le crédit il  va acheter du bois et de la colle pour fabriquer des meubles. 
Avec  les bénéfices de son activité, il veut agrandir son atelier.
texts.en:
Mrs. Papa Saliou, age 56, is married to two women. He's been a cabinet and furniture maker for thirty years: he started very young.

With his loan, he will buy wood and glue to make furniture. With his profits, he wants to expand his workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 12 years to 16 years. She describes herself as honest, visionary, ambitious and God-fearing. 

She operates a retail store where she sells material and dresses. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located at an ideal place and her primary customers are women. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothing materials. Her business goal is to expand her clothes retail store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials.

loans.name: Tagareed

texts.en: Tagareed is a 47 year old woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who helps support 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy materials such as fabric, silk and beads for her sewing and embroidery projects which she sells. She would like to increase her profits and thus her family's living standards in this way.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing and embroidery

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a baker, baking pastries in Wegbe, Hohoe. Hellen has received formal education to the middle school level. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is into farming. Hellen began baking for her livelihood before she got married and has been doing it since to support her husband. She has been baking for the past 16 years. She is responsible for the basic needs of the home and helps her husband to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour, buckets of margarine, and bags of sugar. She hopes to save use the new profits from her business and reinvest back into her business so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, buckets of margarine, and bags of sugar for her bakery

loans.name: Oklounonwe Lingbohoto Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKLOUNONWE LINGBOHOTO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Françoise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Françoise est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise  n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Françoise est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Lucien. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisées et cinq à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Françoise vend depuis treize ans dans son quartier des condiments. De façon secondaire, Françoise vend du charbon de bois. Françoise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Françoise ensemble avec les membres du groupe OKLOUNONWE LINGBOHOTO, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et des sacs de charbon  de bois.

loans.name: Qurotul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Qurotul. Qurotul lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Qurotul owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment service for her community. She joined Ruma in 2012. This is the second time she is asking for a loan from Kiva. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to improve her business, as well as make more contributions to her community.

As the business keep growing, Qurotul is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Qurotul improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Qurotul is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is an energetic and beautiful young 43 year old woman. Born in Lugari a rural village in Kitale, she has lots of enthusiasm and is very resourceful. Since she was a little girl she has demonstrated her talents and knack for farming. Lugari is a remote village in Kitale where people live in dismal conditions.

But within the remote village of Lugari Lillian is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Lilian as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her five children as a primary caregiver. Lilian started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 0.25 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in farming.

Lilian is seeking a loan to buy farm implements such as modern farming tools and seeds. Her operations are growing consistently, hence the need to buy modern farming implements so that she can be reliable.
The additional income from the increased production will enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her children. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings.
Her biggest dream is to own a house and to provide her children with a good future.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en:
Ramon has been running this business for about 2 years. Prior to this, he had to rely on finding jobs as a construction worker or an assistant to feed his family. He and his wife decided to open their own restaurant because it provided a more reliable source of income. Ramon needs the loan in order to place the business inside of his home. Currently he has his tables and chairs outside, but as the rainy season approaches this is huge inconvenience for his clients. Ramon has two daughters who help the business when they can. He also works as a security guard at night in order to bring in extra income.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Ramon needs the loan in order to place the business inside of his home.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.en: Hello, my name is Guadalupe. I am a merchant and my primary activity is lotion and jewelry sales. I distribute them as a street vendor, in different schools and offices. Thanks to this business I can help cover my family’s expenses and other commitments, and thus achieve greater opportunities and a better quality of life for my family.

loans.use: Purchase of chains, wristwatches, rings, earrings, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Mr. Trang is 58 years old and his wife is 2 years younger. They have 2 daughters whose ages are 7 and 9. His first daughter has cerebral palsy. His second daughter is a student at local primary school. They have 0.1 hectare of land for growing vegetablew. The family income is $9 per person/month. Trang hopes to get a loan of $75 so that he can invest in his field in order to save money to support his family. He is confident that he can repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Investing in the vegetable field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new glass display cabinets

loans.name: Hítala

texts.es:
Señora Hítala is the 38-year-old mother of two children, 8 and 2 years old. She began working at a young age. Thanks to her hard work for many years she was able to have her own clothing store. Unfortunately, she was the victim of a robbery that left her and her children without anything; her business was her only source of income for her and her family.After working hard to star all over again she now has a small store which sells snacks and is located in her youngest daughters school. Hitala’s desire is to grow her small yet profitable business. Her goal is to provide her young costumers more options and make them feel comfortable while shopping. To achieve this goal she is requesting a loan of $500 dollars, money that she will invest in the improvement of her business. That way she will make more money and will be able to save enough to finish with the construction of her house. She wants to give her small children a comfortable and safe place to live. Hitala promises to repay the loan in six months. With our help Hitala’s desire to provide the best for her and her family will come true.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Hítala de 38 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años, se dedicó a trabajar desde muy joven; fruto del esfuerzo y trabajo de muchos años llegó a tener una gran tienda de venta de prendas de vestir pero desafortunadamente sufrió un robo que la dejó a ella y sus hijos en completo desamparo, porque su negocio era el único ingreso económico con el que contaba su familia. Ahora después de empezar de nuevo y con mucha más fuerza ya cuenta con una pequeña tienda para la venta de golosinas ubicado en las instalaciones de la escuela a la que asisten sus hijas menores. El deseo de Hítala es ampliar su pequeña pero rentable tiendecita, con el deseo de brindarles mayor comodidad a sus pequeños clientes Y para llevar a cabo este propósito solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares; dinero que invertirá en ampliar su negocio de esta manera podrá ahorrar lo suficiente para culminar con la construcción de su casa y ofrecerles un lugar cómodo y seguro a sus pequeños hijos, ella promete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 mesesCon nuestra ayuda Hítala podrá hacer realidad todos y cada uno de sus anhelos en bienestar de su familia

loans.use:
Wants the loan to increase and improve the variety of products her store
offers in order to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Eunice Besaida

texts.en: Eunice is fifty-seven years old and a mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are above the age of thirty.  Since the death of her husband two years ago, Eunice has supported herself by selling a variety of domestic products to other women in her small community in the Dominican Republic’s San Cristobal province.  Currently, Eunice sells shampoo, perfume, hair care, and hygiene items but she hopes that she can expand her inventory to include women’s slippers and other clothing items after receiving her loan.  She explains that, “with God’s blessing,” the new items will help expand her business and attract new customers.

loans.use: To add women's slippers and other clothing items to inventory of beauty and personal care products

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai H., aged 50, grows rice on a plot of land and earns about $1 a day selling her crops at the local market.  A widow, she supports her four children with this business.  Two of her children are students, while the other two are employed at a garment factory and make about $70 each a month.  She would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase more seeds to increase crop yields.  In the future she would like to reinvest the additional earnings generated by this loan  back into her business and purchase a hand-tractor to increase the efficiency of her rice cultivation.  She plans to use the increased income to help fund her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to increase crop yields.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Do Thi D., 58 years old, has been member of TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 2003. 3 out of her 4 children had moved out, so Mrs. D. now lives with her husband and her youngest child in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam. Her job is to sell bamboo baskets. Each month she earns 80USD. Sometimes she makes baskets, too. Besides, she breeds a couple of pigs. After discussing with her husband, Mrs. D. would like to borrow 375USD to stock more baskets for the coming season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Đào, 58 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. 3 người con đầu đều đã trưởng thành, chị sống cùng với chồng và người con út tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Công việc hiện tại của chị Đào là buôn thúng, mang lại thu nhập hàng tháng là 80USD. Những lúc rãnh rỗi chị cũng tự đan thúng để bán, ngoài ra chị còn nuôi thêm vài con lợn. Vay vốn để buôn bán phải tính toán, lựa chọn thời điểm phù hợp thì mới có lợi nhuận cao. Vì vậy chị Đào đã bàn bạc với chồng xin vay mức vốn 375USD để mua thúng dự trữ đến thời điểm mùa vụ sẽ bán ra.

loans.use: Buy bamboo basket

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is 43 years old, married with 5 children, and hails from Iba Area in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has been in the business of selling drugs, provisions and cosmetics since 1998. She needs a loan of $775 to buy more drugs and cosmetics for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drugs, provisions and cosmetics

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam M. is a 53-year-old hardworking mother of five and a resident of Yombo, where she runs a shop. She has been with Youth Self Employment Foundation for the past six years. Her shop sells various items, including food products and other household items. The profits from her business have helped send all her children to school. In addition, she has been able to build herself a house, and she now takes care of her grandchildren. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Ms Martina and her husband Gregorio's small and humble home is located more than 3904 meters above sea level in the district of Umachiri. They built their home more than 11 years ago. As a consequence of their love, they care for three enchanting children who are the reason for their efforts in their daily labor.

At the moment Gregorio and his family live in his aging parents' home. It is his responsibility to provide for his parents' well-being and tranquility in the last years of their lives. Gregorio and his hard-working wife have always dedicated themselves to raising livestock, and with the profits that they have obtained they are providing their children with an education. In order to increase their economic revenue they intend to genetically invigorate their cows by artificially inseminating them. This will improve the production of milk.

Your indispensable contribution will help this family realize its wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

A más de 3904 msnm (metros sobre el nivel del mar), exactamente en el distrito de Umachiri está ubicado la pequeña y humilde vivienda de doña Martina y su esposo Gregorio, ambos formaron su hogar hace más de 11 años, fruto de su amor albergan a 3 encantadores niños, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo y constancia diaria en su labor. Actualmente don Gregorio y su familia viven en la casa de sus ancianos padres, a quienes también tratan de ofrecerles bienestar y tranquilidad en los últimos años de sus vidas, Gregorio y su laboriosa esposa siempre se dedicaron a la producción de ganado y con las ganancias que han ido obteniendo están brindándoles educación a sus menores hijos; ahora para aumentar aún más sus ingresos económicos pretenden mejorar genéticamente su ganado vacuno mediante la inseminación artificial y de esta manera mejorar la producción y productividad de leche. Tu indispensable aporte concretará los anhelos de esta familia. La fotografía nos muestra a su trabajadora mujer y no ha Gregorio por su incursión en la feria de su ciudad para la venta de algunos de sus ejemplares.

loans.use: Invest capital to increase productivity of livestock

loans.name: La Fuerza Divina Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a lively and energetic young woman who lives with her husband and three children (aged 16, 14, and 12 years) in the rural farming town of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. For a few years now she has run a small business selling clothes and shoes, but she says that often she lacks the necessary capital to buy as much merchandise as she would like. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase a larger variety and greater quantity of clothes and shoes.

Rosa say she dreams of seeing her children go to college so that they can enter a profession and enjoy a more comfortable life than she has been able to. She hopes that with the extra income this loan will allow her to generate she can save money and buy her own house; in the Dominican Republic those who can buy the title to their own land and house are viewed with great respect.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Rosa and her entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy used and new clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Xavier Francisco

texts.pt:
Xavier is 33 years old and was born in the town of Matola (Province of Maputo). He is married and the father of 5 children, 2 girls and 3 boys. The oldest is a 15 year old girl and the youngest is 2. The first four are already in school. His parents also live with him in his house.

In 1984 Xavier moved to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, because his father was transferred with his job. Xavier attended school until the 11th grade, and afterwards completed a course for assistant customs officer that lasted only 6 months. He worked in customs as a first category assistant customs officer and earned a monthly salary of 3,500MTn working from 7am to 8pm except on weekends.

Since his salary was not sufficient to sustain his family, Xavier decided to open a stand off his house where he could sell various products. Ones that stand out are rice that he buys for 14MTn and sells for 17.5MTn and drinks (beer that he buys for 21MTn and sells for 25MTn, and wine that he buys for 50MTn and sells for 85MTn.)

Xavier has a monthly income of approximately 2,500MTn and he saves a maximum of 1,000MTn. This is the second loan that he has taken from Hluvuku and the first from Kiva. The first was for 15,000MTn and was used to begin his selling activities. Xavier was able to pay it off early and returned to solicit this loan that will also to be used for growing his inventory and increasing his sales.

He has a dream to continue with his studies and in the first phase conclude with the middle level. Only with a higher level can he climb in his career and one day become a customs delegate.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Xavier tem 33 anos de idade e nasceu na vila da Matola (Província de Maputo). Xavier é casado e pai de 5 filhos, sendo duas meninas e três rapazes. A maior é uma menina de 15 anos e o mais novo tem 2 anos. Os quatros primeiros já vão a escola. Em sua casa vivem também os seus pais. Em 1984 Xavier mudou-se para Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilandia porque seu pai foi transferido no trabalho. Xavier estudou ate a 11a classe, e depois fez um curso de auxiliar aduaneiro nas alfândegas que durou apenas 6 meses. Xavier trabalha nas alfândegas como auxiliar aduaneiro de primeira categoria e aufere um salário mensal de MTn 3,500, trabalhando das 7:00h as 20:00h excepto nos finais de semana. Como o salário não era suficiente para sustentar sua família, Xavier decidiu abrir uma barra no recinto da casa onde vende produtos diversos da primeira necessidade. Destaca-se o arroz ngonhama que compra por MTn 14 e vende por MTn 17.50 e as bebidas (cervejas, que compra por MTn 21 e vende por MTn 25, e vinhos, que compra por MTn 50 e vende por MTn 85). Xavier tem um rendimento liquido mensal de aproximadamente MTn 2,500 e poupa deste no máximo MTn 1,000. Este é o segundo empréstimo de Xavier na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro foi de MTn 15,000 e foi usado para iniciar as atividades de vendas. Xavier conseguiu pagar antes do tempo e voltou a solicitar este que também destina o para ampliar o estoque e aumentar suas vendas. Tem como sonho continuar com os estudos e numa primeira fase concluir o nível médio. Somente com nível superior Xavier poderá subir em sua carreira e um dia se tornar delegado alfandegário.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to sell in his store

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
P. Guldasta is 47 years old. She is married with four children. Seven years ago, Guldasta began a business so she could cover her household expenses, because her husband´s salary was not enough. She decided to start a business selling children’s trousers. As time went by, P. found that selling women’s trousers yielded a larger income. Considering that the national trousers is a very important item for most women and girls of Tajikistan, Guldasta’s business is stable and successful, allowing her to contribute considerably to her family’s income. Currently, Guldasta’s goods are in high demand. She would like to take a chance and increase her inventory. A loan of $1000 would greatly improve her stock of clothes, and allow her to expand her customer base.

The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of her business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing the national trousers for women and girls in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Slobodanka

texts.en:
Slobodanka is a woman from the town of Doboj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married with one child. Her husband found a full-time job in Slovenia, while Slobodanka farms at home, mainly growing fruits and vegetables.

This is Slobodanka's first loan from ZŽene za ŽZene, which she has requested in the amount of 1500 KM (US$1150). She will use some of the money to buy pesticide to protect the fruits and vegetables she is currently growing. She will use the rest to buy more fruits and vegetables from a wholesaler. Slobodanka plans to resell this food in town and hopes that this income will help her meet expenses until the rest of her crops are ready to be harvested and sold.

loans.use: To by pesticide and more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Baji is the wife of S. M. and lives in an area named Walton, of city Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 28 years. She is the mother of one son and his name is Javed. Javed is married and has one son. Bashiran Baji's husband has a food business. Bashiran Baji also has a business of selling rice. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, rice, lentils and spices) for her husband's food business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat Baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Shamim Baji wants a loan to buy shoes to resell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy electric colored lights for her lighte decorater business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils for food business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine O. is 50 years old and a widow with 12 children. She takes care of her children alone although her two eldest daughters who are working assist her as much as they can. Her youngest child is 11 years old and he is in a public secondary school in Lagos state. Catherine sells provisions like toothpaste, hair cream, and detergent retail. She has been in this business since 2006. However, she is also a cake designer and often gets contracts to bake cakes for people during social engagements. She is a LAPO client and is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is married with a daughter, Aida. He lives with his family and his elderly mother in Kherson, in the south of Ukraine. Marat sells sports footwear in the central city market. He is very disciplined and likes to do things in an orderly and accurate fashion. These characteristics have helped him to stay afloat for 10 years in a row. Marat has 17,000 Grivnas invested in his business. He is getting about 8,000 Grivnas in income each month.

Marat knows how to manage his business and create favorable conditions for his customers. His successful operations are a direct result of availability of lending services through Nadiya Ukraine. Marat has taken and paid back 14 loans without any problems. This time he is seeking a 3600 Grivna loan to increase the assortment of inventory in his kiosk.

Note: this is a short-term, seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of his inventory

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mr. Sarom S., 39, is a local farmer who specializes in rice crop as well as vegetables. He lives in Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. His wife, Mrs. Solin Yann, is 40 years old and makes a living breeding pigs from her home. She cares for four children, all of whom attend school. Recently, Solin sold all her pigs to a slaughterer, emptying her pen. She needs more piglets to raise again. Hence, she talked with her husband about requesting a loan of $800 to buy piglets and a motorcycle to make transportation easier.(Mr. Sarom's wife is pictured because he was not available)

loans.use: To buy more piglets and a motorcycle

loans.name: Sodjedo

texts.fr:
Monsieur V.  est âgée de trente huit ans (38) et habite dans le quartier d’agoè nyévé,
Il a pour activité la soudure qu’il exerce depuis 2003, ce métier lui réussit bien parce qu’au Togo beaucoup de matériaux sont fabriqués en fer. Il n’a jamais fait de prêt à WAGES et demande ce prêt pour s’approvisionner avec des barres de fer.
Monsieur V.  est marié et à quatre personnes à charge (04).
texts.en:
Mr. V., 38, lives in the Agoè Nyévé neighborhood. Since 2003, he has been in the welding business, in which he is doing well because in Togo, lots of things are made out of iron. He has never received a loan from WAGES and is asking for this one so as to stock up on iron bars.

Mr. V. is married and supports four persons.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tools etc. for his welding

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S., 51, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She raises pigs and together with her husband, she is a farmer growing rice. This couple earns a combined income of around US$ 6 a day.

Sun S., pictured here, has two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other one is a student. She would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, rice seed and a water pump in case her farm has difficulty with water.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticide, and a pump

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: P., 24, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She runs a small stall behind her house where she raises ducks to lay eggs for sale. She also sells fish in the local market, and she can earn an income of approximately $3 a day. She currently cares for two children. Both of them attend school. She is married to Kol, 34, who is a local fisherman. She usually gets her fish to sell from her husband's fishing and she sells them for a profit. P. is asking for a loan in order to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. She will use it to transport the fish to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba Z. is 40 years old. She is married with two children. Matluba has a tailoring business. Her business is sewing traditional women's dresses. Her workmanship is very good and being still young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. She has had this business for 22 years and has gained a lot of experience.

With her loan, Matluba will buy more material for sewing dresses. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing traditional dresses.

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: El joven Norlan tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, el se desempeña como cadete de taxi desde hace  cuatro años, recorre día a día en la ciudad para abordar a clientes. El es soltero y sus deseos es poder mejorar su casa. Con unos ahorros le compro el taxi a su hermano y ahora ve las ganancias. Con esta solicitud de crédito desea reparar la dirección y la caja del carro para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es poder comprar otra unidad de taxi, poder tener una casa propia para cuando tenga su familia.
texts.en:
Young Norlan is 28 years old. He lives in Villa Venezuela in the city of Managua. He has worked as a taxi driver for four years. He travels the city day after day to serve his customers. He is single and his wishes are to improve his home. With some savings, he bought a taxi for his brother and now sees the profits. With this loan he hopes to repair the steering and car battery to give good service to his customers. His plans for the future are to buy another taxi unit and be able to have his own home for when he has a family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a car battery and repair the steering in his taxi

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La señora Gloria tiene 52 años de edad, reside en el barrio 14 de Febrero de la Iglesia Fraternidad 2 c al este 1 c al norte en la ciudad de Managua, con 4 hijos todo mayores e independiente. Su esposo vende productos lácteos, y su negocio es una pulpería que la inicio con ahorros que tenia. Lleva nueve años de estar administrando y tres ciclo de préstamos en Afodenic el cual ha podido mantener un inventario variado, el cual ha generado clientela ya que ha podido cubrir las necesidades del cliente y las de su familia que considera de muchos beneficios para el desarrollo de su negocio. Con esta solicitud quiere compra granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosa y comprar productos de sardinas para esta temporada de la semana santa ya que la gente la consume mucho. Sus planes es poder es poder apoyar a sus hijos y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and lives in the 14th of February neighborhood, north of the city of Managua. She has 4 children who are now grown and independent. Her husband sells dairy products, and her business is a grocery store that she started with some of her savings. She has been managing her store for nine years, and has been through three loan cycles with Afodenic. The loans have helped her to maintain a varied inventory supply in her store, which has generated customers since she has been able to meet their demands. She has also been able to meet the needs of her family, which considers the loans to be very beneficial toward her efforts to grow her business. With this request she would like to buy basic grains, sweets/snacks, sodas, as well as sardine products that are in high demand during this season of Holy Week. Her plans include being able to support her children and improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, sardines, and canned products.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.fr: Weloli E. vend de l’eau purifiée dans son quartier qui est située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle aime son activité qu’elle a commencée à exercer depuis 2001. Son affaire a beaucoup soutenu financièrement son foyer  surtout à payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants quand son mari a perdu son travail en 2003. Le nombre de clients de Weloli ne cesse d’augmenter à cause de ses bons services qui leur offre. C’est pourquoi le crédit qu’elle a obtenu lui a permit d’acheter une grande quantité d’eau pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients. Weloli a aussi diversifié son affaire en achetant des emballages en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Dans le but de lutter contre les maladies causées par l’eau non potable, son ambition est de construire une petite usine de fabrication d’eau purifiée afin de desservir la population de son milieu qui en a grandement besoin. Elle a 37 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants âgés de 9 à 15 ans qui vont tous à l’école.
texts.en:
Weloli E. sells purified water in her district, which is located west of Kinshasa. She likes her business, which she started in 2001. It has financially supported her household, especially in paying the schooling costs for the children when her husband lost his job in 2003. The number of customers that she has is growing continuously due to the good service she provides them. This is the reason behind the obtained loan, which enabled her to buy a large quantity of water to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Weloli has also diversified her business by buying packaging material in order to grow her revenues. In the goal of fighting against illnesses caused by non-potable water, her ambition is to build a small factory to produce purified water, so as to serve the people of her area, which is in heavy need of it.

Weloli is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children, ages 9 to 15, who all go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of purified water… and also packaging

loans.name: Annabe

texts.en:
Annabe Y. is 31 years old. She is married and living happily with her three children. Her husband is into farming where cassava, corn and banana are their primary products.

Annabe has had her variety store for almost a year. She wants to gain more profit from her business to support her children’s needs (education, food and clothing). In this connection, she needs additional money to procure additional items to add to her inventory and generate a much higher income.

Annabe is working on her loan proposal to HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She is positive enough to think that her business will improve with the help granted by the organization.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her variety store

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 2 años decidió abrir un hotel, donde brinda el servicio de hospedaje a personas que no son de su localidad, ella atiende durante las mañanas y en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su esposo, cuando tiene días libres en su trabajo. Este negocio le permite solventar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos, además de otros gastos familiares. El mes de junio se inicia la temporada alta en su región, ya que se acercan los feriados por fiestas patrias, por lo que Yanina quiere mejorar los ambientes de su hotel para recibir a los turistas. Esta es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue muy bien informada acerca de la dinámica del trabajo en su banco comunal, por su parte, se compromete a trabajando por el bienestar de todos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de camas y colchones para amoblar otras habitaciones de su hospedaje.
texts.en:
Yanina, 36, lives with her husband and two children in her own house. Two years ago she decided to open a hotel where she offers hospitality services to people who are not from her area. She takes care of the hotel in the mornings. Sometimes her husband helps her when he has days off from work. This business allows her to pay the educational costs of her children, and it covers other family expenses. The month of June starts high season in her region. The National Holidays are getting close, and Yanina wants to improve the hotel’s environment for the coming tourists. This is her first loan with MFP. She was very well informed about the work dynamic in her community bank. She promises to work for the well being of all. The loan is to buy beds and mattresses to furnish other rooms in her hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beds and mattresses for her hotel

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn T. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 35 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling gasoline in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering and to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y la menor de sus hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde brinda la atención a los clientes junto a su hija.
