Anteriormente arrendaba locales para su negocio, pero hace 2 años se instaló definitivamente en su casa y sus clientes se mantienen estables por la buena atención que brinda, lo cual le satisface porque obtiene las ganancias esperadas. Para más adelante, Marlene desea implementar su tienda con otros productos no comestibles, como útiles de escritorio, productos de limpieza, etc. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy responsable que cumple puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería y al mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su tienda.
texts.en:
Marlene is 39 years old, and lives with her husband and their youngest daughter in their own home. For the past 17 years, Marlene has had a food store where she and her daughter attend to clients. In the past Marlene rented space for her business, however 2 years ago she moved her business to her home. She keeps a stable client base thanks to her good customer service, which allows her to count on a stable income. For the future, Marlene plans to put more nonperishable merchandise in her store, such as office supplies, cleaning products, etc. This is the 6th time she is taking out a loan with MFP, and is a responsible client who always pays her installments on time. The loan funds will be used to purchase merchandise and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Earn

texts.en: Earn Y. is 42 years old and is married. She has lived with with other family members in a medium-sized wooden house in the Siem Reap Province for years. She earns a living selling fresh fish in the local market and in her village as well. She gets her fish from her husband’s fishing from Tunle Sap River, as well as from other fishermen. Earn Y. complains that she finds it hard to transport fish because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. She has always hired a neighbor’s taxi at a steep rate to transport her goods. She hopes to reduce this cost by using this loan from Kiva to buy a motorcycle which she will use for her needs. Earn Y. has six children, two of whom are employed in different jobs. She and her husband are pictured above.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel C. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar de las útiles escolares y el pago de la colegiatura ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero que le están pidiendo para que pueda inscribir a sus hijos en la escuela.
Don Juan Manuel es empleado de una Agencia Aduanal en el departamento de despachador y su esposa la señora Marcela Zamarrón se dedica a la limpieza de casa particulares. Estos son los ingresos que tiene para darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que puedan tener un buen estudio. Con una parte de los ingresos del señor Juan Manuel pagaran el préstamo. 
Cuando fuimos a visitar la casa de señor Juan Manuel el se encontraba en su trabaja, y su esposa también andaba en su empleo, y quien son atendió fue uno de sus hijos que es la persona que aparece en la foto
texts.en:
Juan Manuel C. has two children who are currently in school. He is asking for a loan to buy school supplies and pay school fees. He currently does not have the money that they are asking for to enroll his two children in school. Juan Manual works for the Customs Agency in the dispatch department. His wife, Marcela Zamarrón, cleans private homes. These are the incomes he has to give his children the best so they can have a good education. Juan Manuel will use part of the income to repay the loan. When the agency went to visit Juan Manuel’s house, he was working. His wife was also working. One of his sons was available, and he is the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and pay school fees

loans.name: Marlene De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Marlene de la Cruz E. , tiene la edad de 46 años , habita en el barrio las enramadas , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen cuatro hijos , dos  ya independientes y dos a su cargo los cuales estudian ,le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Marlene desde hace 21 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y mejorar su producción. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para hacer posible este mejoramiento.
texts.en:
Mrs Marlene de la Cruz E., 46 years old, lives in the neighbourhood of Las Enramadas together with her husband who helps her with home expenses. They have four children, two already independent and two that they look after who study and help her with agricultural activities and in the home. The family's plan is to improve their living conditions. Since the age of 21, Marlene has dedicated herself to agricultural work, however the most difficult part has been the lack of financing, so her future plan is to diversify her crops. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and supplies and improve her production. She gives thanks to Kiva for the support that makes this improvement possible.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to improve cultivation

loans.name: Tnaomat B1 Group

texts.en:
Sem T. is a 45-year-old farmer who is the leader for a group of 7 people – Tnaomat B1.  Sem lives in Naiotel, Taebenu Sub District- Kupang District. It is situated about 30 km from and takes about three hours from Kupang City by motorbike. The road to the village is bumpy and has not been asphalted; it is still stony so it is hard for public transport such as minivans to enter the village. In order to reach the village, people usually use motorbikes or trucks. Naiotel is a remote village; there are no local markets or education and health facilities available in this village. If a family member is sick then they bring him/her to the local clinic which is situated about 5 km from their village.    

Only 40 households live in Naiotel Village. Most people in the village have backgrounds as farmers but they usually face difficulty in the dry season as the weather is hot and they have to fetch water from the river which is about 1 km from their houses. 

In the rainy season, the community is keen to cultivate vegetables, peanuts, corn and produce coconut oil. They usually sell the agricultural produce in Tunbaun Market (about 22 km from the village) and Oeba Market in Kupang City (about 30 km). They take motorcycle taxis to bring their produce to the market. It costs IDR 30,000 per return trip. In the dry season they can not sell the produce as the farm is dry; they can not plant vegetables, peanuts and corn. In order to finance the family's daily needs, the community usually digs manganese every day to be sold. The price is IDR 1,100/kg.

Sem is a married man and a father of 6 children. The children live with him and his wife. They are:

-	Marni, who only graduated from elementary school. She could not continue to high school as Sem was unable to finance her education.
-	Jermi in the Second Grade of Senior High School, Sem’s brother helped Jermi so he could continue to High School.
-	Yanti in the Second Grade of Junior High School
-	Yeti in the Third Grade of Elementary School
-	Yona is 3 years old, not at school yet.
-	Dina is 1 year old, not at school yet.       

Sem realizes that he has to find another option to improve his family's life so that he is able to meet his children's education fees and their daily needs. He heard about TLM's cattle fattening program from the field officer. He is interested in joining the program. Together with other farmers who are also interested in joining the program, they formed a group in order to receive loans to buy cattle to be fattened over 12 month period.  Sem is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,400,000 from TLM to buy young cattle. The other group members of Tnaomat B1 are also requesting a loan to buy young cattle. All of them hope to have improvement in their lives through the loan.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is fifty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Hannah is a business woman. She prepares and sells palm oil. Hannah supplies to retailers and also treks to nearby communities to sell her goods. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits

loans.name: Mungai

texts.en:
Mungai is 39 yrs old and is married to Loise, who is 34 yrs old. They are blessed with two sons and two daughters. He was introduced to Kadet by an existing member of Kadet. He is applying for his 2nd loan.

Mungai does horticultural farming and sells horticultural products to Kenya Horticultural Exporters. He also supplies green kale to the local community. He intends to expand his farm with the extra profit that earns from this loan. His future dream is to own a big farming corporation.

He describes himself as a good Christian, a hardworking man, a farmer, and a successful businessman.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as seedling, to sell to Kenya Horticultural Exporters

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un E. is a villager in Krang Ta Yang village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old and a widow with 4 children, two of whom are construction workers while the others attend the local school.

Mrs. Un E. is a grocer and now she wants to expand.

Thus she has decided to request a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to earn more profits.

She hopes to improve her business and provide a better living for her children.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Sukortaity Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Sukortaity group, who are all businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will expand their businesses to earn more sales in improve their profit margin. Consequently, their standard of living will improve. In this way, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children in terms of feeding, clothing, education, and medical needs.

The leader of this group is Aminata K. who is second from right. Aminata is approximately twenty-one years of age; she was born in a village call Banki, about eight miles from Magburaka town. Aminata is single with one child who is not of school going age.  Aminata sells fish and has been in this business for five years now. She will invest this loan into her fish business by buying cartons of quality fish. She usually buys her fish in Freetown or Makeni and sells in Magburaka town.

loans.use: To buy cartons of quality fish.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mr. Meas N. is 36 years of age and resides in a small home located along the river. Here, he and his wife earn their daily income by fishing around Tunle Sap Lake. This couple is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. Meas N. needs a loan to buy more fishing implements which will allow him use to catch a larger amount of fish.

loans.use: To buy more fishing implements

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guisiliban Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Evangeline is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business buying and selling green bananas and coconut in the local market. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es: Filomeno tiene 49 años y junto a él vive con sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace mas de 5 años decidió vender autos usados, adquiridos por amistades que  desean vender sus carros y cada venta que realiza obtiene una comisión, y con dicho capital compra carros usados y luego venderlos. De esta manera se dedica a este trabajo en sus tiempos libres, ya que su profesión es de docente de grado primario. Lo que más desea Filomeno es tener más capital de trabajo para poder comprar más carros. Este es su primer crédito con MFP,  por lo que esta muy ilusionado de concretar sus objetivos y pueda dar bienestar a sus hijos ya que su esposa viajo al exterior. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un carro usado para venderlo a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Filomeno is 49 years old, and he lives with his children in a rented house. More than five years ago, he decided to start selling used cars, which he acquires from friends who want to sell their cars. He earns a commission on each sale, and with this capital, he purchases more used cars to sell. He dedicates himself to this work in his spare time, since his main profession is teaching primary school. What Filomeno desires most is to acquire more working capital in order to buy more cars. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very enthusiastic about reaching his goals so that he can provide for his children's well-being, since his wife has gone abroad. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy a used car in order to sell it for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a used car to repair and sell

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: K. Robinah is a successful businesswoman. She is thirty-five years old and married with one child. She owns a textile boutique. She has run this business for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase textiles from Zaire, Kenya and within Uganda in order to increase her business stock. Her future plan is to set up another shop.

loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de  San Martin y  Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda tiene 63 años y 04 hijos, todos independientes. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Trinidad, es una mujer perseverante y luchadora que siempre le gusto trabajar,  lleva 06 años dedicándose a la venta de dulces  como: Mazamorra de maíz morado, arroz con leche y flan, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos diarios, decidió implementarse más en el negocio, sus ventas los realiza en la tardes en las afueras de su casa a partir de las 3.00 Pm.
Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, maíz morado en kilos, azúcar y algunos utensilios que le sirvierón para iniciarse en el negocio, nos cuenta que le va  excelente  porque  tiene muy buena acogida por el rico sabor de sus dulces. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes, para dar un rico sabor, en cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Trinidad, se siente aun con muchas fuerzas de seguir trabajando. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños anhelados, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Trinidad belongs to the Communal Bank “María Auxiliadora”, District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin and Departament of San Martín. She is a widow, 63 years old and has four children, all independent. She has a high school education. Trinidad is a woman who perserveres and fights and who has always liked to work. She has spent 6 years selling sweets such as: blue corn pudding, rice pudding and flan. Since she saw it was generating good daily income, she decided to dedicate herself more to the business. She sells in the afternoon outside of her house starting at 3:00. p.m. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she bought kilos of blue corn, sugar and some utensils which she used to start the business. She tells us that it is going excellently for her because she has a good clientele because of the delicious taste of her sweets. Presently, she continues with the same business. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy ingredients to prepare her sweets such as: blue corn, rice and kilos of sugar, apples and pineapples, ground cinnamon, and other ingredientes to give a good flavor. In regards to utensils, she will buy glasses and little plastic spoons. Trinidad still feels a lot of strength to continue working. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping to acheive the dreams she has longed for, for her and for other women who want to grow and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients for the preparation of her sweets.

loans.name: Paullina

texts.en:
Paullina sells foodstuffs like dried peppers, melons, palm oil, groundnut oil, tomato paste, and more at one of the local markets in Benin City, Nigeria. She runs this business to make sure there is food on her table and to take care of other financial needs at home like payment of the children's school fees, buying of school books for her children, etc. She has been able to support her family and play a vital role in the family and that gives her joy in running the business. 

Paullina hopes to save part of her income to purchase a plot of land where she can build a house and rent it out, as this will also serve as another income-generating source as the business improves. 

She is a member of LAPO Microfinance; she hopes to expand the size of her business in future. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Paullina is 45 years old, married with 5 children, and they are doing well. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ileana Maria M., tiene la edad de 45 años, vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino, es casada su esposo es electrisista y le apoya en los gastos que se incurran en el hogar, la familia tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 14 y 15 años, ambas mujeres que estan estudiando la escuela secundaria. 

Ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de cosméticos y dentro de sus principales planes que tiene para el futuro esta la apertura de una tienda con enfoque femenino, pero dentro de los problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, esta la falta de financiamiento o de fluides en sus utilidades, debido a que ha tenido clientes que no le cancelan sus pedidos, pero continuara trabajando con nuevos clientes bajo nuevas condiciones de pago, para evitar la morosidad de los mismos, ella solicita de un prestamo para la compra de cósmeticos y que esta inversión le ayude a la ampliación de su negocio y ha mejores condiciones económicas que le favorezcan para nuevos proyectos de vida a la familia.

Ella es una mujer responsable y tienen  muchas amistades, que ratifican la buena fé de la señora M..
texts.en:
Ileana Maria M., 45, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood.  Her husband is an electrician and he helps her with household expenses.  They have two daughters, who are 14 and 15 years of age, both of whom are in secondary school.

For the last 10 years she has sold cosmetics and, among her plans for the future, is opening a store with a feminine focus.  However, a challenge she faces is the lack of available financing or cash flow because some of the customers haven’t paid for their orders.

However, she will continue to work with new customers under revised payment plans so that she can avoid having payment defaults.

She is asking for funding to buy cosmetics so that she can enlarge her business thereby producing better economic conditions that will be favorable for her new family projects.

She is a responsible woman, who has many acquaintances, all of whom attest to her good character.


[[[Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer]]]

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hah V., 45, (husband pictured) sews clothes in the garment industry.  She can earn a salary of $100 or $120 and this helps to met her family’s daily expenses. She also relies on the income from her husband who drives a motorcycle taxi around the capital of Phnom Penh. 

They have three teenage children.  One of them is jobless and other two are employed.  Hak hopes to encourage her unemployed child to get a job, but she has no cash to start a business.  So, Hak is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy clothes and beauty salon accessories for her child to sell.

loans.use: Buy clothes and beauty salon accessories for her child to sell.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed A. R. is an energetic woman who makes and sells parandas (ornaments used by women to tie-up their hair) at her home. She has five years of experience in this business and now she has become expert in it she can make different kinds of parandas such as simple and heavy-beaded.

Khursheed has no other source of income. She sells mainly to neighbors. She owns a two-room house and has been living in it for over twenty-five years.

With the Pak Rs. 35,000 loan Khursheed is requesting, she wants to buy thread and beads in bulk. She decided to work with Asasah because she liked its policies and loan terms. Her aspiration is to make her business famous. She describes herself as hardworking and independent.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more parandas

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 52 años, la comparte su vida con sus dos  hijas: Julia y Fanny de 24 y 20 años respectivamente. Todas ellas viven juntas en su casa propia. Hace más de 9 años instaló su propia guardería para niños, llamado “suspiritos”, lo cual ha significado su principal fuente de ingreso. Desde entonces, su actividad empieza, desde muy temprano decepcionando a las madres que dejan a sus hijos al cuidado de Felicita, ella durante el día educa a estos infantes hasta la hora en que llegan sus madres a recogerlo. Su mayor es poder ofrecerles a los niños mejor comodidad además de juegos para que su tiempo en la guardería sea de mucho provecho, estimulando su aprendizaje. En ocasiones su hija la ayuda en esta labor, es por ello que se esta forjando como profesora de educación inicial, por lo tanto Felicita se siente muy bien asesorada por su hija. Por lo pronto desea ampliar su guardería, para que sea lo más confortable para los pequeños. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar gras artificial para su jardín así como comprar juegos como columpios y toboganes.
texts.en:
Felicita, age 52, shares her life with her two daughters. Julia is 24, and Fanny is 20. They all work together in her own house. Over nine years ago she set up her own childcare center called Susperitos. This has been her main source of income. She starts very early taking care of the children that the mothers leave in Felicita’s care. During the day she educates the children until the time when their mothers arrive to pick them up. Her biggest desire is to make the children more comfortable. She also wants to provide them with more games so that their time in childcare is very beneficial and will stimulate their learning. At times her daughter helps her with this work. That is why she is learning to be an early childhood education teacher. Felicita feels very well advised by her daughter. Soon she wants to expand her childcare so that the little ones will be more comfortable. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments. She wishes to use the loan to buy artificial grass for her nursery school. She also wants to buy games like swings and slides.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy articial grass, games, and swings for the children

loans.name: Kostyantin

texts.en:
Konstantin is married, has two children, and owns a shoe store at Jubilee Market in the town of Zaporozhye. He started this business eight years ago, and his outstanding collection of goods and excellent customer service have made his store a success. He is delighted with the outcome of his work because he enjoys selling shoes very much. 

Konstantin has applied for a loan for 15,000 UAH to buy new seasonal inventories. He goals are to develop this business further and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a new supply of shoes to sell to his customers

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert A. is from the village of Anquiray, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 30 years old. Gilbert is married. To make a living, Gilbert owns & operates a business providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Gilbert has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Gilbert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Gilbert is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Gilbert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn and manioc

loans.name: Talino

texts.en:
Talino D. V. is from the village of  Balbagon Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 36 years old. Talino is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Talino owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services used to transport local community members. Talino has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Talino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Talino is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Talino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es: La Señorita Julia C. tiene con 29 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios , Artesana “Confección de delantales típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Máquinas, habita junto a su Mamá conjuntamente, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados  para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de Confeccionar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit, la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Julia C. is 29, single, and a craftswoman who makes traditional women's aprons. She has a workshop with 2 machines and lives with her mother. They do the same work and have two employees. For 6 years she has made aprons in her residence in Caserio Xetinimit. Her customers' demand has grown, but the economic conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient for her to increase her working capital. For this reason she went to Asociacion ASDIR, to request a loan with the intention of buying basic supplies. This way she will increase her sales, with the hope of getting her family ahead and to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma N. is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 31 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Vilma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.-

loans.use: To puchase more feeds to expand her business

loans.name: Sa Vang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Vang E., 53, was selected as the leader of this group loan by its four members, who are located in Khpob Veng village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portiO. of the loan to support their different purposes.   

Mrs. Sa Vang E. is a grocery seller and also a vegetable seller in the local market. With this business, she is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mok Yong, stays at home and takes care their children. In order to support her grocery business, Mrs. Sa Vang E. will use the loan requested from AMK to buy more groceries to sell. This couple has five children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a wedding chef, while the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Musuq Rumi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva piedra en quechua inicia el ciclo 20 con 19 socias.
Como es el caso D. L. señora Esperanza que es socia hace algunos años y actualmente es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal, Esperanza fue presidenta en 3 oportunidades, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian.
Esperanza venD. leña en su casa, negocio que realiza todos los días, L. leña lo compra D. los productores..
Esperanza solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles para L. compra D. leña.
Esperanza sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante estudiando una profesión.
texts.en:
The Musuq Rumi, which means New Stone in Quechua, communal bank is starting its 20th cycle with 19 members. Esperanza has been a member for several years and now is the group President. She has been President on three occasions. She’s married and has three children who are in school. Esperanza sells firewood at home every day; she buys the firewood from producers. She is asking for a 400 sol loan to buy firewood. Esperanza dreams that her children get ahead studying a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Mrs. Lach K. is a rattan cupboard producer who is a 45-year-old, married mother caring for three kids, while another two of her children are already married and live away from home. 

Lach K. and her husband have had a small rattan cupboard investment, since early 2005. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes them to sell directly at their client’s house. They always get outside of their house to sell their products around their community. 

Recently, Lach K. got orders for rattan from her customer but her stock is not enough to serve them. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Lach K. seeks a loan to stock a larger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.use: To stock a bigger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Helen is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old, married, and blessed with a 2-year-old child.  He does welding to earn a living.  

He was previously employed before he went into the business.  He has been running the business for six years with one employee.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a savings culture.  He hopes to open a welding firm in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to add stock of raw material such as metals, and to buy another welding machine.

loans.use: To add stock of raw material such as metals and to buy another welding machine.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 25 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Verónica tiene un pequeño consultorio dental. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

 Verónica desprende una imagen de una joven trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Verónica espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital de negocio y desea comprar material dental y otras cosas más. 

Verónica pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Verónica is 25 years old, she is single and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town. Verónica runs a small dental office. She has been engaging in this activity for many years, and it works very well for her thanks to her determination in doing her job.

Véronica is the very image of a hard-working and responsible young woman. With her next loan of 800 PEN, Véronica would like to increase her working capital and to buy dental materials and other items.

Verónica is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and she is thankful for the opportunity she is being given through this loan; at the same time she commits to complying with her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and to buy dental materials and other items.

loans.name: Henry Ngugi

texts.en:
Henry is 25 years old and married to Irene, who runs another business. He has been selling clothes for the past five years with an income of 10,000 Kenya shillings.

He is taking the second loan with KADET after serving the previous one without any difficulty. He has never borrowed from another MFI. He hopes to become a leading boutique owner in the area, which will see his family living a happy life.

loans.use: To buy variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Orozaly

texts.en:
Orozaly U. is a 52-year-old farmer who has three children. All Orozaly’s life has been closely connected with livestock breeding; he worked as a veterinarian for a long time. After the breakdown of the Soviet Union, he established his own farm with milk cows and its daily milk yield is sold to the local dairy factory. Orozaly is also engaged in cultivating beans and perennial herbs and works hard to get a good harvest.

Orozaly plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to expand his farm by buying milk cows, which will allow increased milk sales. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing land for cultivating. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque S. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. He is 35 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Roque owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. His main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk foods in the local community. Roque has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Roque joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and use working capital. For his second loan, Roque is requesting 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods and beverages. Roque plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve and expand his shop. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Maria Nellys de 32 años de edad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y sus padres, labora como docente de primaria desde hace cinco años en la Escuela Paulino Halsalla ubicada en la colonia Yolaina en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, donde se desempeña con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, Vecinos y Amigos manifiestan muy buenas referencias de su persona, por ser una persona luchadora, responsable y bien querida en la colonia donde ella habita.  

Solicita su tercer crèditoa Kiva para Repellar la casa ya que poco a poco va comprando los materiales para construir su  vivienda y asi mantener el espiritu de superacion.  

Su sueño en la vida es que su linda familia permanezca siempre unida y goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
Maria Nelly is 32 years old and has the help of her husband and parents. She has worked for five years as an elementary school teacher at Paulino Halsalla School, located in the Yolaina neighborhood of the municipality of Nueva Guinea. She works there with great responsibility and honesty. Neighbors and friends give very good references about her for being a determined, responsible and well-liked person in the neighborhood where she lives.

She is requesting her third loan from Kiva to plaster the house, as she is buying the materials to build her house little by little and this way, maintain her spirit for self-improvement.

Her life dream is for her wonderful family to always be close-knit and healthy.

loans.use: To plaster the house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia V. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 50 years old. Lucia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Lucia wishes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min L. is a 46-year-old villager who lives in Preaek Andoung village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kry Kimheang, have a child who attends a local school. The couple are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. In their business, they face some problems because they do not have enough farming supplies to grow their rice. Therefore, Mrs. Min L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and hoses for growing rice. Aside from farming, they also earn an income by fishing in the local village.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and hoses for growing rice

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 31-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to continue to save for future family needs and business expansion. Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Leslie Alberto

texts.es: El Sr L. labora como ayudante de transporte  es  soltero,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar materiales bloque ,cemento ,estribo, clavo, hierro y mano de obra, para construir  muro de  su vivienda y darle mas segurida a su casa y su familia y espera que le siguen apoyando para  ir mejora mas.
texts.en: Mr. L. works as a transportation assistant. He is single and this is the first loan that CEPRODEL has given him. He is thankful for the opportunity they have offered with this expenditure to buy materials such as blocks, cement, supports, nails, iron and labor costs. This is to build a wall around his property and give his house and family more security. He hopes they will continue supporting him for more improvement.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 25 años, tiene una hermosa relación de 7 años con su esposo Samuel, con el que tiene  un hijo, Tomy. Al que cuidan y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Perene (selva central peruana). En la comunidad de Manankiari, se encuentra su hectárea de terreno agrícola, donde siembra plátano, guanábana, tangelo y naranja. Pero consiente de su limitación; siembra también en sociedad con otras personas que tienen mayores terrenos agrícolas. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo obtuvo buenas ganancias, pues comercializa en el mercado de frutas de la capital del país, donde viaja constantemente. “El secreto es saber negociar las cargas de frutas”, afirma. Su principal dificultad, es la falta de terrenos amplios para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades, limitándose a asociarse con terceros. Por ello está juntando dinero para invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de tangüelo (fruta cítrica), en el mes de abril. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada pues agradece al apoyo que obtuvo de su asociación en todo este tiempo. Judith, constantemente contrata peones para que le ayuden en la limpieza de sus cultivos. Por ello con el crédito pagará el salario semanal de las personas que le ayudan.
texts.en:
Judith, age 25, has been in a beautiful seven-year relationship with her husband Samuel. They have a son named Tomy who they care for and provide an education. Judith has her own home in the town of Perene, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. In the community of Manankiari, she has a hectare of farmland on which she grows bananas, guavas, tangelos, and oranges. However, she is aware of her limitations. She also works for other people who have larger plots of land. Judith has seven years of experience. Throughout this time, she has generated good earnings by traveling constantly to the fruit market in the national capital to sell her goods. “The secret is to know how to negotiate for loads of fruit,” Judith says. Her main difficulty is not having enough land to grow in large quantities, which is why she relies on other people. For this reason, she is accumulating money to invest in the purchase of more farmland. Now she is preparing for the tangelo harvest that takes place in April.

Judith is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Soñadores” (The Dreamers) and receiving her fourth loan from MFP. She is grateful for all the support she has received from her Communal Bank. Judith is always hiring workers to help with clearing her fields. For this reason, she will use this loan to pay the weekly salary of the workers who help her.

loans.use: To pay workers to clear her fields and remove weeds.

loans.name: Angel Bolivar

texts.es:
ANGEL BOLIVAR S. V. , tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con 4 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Angel se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura en especial al siembra de maíz y trigo.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es mejorar la casa.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ángel Bolívar S. V. is 68 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in Tangara, in San Miguel, in Bolívar province.

This community bank is called 'Campesinos Unidos' and is located in Tangara, 15 minutes from San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in agriculture and retail.

Ángel is a farmer who mainly grows corn and wheat.  He buys his supplies in San Miguel and sells his produce in San Miguel market.

Ángel is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.  This loan will help his family business to produce more and he will work hard to pay off his debt.  Ángel's dream is to improve his home.

The challenges that Ángel faces in his work are insect infestations and plant diseases.  He enjoys taking part in sports and dancing at local festivals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is  47 and is married with five children, ages 14 through 24 years old. She also takes care of two relatives ages 12 and 16 years old. Only Gorette works in her family. She runs a hand crafts  business. She has been in this business for three years and her hours of operation are from 7am until 6pm daily.

Gorette has requested this loan through Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more hand crafts. The extra income generated from this loan will help her to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more hand crafts.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Twaha has had a small retail shop for four years.He also has a second business of a metal work shop.         

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Twaha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Twaha hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 30 years old and married to Patrick. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods like flour, sugar, sweets and soft dinks for resale in her retail shop.

In the future, Jane hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy retail goods for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 29-year-old single man, owns a fuel station where he sells fuel, diesel, cigarettes, car wash services and mobile phone recharge cards. A hard worker who invests every cent he gets into something new, Ali is striving hard to achieve a better income and a better future with the hope of starting a small family of his own. However, his first priority is to be in a position to provide everything they will need.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open a new business, a small cafeteria. He needs to buy a refrigerator and hookas and build a brick tent with artificial green grass to make it more comfortable for visitors. Ali also hopes to start another new business in the future in the agricultural field.

loans.use: in order to invest in a new business.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is married and has a business buying and selling nipa (palms) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now. Isabelita works hard to support her family.

She has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Isabelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: K. Demanya

texts.fr: Revendeur de presses, d’articles scolaires, et devers depuis 2004, Demanya est marié à une revendeuse et a en charge 03 enfants. Il achète ses presses dans une maison de presse et revend devant sa devanture. Il veut renforcer son activité c’est pour cela il sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en: Selling newspapers, school supplies and various other items since 2004, Demanya is married to a petty trader and raising three children. He buys his newspapers in a publishing house and sells them in front of his building. He wants to expand his business and that is why he is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy newspapers and school supplies.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou agee de 54 ans habite un village situe a environ 15 km de la ville principale.Elle est mariee et mere de 7 enfants dont l'aine a 32 ans et le plus jeune,18.
Fatou est  dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans deja.Elle l'a herite en quelque sorte de sa mere adoptive.IL faut aussi noter que Fatou n' est pas novice dans les credits car elle a eu a  en benefier de 3 auparavent.
Avec ce credit elle veut acheter des produits halieutiques(poissons fumes,yet...)
Cette operation lui permettra d'augmenter son profit afin de mieux gerer les depenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou is 54 years old and lives in a town located about 15km from the main city. She is married and has seven children, of whom the eldest is 32 and the youngest is 18.
Fatou has been in business for over 15 years already. She inherited it in some sense from her adoptive mother. It is also worth noting that Fatou is no stranger to repaying loans, as she has benefited from three already.
With this loan, she wants to buy seafood products (smoked fish, dried cymbium molluscs, etc.).
This operation will allow her to increase her profits in order to better manage her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy seafood products (smoked fish, dried cymbium molluscs, etc.)

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 64 years old. He supports a family of ten people. He is married to Jane, who helps him with the farm so as to get additional income for the family. His children are of the following ages: 23, 22, 20 ,18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years old. He practices farming and has been in business for 26 years. His monthly income from the business is 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Richard is borrowing 20,000 KES which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use additional income to educate his children. This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His dreams and hopes are to continue with his farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seed and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Verónica  Del Sagrado

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Verónica  se dedica arduamente a laborar como sub-directora y se dedica a esta labor desde hace trece años. Es casada y tiene a su cargo un hijo.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda por medio de la compra de materiales de construcción tales como verjas para darle seguridad a su vivienda y por ende a su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Managua, Mrs. Verónica has been working as an assistant director for 13 years.  She is married and has a son in her care.

She is requesting a loan through CEPRODEL so she can buy construction materials for home improvement.  Her plans are to put in a gate for family safety and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Edelyn has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy snacks to sell, like biscuits and candies.

Edelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Edelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks to sell, like biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz y productos secos como trigo, quinua y cebada, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba donde atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz y granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, trigo y quinua al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Fraternidad de Urubamba Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  

Victoria, age 49, is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling corn and dried products like wheat, quinoa, and barley.  She has a stand at the Urubamba market, and she works there from 5:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  

It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.  She wants to improve her business of selling corn and dried grains.  

She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale corn, wheat, and quinoa.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make all of her payments

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, wheat, and quinoa.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris works hard to support her family. Iris is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Iris requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Iris has been in this business for 7 years.
She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Felicisima has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Felicisima is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Felicisima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos  a La señora Nelly Tiene 44 años está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el ultimo de  17 años que estudia el último año de colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Nelly para ayudarse y ayudar a sus hijos se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios), trabaja desde las 6h30 en una casa como empleada domestica pero en las tardes se dedica a  vender sus productos por toda la localidad donde vive, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana,  lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad comercial y le ha ido muy bien ya que con esto ha podido ayudar  a sus hijos con los estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido ya que con los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es terminar por completo su casa.
texts.en:
The village bank Caminantes de Cristo meets every 15 days on the outskirts of Portoviejo in the sector known as Las Piedras [The Stones], an area that is very near to the rock quarries, hence its name.  

Here we meet Nelly, 44. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are grown and the youngest, 17, is in their last year of high school. Her husband is a mason.

Nelly, in order to help herself and her children, is a merchant, selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and accessories). She starts work at 6:30 as a domestic employee, but in the afternoons she sells her products all over her neighborhood. She sells on credit and collects payments every weekend. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and it has gone very well and has allowed her to help her kids with their schooling.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and lotions. She is a founding member of this village bank and likes it because the help that she has received through the loans has allowed her to improve her business.

Her dream is to finish constructing her home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Monica

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos que ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ningem. 

É empregada de balcão numa loja ha mais de 18 anos e tem um salario de 6.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar materialpara construcao da sua casa(pedra, areia, blocos, cimento, e outros).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, e 8.000.00mt, para o negocio.
No futuro sonha em  construir um estabelecimento comercial e iniciar o seu proprio negocio, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children who still attend school. She completed 3rd grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
She has been a sales clerk at a store for over 18 years and earns a salary of 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (stone, sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.). The first loans were for 5.000, 7.000 and 8.000mt, for this enterprise.
In the future she dreams of building a store and starting her own business. She will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (stone, sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 57-year-old housewife. She has been sewing bed covers and some clothes for the last 10 years at her house. Recently she started sewing curtains and other types of covers and sheets, depending on what her customer wants. But sometimes she faces a few troubles when sewing because of her old machine. So now she has applied for a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine to help her overcome the difficulties she had using the old one.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, a 58-year-old married father of seven children ranging in age from 24 to 15 years, two of whom are in school, has been farming for over seven years in his home area of Kitale Western Kenya, producing and selling milk and maize for the local market. He runs a retail shop business for additional income. His major challenge is animal diseases.

Jacob has requested a loan of 61,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a dairy unit and purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional cow and the dairy unit construction will improve his milk output and hence his family's farming income and general living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit and buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
L. señora aquilina es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años D. edad y está casada con el señor José quien es apicultor, tienen 6 hijos, D. los cuales ya todos están casados y cada quien hizo su vida aparte, elL. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, desD. hace mas D. 9 años.

Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también así contar con una mejor calidad D. vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas mercancía como son: aceite, leche, arroz, galletas, agua, sopas, refrescos, huevos, jabón, etc. Y así tener mucho más surtido su negocio.

Una D. las metas que tiene doña aquilina para su negocio, es L. D. hacerL. crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante ampliar un poco mas su local, ya que quiere poner una tienda D. venta por mayoreo, puesto que así contara con un amplio surtido y mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios D. kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá D. mucho, puesto que ahora pueD. continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Aquilina is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She is 50 years old and married to José, who is a beekeeper.  They have six children, all of whom are married and have their own lives.  She has had a grocery store for more than nine years.

She says that she decided to invest in this work because she wants to help her husband with the household expenses, since he was working too much and he does not earn enough to have good financial solvency.  They also are able to have a better quality of life.

She will invest the loan she received in buying more merchandise, such as oil, milk, rice, cookies, water, soup, soda, eggs, soap, etc., so her business has more stock.

One of Aquilina's goals for her business is to make it grow a lot, since she is thinking about expanding her store a little in the future.  She wants to open a wholesale store, since in that way she will have a wider assortment and she will improve and increase her income much more.

She thanks Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all the support and confidence they are giving her.  This helps her a lot, since now she can continue investing in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise: oil, milk, rice, cookies, water, soup, soda, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарджон молодой перспективный парень Он семьянин, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается купле продажей. Яиц. Это очень востребованный вид товара, который быстро реализуется. Он хотел бы получить 3000 долларов для оптового закупа товара. К праздникам очень поднимутся цены и он хотел бы закупить товар. Он надеетя на вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Zafarjon is young and promising young man.  He is a family man and has two children.  He is involved in buying and selling eggs.  This is a highly demanded product, which gets sold quickly.  Zafarjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 to purchase product at a wholesale price.  Prices will rise a lot for the holidays, and he wants to buy the product now.  He hopes to get your support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase eggs

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 38-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and only one child. He's considered as the main source of income in the family and is working really hard to provide a better future for his young child. 

He started his own metal works in 2003 and has already a total of eighteen years of experience in this domain. Today, he needs a loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added metalworking equipment for his business. He's certain that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he plans to open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional metalworking equipment for his business

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 22 years old.  She is married and has one child, age 4. 

In 2005, Muna established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Muna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 25 years old, married to Charles, and they have one child. She has been in the business of rearing cattle and piglets for the last two years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 6,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes. 10,000. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer. She plans to use the loan to buy another dairy cow and piglets.

Her dreams are to expand her business into large-scale dairy farming and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more dairy  cattle and piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba operates a grocery shop in Ankako. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer.

Araba has been selling groceries for five years. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more groceries for resale at her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create awareness of, and to expand, her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale at her shop.

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en:
Khlood is a 27 year old marrried woman from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements, she would like to provide for her family a good environment to live in.
Since Khlood is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Gladys. She is married, and she has two children, aged 8 and 6 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for fostering.  

In 2009, Gladys established her biscuit, hard drinks, soft drinks, batteries, milk, pure water and bread business.   

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,900,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.

Gladys requires a loan in order to buy cartons of milk, biscuits, batteries, sweets, pure water and vegetable oil.  

Gladys still plans to build a house, educate her children and acquire a shop. She now plans to change her business product to a pharmacy after her course in nursing. This loan will help to accomplish some of her future plans. Her challenge is inadequate capital.  

She is hardworking businesswoman. She hopes to repay the loan within the stipulated time. She thanks you.

loans.use: to buy cartons of milk, biscuits, batteries, sweets, pure water and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en: Lyna, 20, is a student who from Phnom Penh city. Beside from her studying, she has working as a tailor for tailor shop to get salary to support on her expend and her study. She has been with her working for years and it make her saving about 7 USD per day after her expend from her daily income. For Lyna, this is her first time with VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to pay tuition fees for her Bachelor’s degree. She hopes that she can get a good job after graduated, so she can get a decent income to improve on her family condition get better than before.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her Bachelor’s degree.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina lives in Lumo area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam.She owns a vegetable and fruits stall where she sells different fruits and vegetables.She fetch some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinaches from local farmers nearby her residence.Other farm produce like oranges,bananas and pineaples come from nearby regions.Amina plan to improve her business.She is planning to have cages for produts attractive display and hygiene .She also want to increase the quantity of the stock to overcome shortages.This will make her products offering more attractive than her competitors.And as a result she can make more sales. To fulfill these requirements she is in need of USD 400,to subsdize her capital.

loans.use: Adding stock,purchase display cage

loans.name: Lamo

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the eight women of the Kawral association, led by Lamo S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Our business strategy depends on the capacity of the group to stock enough farm products [e.g. millet, yams, peanuts] to establish our own fund dedicated to the periodic replenishment of our stock of quality food products at good prices, to be sold in the bi-weekly markets. Our business activities will consist of purchasing the goods when their price is very low (strong supply), store them, and sell them in the local markets.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet : Avec toutes les conséquences néfastes liées à la production agricole inadaptée, la destruction massive des sols et autres phénomènes liés à la désertification ;le département de M’BACKE se retrouve avec un déséquilibre

Objectif général : Augmentation durable des revenus agricole

Objectifs spécifiques

• Lutter contre la pauvreté du milieu rural (communauté rurale de DENDEYE)

Stratégie

Elle repose sur la capacité du G I E à stocker assez de produits de première nécessité pour constituer un fond Propre destiné au renouvellement périodiques des denrées de qualités à bons prix destinées à la vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires (LOUMA)

Activités

Il s’agira d’acheté de la matière première au moment ou le prix est très bas. ( forte offre ) et de les stocker et d’organiser des actions de commercialisations dans les marchés locaux.

Activité 1 : achats matières premières

Activité : commercialisation»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and has restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.
