loans.use: Purchase of agricultural products (millet, yams, peanuts, etc.) and transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia C. has raised seven children, who then gave her 20 grandchildren who in turn have given her 17 great-grandchildren. She carries on her experience with children by selling empanadas (baked or fried pastries wrapped around fruit or meat and cheese) outside the local school yard every day. She buys the empanadas pre-made from the city of Nagua, about a 30 minute trip. This is her first time running her own business but she has plenty of experience with her target clientèle.

NOTE: Felicia is one of five micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $750 loan together. If a member is unable to pay in full and on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase empanadas for resale

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
У Дилрабо высшее образование и по образованию она педагог. Закончив университет она начала работать в школе простым педагогом. Постепенно она росла по карьерной лестнице и сейчас она работает директором школы. Ее школа находится в маленьком городке Шураб. Дилрабо любит свою работу и ходит на нее с радостью. Заработка преподавателя не хватает на жизнь и поэтому приходится дополнительно заниматься выращиванием домашнего скота. Этим занимается вся семья Дилрабо. Узнав про Микроинвест она пришла на консультацию. Условия предоставления займов понравились ей и она решила получить займ. На полученную сумму она прикупила несколько баранов. По ее словам это принесло дополнительную прибыль в семейный бюджет. Сейчас она собирается расшириться и получив новый займ купить еще больше баранов.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Dilrabo has a college degree in education. After graduation, she began to work as a school teacher. Gradually, Dilrabo climbed the career ladder and now she works as the school’s principle. The school is located in a small village of Shurab. Dilrabo loves her work and enjoys teaching. However, a schoolteacher’s pay is not enough to sustain oneself, and Dilrabo must do something in addition to her work in school. To earn extra income, Dilrabo and her entire family breed cattle. When Dilrabo learned of MicroInvest, she came for an appointment and liked the loan conditions. Dilrabo took a loan and bought several rams. According to Dilrabo, the purchase brought additional income into her family’s budget. Now, she asks for a new loan to purchase more rams.

loans.use: To expand the number of cattle

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio is a married man, has four children, and his wife is a homemaker. He started his business when he was very young and through his effort he managed to buy a light truck with which he could offer a service of transportation for light loads. His business continued growing and with his income as well as with help from his relatives, he managed to buy his own heavier truck with which he now can offer to transport more things and larger loads. His market consists of small towns close to his community. He is very persevering and hard working, so he expects his business will continue to grow.

Sergio is asking for a loan of $475 for maintenance service for his truck which is his main means for working so he can continue giving a good service to his clients and not disappoint them due to mechanical problems with his truck. He offers to pay the loan in 3 months. He and his family thank you for your support in continuing his business and improving it every day.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Sergio es un hombre casado y tiene cuatro hijos y su esposa se dedica al hogar, él empezó desde muy joven con su negocio y con su esfuerzo pudo comprar pudo comprar una camioneta con la cual podía ofrecer el servicio de transporte de cosas ligeras, pero continuó creciendo y con lo que junto y ayuda de sus familiares pudo comprar su propio camión con el cual ahora ya puede dar el transporte de carga de más cosas y más grandes lotes, su mercado son poblados cercanos a su comunidad, él es muy perseverante y trabajador por lo que espera continuar con su crecimiento en el negocio.

Sergio esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para darle mantenimiento a su camión que es su arma de trabajo para que pueda continuar dándole un buen servicio a sus clientes y no fallarles por desperfectos de su vehículo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Él y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo para continuar en su negocio y mejorarlo día a día.

loans.use: Maintenance/service for his truck

loans.name: Hugo Vidal

texts.es:
Hugo is a hardworking man, who until now has been able to give the best to his family based on many sacrifices and constant work. Each day, in the very early hours, he leaves his home and devotes himself to caring and feeding of the animals he breeds. He also works cultivating a plot of land. His selfless wife cares for their small children along with their guinea pigs, and at midday carries out food to her husband and their children who help him with agricultural work. This is why he'd like to greatly increase their production of crops, so the children can focus on their studies without any problems. He asks you to help him be able to plant a large quantity of potatoes and corn and improve the breed and raising of his animales. Do not be indifferent to the need of this family, and if you can help, do not hesitate. Hugo hopes for your help to continue educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hugo, es un hombre luchador que hasta hoy ha podido darle lo mejor a su familia a base de muchas madrugadas y de constantes días de trabajo, razón por la cual todos los días desde muy tempranas horas abandona su hogar para dedicarse a cuidar y a alimentar a sus animalitos que cría dentro de su hogar, además de la parcela de tierra que cultiva mientras estos buscan su alimento en las alturas.Su abnegada esposa se queda al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos y al cuidado de sus cuyes y a medio día sale a llevar los alimentos a su esposo, y a sus hijos que colaboran con las labores agrícolas de su padre, motivo por la cual desea enormemente acrecentar su producción para que ellos puedan estudiar sin ningún problema y solicita vuestra ayuda para que pueda sembrar un gran cantidad de papa, maíz y mejorar la raza de sus animales.No seamos indiferentes ante la necesidad de esta familia y si tú puedes colaborar no lo dudes Hugo espera tu ayuda para seguir educando a sus hijos

loans.use:
To purchase seeds and better animal food in order to improve the quality of his breed of small animals.  
(Compra de semillas y alimento para mejorar la raza de sus pequeños animales.)

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 26 year old shop keeper in Lugazi. He is married with 4 children and he cares for one orphan. He has had his business for 7 years and has been a member of his lending group for 3 years. In his shop he sells salt, paraffin, sugar, maize flour, soap and cosmetics. Most retail stores sell similar items. In poor areas the needs of villagers are simple and there is very little ability for luxury items.  As a store owner you would not want to take a risk by adding a “new” item to your inventory, because the likelihood of it being sold would be small. So, one focuses on selling only the necessities. Being in a rural village, Steven also has room to do some farming. He owns 2 pigs. When you ask the people of Lugazi what animals they own, they always give you a count. Each animal has considerable value to them and the count is a way to let you know of their importance. Steven plans to add poultry to his farm, but for now he plans to use his loan to add the necessary items to his store to replenish his inventory.

loans.use: Steven plans to add more paraffin, dry goods, soap to his store inventory.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou Ahiandzegbé is 35 years old, married, and has five (05) children. Her main business is the making of bouillie (a hot breakfast cereal) from local millet. She buys the millet in the neighbouring villages during the harvest, stocks it, and uses it during the rest of the year to make her bouillie, which is prized in the area. With this loan, she will buy 100 bags of millet in order to meet the demands of her customers. The income drawn from this business will be used to meet the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mme Akou Ahiandzegbé est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Sa principale activité est la fabrication de la bouillie du mil local. Elle achète le mil dans les villages environnant à la récolte, stock et l’utilise tout au long de l’année pour fabriquer de la bouillie très prisée dans le milieu. Avec le présent emprunt elle va acheter 100 sacs de mil afin de satisfaire la demande des consommateurs. Les revenus tirés de cette activité sont utilisés pour financer les dépenses courantes du ménage

loans.use: To buy 100 bags of local millet in the neighbouring villages and to transform it (throughout the year 2008) into 'bouillie' for local consumption

loans.name: Bufanala B Group

texts.en:
Rose Naiga is 35 years old and lives in Kalerwe, Uganda. She has a welding business and makes $25,000 Ugandan shillings—or about $15 U.S. dollars—a week, which is not enough to pay the mandatory school fees for her six children. They range in age from 2 to 18 years old.

That's why she has applied for a $1,100 loan with three other women. In a group loan, the funds are distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee each other's loans, so if one member can't repay, the others are responsible. Fida N. wants to grow her business, while Scovia B. wishes to start selling sweet potatoes. Lastly, Jawuda I. hopes to buy more clothes to expand her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand a welding business

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy Iyrekekpolor is single and is from Edo State, Nigeria. He is a photographer, and he also rents and sells VCDs. He studied his profession for three years and has been in business since 1997. He needs a loan of $300 to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Salma's Mikanjuni A Group

texts.en:
Salma is married with 1 child, age 20. Salma is a fish and cloth seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Pili and Mwanahamisi, who have businesses dealing in groceries.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is thirty-nine years old and a single mother of four school-age children. She lives in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal. Natalia separated from her husband four years ago, and since then she has had to fend for her family by herself. She says that seeing to the needs of four kids is no easy job, and that some nights she doesn’t get a wink of sleep, thinking about what she can do to keep supporting her family.

Currently, Natalia sells garments to people in her community, and she says that her business has been a great help in paying for her children's schooling. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more garments to increase her sales volume and thus her revenue.

Natalia wants to become one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her sector.

loans.use: To by clothing in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Mirzoaly

texts.en: Mr. Mirzoaly M. does not have a lot of formal education, but 30 years of working with livestock has made him very experienced in this trade. Like many people in his village, he has a big, well-cared-for flock and would love to own a large farm. The farm he owns today is a family business in which he wife works with him to care for their animals, and his children sell milk and yarn produced at home. Mr. M. has a good reputation and is widely known as a very hard-working man and a loving father of six children. Mr. M. dreams of giving a good education to his sons and helping his daughters have successful marriages, and is committed to work hard to make that happen. Mr. M. has applied for a loan from Kiva to build a new barn in which to house his cows.

loans.use: to build a new barn in which to house his cows.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in Gbatopé in the Zio prefecture on December 31, 1986. He is married and has two children. From a young age he learned how to make shoes because he had a passion for it. Since 1993, he has operated a shoemaking shop in the city of Lomé where he purchases, on-site, everything that he needs to make shoes. He takes orders and also sells his shoes at expositions. His shoes are in high demand, but due to his insufficient working capital, he is unable to meet customer demand. Therefore, he got the idea to take out his first loan to increase his working capital so he can buy raw materials to make shoes, such as lizard skins, soles, and buffalo hides.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou est né à Gbatopé dans la préfecture de Zio le 31 décembre 1986. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Dès son jeune age il a apprit ce métier de fabrication de chaussures car c’était sa passion. Depuis 1993, il a ouvert son atelier de fabrication dans la ville de Lomé où il achète sur place tout le nécessaire pour la fabrication. Il reçoit des commandes et fait aussi la vente par exposition. Ses chaussures sont très demandées, mais à cause de son fonds de roulement qui n’est pas très suffisant il n’arrive pas à répondre à cette demande. Il a eu alors l’idée de prendre ce premier crédit pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’acheter les matières premières qui sont les peau de varan, les semelles et les bifalo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: Sampuli's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Sampuli F. is 35 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 13. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Sampuli has successfully repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asma O..

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her business

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en:
K. Bibigul is 51 years old. She is married with five children. Bibigul has always had a trying life. Supporting their large family was very difficult for her husband, so she decided to start her own business. Struggling against the difficult life, Bibigul learned to process dried fruits and apricots 10 years ago. The business went successfully after it started.

Thanks to this activity she could to provide for her family and educate her children, who today are working adults thanks to her example. Now Bibigul’s husband is pensioned off and helping her with the business. Today this friendly family is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) for the term of 6 months. They hope to use the loan to purchase more dried fruits due to great demand from her customers. Bibigul and her husband are sincerely thankful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits for processing and further selling

loans.name: Tenjei

texts.en:
Tenjei is married and has six children. He is a very hard working man, as far as educating his children is concerned. He often has the problem of unemployment, since it is a very rampant situation in his community. 

He joined GHAPE and learned loan usage and management techniques which have built his skills and made him who he is today. With this loan, he plans to expand his business to rear pigs. He thinks his business will succeed because the manure he gets from his animal farm will be used to boost the production of vegetables in his community, and he will provide them with pork and red oil for big ceremonies. 

The profit he gets from the business shall be used to pay tuition fees for his children, with the remainder as back capital.

loans.use: Buy motorcycle and pig supplies

loans.name: Iris Gardenia

texts.en:
Iris Gardenia V. P. is a member of the community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. Iris is a nurse and also has a small kiosk that provides services including phone booths and groceries.

Iris will invest her loan of 1500 soles ($500.00) in her business by purchasing items like water, sugar, candies, toilet paper and bread. With the additional income she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional groceries and goods

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
Muharam Z. is 35 years old. She is married with two children. Muharam sells office and school supplies. Her trading place is located in the central market and has a wide range of goods. The majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with other big stores selling office supplies, Muharam’s prices are lower and more attractive.

Muharam's husband is a farmer and as it is known that farming has the seasonal nature. There are periods when Muharam's business is the main source of income. Muharam repaid her previous loan ahead of schedule and now she wants to take another loan due to the high demand for her goods. She requests 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for the term of 10 months to purchase office supplies to sell. Muharam has been a client of IMON for several years with a positive credit history. She promises to repay this loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Medhat

texts.en:
Medhat is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. He has owned a clothing shop for a year. Medhat is asking for a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase his inventory. This is his second loan cycle. He has always paid on schedule.

The loan has influenced his life in a good way. With it, he began a business selling sportswear and shoes. His prices are competitive, and sometimes he sells wholesale. He is planning to expand his clothing line beyond sportwear and shoes. In the future, he hopes to generate more income by offering a greater selection of men's clothing.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn H. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business of breeding ducks is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food. 

Her husband, Mr. Tim Ken, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Horn H. is a 32-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food.

loans.name: Mr. Som Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are nineteen members of this village bank in Anhchang Rung Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They will use their loan for various purposes.

Mr. Som N. has been selected as the village bank president by its members. He is a single farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He currently earns a small income to support his family. In order to improve his income, he decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a pig breeding business.

Eighteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius sells drinks by retail to his customers. He hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

He is 52 years old and married with six children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Mariela R. E. tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 1er año de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Lidia tiene como negocio la venta de jugos y comida rápida es apoyada por su madre aun esta empezando con su negocio pero manifiesta que sus ventas van mejorando, su negocio lo realiza en el domicilio de  su mamá.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de frutas necesario para la preparación de jugos así como de otros alimentos para su negocio de comida rápida.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de vasos y la reparación de su licuadora.
Lidia tiene como sueño poner una bodega surtido de abarrotes y continuar con la venta de jugos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lidia Mariela R. E. is 20 years old. She lives in Salaverry district in Trujillo Providence in the State of La Libertad. She completed school to ninth grade.

Lidia has a child as a dependent. She has a small business, at her mother’s house, selling juice and fast food. Her mother helps and the business is improving.

Lidia bought fruits and other ingredients needed for the foods she prepares with the $100.00 loan received from the Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry Communal Bank. She will buy glasses and repair a blender with the new $100.00 loan, which she will repay in four months.

Lidia’s dream is to set up a small grocery store and to continue selling juice.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glasses and repair a blender.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalia M., 58 years old, is married and lives in the city of Oroquieta. She was blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer.

She has a “sari-sari” (general) store to support the daily needs of her family. Her customers are neighbors, friends and passers-by. The idea of owning a store came into reality because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, Kiva's partner. The coop provides capitalization to starters. She became a member in September 2008.

For the second time, she is applying for PHP 7,000 to buy additional goods for sale. Hopefully, she will be able to sustain the business and be able to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Alvino

texts.es:
El Sr  Albino V. es una persona joven con espíritu emprendedor y tiene deseos de sobresalir.  El es de una de las compañías denominada Ndavaru de la ciudad de Carapegua. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de sobrecamas varios. Junto con su madre elaboran sus propios productos tejiendo en su propia casa, de esa manera día a día se sacrifican para tratar de salir adelante.

El negocio con que cuenta le es muy rentable gracias al empeño que demuestra hacia su trabajo. Fabrican al  por mayor y tienen clientela formada tambien se dedica a  vender casa  por  casa  otro  tipo de mercaderìas. 

El crédito solicitado fue utilizado para la compra de  Frazadas y otros productos atendiendo que esta por entrar la temporada de frió.
texts.en:
Mr. Albino V. is a young person with an entrepreneurial spirit and he has a great desire to succeed. He is one of the designated Ndavaru companies in Carapegua city. Today he sells a variety of bedspreads. Along with his mother, they sew their own products in their own home, and in this way day after day they sacrifice everything to be able to get ahead. The business is very profitable thanks to the determination he demonstrates toward his work. They make these items wholesale and they have an established clientele and he also sells other merchandise house to house. The loan he seeks will be used to buy blankets and other products because they are coming up on the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blankets

loans.name: Bimukarram

texts.ru: Умарова Бимукаррам  1959 года рождения имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Торгует семенами, рисом и другими бобовыми культурами. Торгует на рынке  18 лет.  В Микроинвест обратилась посовету мужа. Муж зарабатывал в то время мало денег и ей пришлось выйти на рынок торговать рисом. Раньше она была просто продавщицей, со временем она выкупила рис и продолжала продавать сама. Благодаря КИВА она вышла из своей трудной ситуации.
texts.en:
Bimukarram U. was born in 1959; she has 2 children. She does not have a higher education. She sells seeds, rice and other legumes. She has been selling at the market for 18 years. Bimukarram turned to MicroInvest on the advice of her husband. Her husband was earning little money at the time and she needed to go out to the market to sell rice. At first she was just a saleswoman, with time she purchased the rice and continued to sell it herself. Thanks to KIVA she was able to resolve her difficult situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Silvio R. de 40 años de edad, habitante del barrio Augusto Cesar Sandino en la capital de Managua, su compañera de vida es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos todos los tienen estudiando. Se desempeña de técnico de pista en una gasolinera, trabajo que intercalan las horas de trabajo algunas veces de día y otras de noche, desde hace un año y medio trabajo en ese puesto, aspira a otro forma de vida en la cual gane más. Los planes que tiene para el futuro es mejorar su vivienda para darles seguridad a sus hijos. Por falta de financiamiento no ha realizado las mejoras que necesita su humilde casa. Gracias al préstamo que le brinda Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, Hierro, zinc, bloques y ladrillos. Para la construcción de un cuarto para estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Señor Silvio R. is 40 and lives in the Augusto Cesar Sandino neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. His wife is a housewife, and all three of their children are in school. He works at a gas station, where he sometimes works days and sometimes works nights. He has had this job for a year and a half. He hopes to find another job where he can make more money. His plans for the future are to improve his home to give his children safety. Because of the lack of financing, he hasn't made improvements to his humble home. Thanks to the loan that Afodenic is offering him, he will be able to buy construction materials like cement, iron, metal, and bricks. He is going to build a room so his house will be in better condition.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
"We own the land that we till. We also raise farm animals to have immediate income for the family," says Margarita I., a 32 year old mother of four children.

Margarita learned about CEVI's helpful services. She would like to avail a loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital for her businesses. Specifically, she intends to purchase two sacks of fertilizers, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm needs. She believes the loan will really help her achieve the maximum yield for her farm.

She is happy to receive a loan from CEVI. She also receives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fam supplies.

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es: La Señorita Julia C.  cuenta con 28 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Calzado”, habita junto  a sus Papas , ella lleva 6 años en la Artesanía en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Miss Julia C. is 28 years old, is single, and does handicrafts work; she produces footwear. She lives with her parents. She has spent 6 years making handicrafts in her home, which is located in the Casereío Xetinimit in the town of Nimasac, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demand is growing, but her economic conditions are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She intends to use the loan to buy more raw materials. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (producing footwear)

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a member of the Uwasombo borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 49-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of four children aged 32, 29, 26 and 16 years. She also cares for three other dependents.

Three years ago, Mwanaisha started her own business selling bicycles. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 45,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Mwanaisha’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more bicycles. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mwanaisha hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles for her business

loans.name: Kojo Isaac

texts.en: Kojo Isaac M. is married and has 9 dependants. He has received schooling through junior high school. Kojo drives at Takoradi, which he has done since 1985. Kojo Isaac uses his income to pay for school fees and other bills. Kojo Isaa will use the loan to buy car spare parts. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo Isaac plans to educate his children.

loans.use: ojo Isaa will use the loan to buy car spare parts.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata C., est une femme de 31 ans avec 1 enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE depuis 2 ans et demi, elle est très dynamique et a une bonne performance au niveau de son groupe. Elle fait du commerce d'huile végétal et de pâte d'arachide qu'elle transforme elle même. elle contribue au bienêtre de la famille en soutenant son mari dans certaines charges.
texts.en:
Fatoumata C. is a 31 year old woman with 1 child to support. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Medina Diambere for 2 and a half years. She is very dynamic and shows good performance in her group. She sells vegetable oil and peanut butter that she makes herself. She contributes to the well being of her family by supporting her husband with some expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her capital

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia A. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to improve on her shop stock.  Emelia is 40 years old and is Married with a husband that is a clerk. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: improve on her shop stock

loans.name: Mighty God Group

texts.en: Adwoa is forty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader and the leader of a trust bank group called "Mighty God." The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. Some of the group members, however, also render services, such as sewing/tailoring, hairdressing, etc. They want a loan to buy goods and materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a 50 year-old widow with five children. She has run a food kiosk in the Mathare slums of Nairobi for 18 years and previously had a grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more food and a mkokoteni (hand cart). She says that she has been able to educate her children because loans from Faulu have allowed her to expand her business. She hopes to one day buy land and a pickup truck for the business and make a better life for her family away from the slums. She describes herself as hopeful and a very hardworking and visionary client. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy food and a hand cart for her kiosk.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad O. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 68 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Natividad owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
K. Hasan is a farmer who has been working the land for the past seven years. He is 48 years old, married and has five children (there are six people in his household, including his five children and wife). He was educated through secondary school and had some formal training in farming. This has done the trick for him financially. In the upcoming season, Hasan plans to grow wheat, onions and carrots. This will require more money than he has, so he is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow Hasan to take better care of his children's health, nourishment and schooling.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming products

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. Gina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Soeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeb C. is the mother of four children who are all students. She lives in Prey Bay village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Soeb C. is a farmer who owns small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Noeun Morm, is a duck breeder who is able to earn a small income to help his family. He is shown on the right in the photo.

Since her husband’s duck business is going well, he wants to expand it so Mrs. Soeb C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for her husband's business

loans.name: Sokvet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvet T. and her husband, Mr. Seangbunq Ngin, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1998 and have one son and one daughter. The son attends school and the daughter stays at home. Sokvet was not available for the photo, so her mother is pictured instead.  

Sokvet has been a garment factory worker for nine years, while her husband has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for more than four years. She is requesting a loan of $300 to fill up the land under her house and to build a fence around the house.

loans.use: To fill up the land under her house and build a fence around the house.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun S. is 31 years old and lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nat In, are farmers.

Although they try to work hard with their farm they still earn less income than needed to support their family, so they started a new business as rice middleman. In order to support the new business, Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cart. She will use the rest to buy more rice to support her new business.

Soeun S. is the mother of two children who are 2 and 8 years old. One of her children is currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase a cart and more rice for her business

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass K. is a businessman who sells cosmetics and hair products.  He owns a store that is located in a market commonly known as Portee market in Freetown.  He is married with three children.  Over the years his business has grown from a small table to that of a shop that he now owns.

Knowing that with more capital his profit will be increased, Abass is seeking a loan to add to his present capital to buy more stock, and make more profit that will enable him to respond to his family's needs.

Abass is a client with a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair products to sell.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz es propietaria de un negocio como es la venta de quesillos de manera ambulante, la señora sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto. Su esposo trabaja en una bicicleta de tres ruedas transportando gente de un lugar a otro. Pues esta Alba se gana la vida de la manera más humilde que puede. Ella tiene tres hijos los cuales asisten al colegio público ellos le ayudan en los que más pueden. Esta  solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Alba Luz has a small business preparing cheese snacks called quesillos which she sells around the area. Her husband earns money by taking people from place to place on his 3 wheel bicycle. Alba lives as humble a life as she can. They have 3 children who attend school and help their parents however they can. Alba is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products so she can increase her sales. Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her small food business and increase her sales

loans.name: E.montealto's Group

texts.en:
Emelyn M. is 31 years old,  married and lives in the village of Villaflor. Emelyn is the leader of E. M.'s Group, a four-member group eligible for loans offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Emelyn raises pigs. She has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month. In 2008 she joined PMPC to gain access to their financial services. Emelyn is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future (this will be the fourth loan she has taken out from PMPC). She plans to use all additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mr. Him H. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Tha TH., have been married since 2004. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Him has been driving a horse cart for more than seven years. His wife is a silk weaver. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase an additional horse for his business. And he will use a part of his loan to purchase silk materials for his wife to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy an additional horse for his business.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. S., 34, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables in the village, in a commune of Phnom Penh City. She has been growing crops since 2006. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. All of her children are students. Her husband is a financial earner who works in the construction field. S. faces some problems: her old house is broken which has affected the family’s living conditions. Because of that, S. is looking for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Fardin Group

texts.en:
Nasir Ahmad is the group leader of Fardin group. He is 45, married and living in a family of 7 members. He and his family members are residents of the 16th district of Kabul Afghanistan. He is a tinsmith and can produce different kinds of things in his shop such as heaters, bags, pots and so on. 
He needs the loan to rent a new shop next to his old one and to expand his business. He is glad that has this opportunity to go ahead and be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: To rent another shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single woman with two children, one girl and one boy, both of whom attend school. She has been selling clothes both new and second hand for two years. She sells the clothes at the market to both men and women customers. She hopes to buy one bale of clothes with the KES 40000 loan.
	
Her major business challenges are seasonality as she experiences low sales during rainy seasons, and finding the best supplier for the clothes. She hopes to open a boutique in future. 

She decided to join Yehu because it offers its loans at a lower interest rate. Sarah rents a house with electricity and no water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy one bale of clothes

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Meet the teachers of a primary school in Lunsar, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone! This school was built in 1986 to promote education within Lunsar and villages surrounding Lunsar. This is the first loan that teachers of this school are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, some of these borrowers will invest in their businesses, and others will buy pieces of furniture. Some pay school fees for their children, some will use it to buy a plot of land and so on.

Musa K. is the headmaster of the school and leader of this group. He is age 45. He was born in Port Loko, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married with four children: one of his children is a baby and three are in secondary school. Musa has been a teacher for 28 years now. 

Musa will hand over his share of the loan to his wife who is a petty businesswoman. His wife sells palm oil, rice and other market foodstuffs. This will definitely boost his wife’s business so that she, too, will be in a better position to contribute significantly towards running the home.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and other market foodstuffs

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh T. L. was born in 1969. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Her husband is a carpenter. She has a medicine shop. She not only sells medicines, but  she also grows rice and raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She wants to expand her medicine shop. So she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA. She will try to repay her loan punctually.

loans.use: to expand her medicine shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is single and has two children. She works hard to support her children by selling firewood. After separating from her husband, she began to take her business very seriously because she was now the family's breadwinner. Jane has been in business for seven years and has applied for a loan for 45,000 KES to buy more firewood to sell to her customers. Her goal is to earn enough money to provide her children with decent housing and quality education.

loans.use: To buy firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sherlita's Group

texts.en:
Sherlita M. is from the town of Villa Marzo, Cordon. She is 48 years old and the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Sherlita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, She raises pigs for fattening and sale. Sherlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Sherlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies and is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP also to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Sherlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Dela Paz Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old. Regina is widowed and has nine adult children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Regina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 21st loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann A. is from the village of Kinura, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old, married, and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rose Ann owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorsikad (a motorcycle with a sidecar) services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years, and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rose Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase materials needed to provide her service. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. This will be Rose Ann’s 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand her services

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is from the village of Barangay 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Mila joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. Mila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kirinkai Ole

texts.en:
Kirinkai Ole N. is 48 years old and married to Pasiyio N.. He supports six people in his family.

Kirinkai farms on his own land, which he has been doing for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET. This will be his first loan,  which he is planning to spend on fertilizer and chemicals to treat his wheat crop.  He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kirinkai's dream is to practice large-scale farming, attain financial independence and improve the living standard of his family.

He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for his wheat crop

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de  Yryvukua.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, cría de animales etc. 
Este comité ya están en su 2do ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y  unión entres las compañeras.
Maria Librada A. F. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene  25 años de edad, con 2 hijos, es muy emprendedora, están en su 1er ciclo y gracias al Crédito y con la ayuda de su esposo Elvio  ahora ya tiene su propio quiosco, y cría de animales como, chancho, gallina etc. 
Pero en especial ella se dedica a la cría de cerdo, y solicita el préstamo para la ya que desea construir mejores porquerizas y de esa manera también su producción.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee is composed of several neighbors from Yryvukua.  All of the members are involved in independent activities like sales, fast food preparation, raising small farm animals, etc.

They are already in their second cycle and during all this time they have shown punctuality, solidarity and unity among themselves.

María Librada A. F. is group President.  She is 25 years old and has two children.  She is very enterprising.  She is in her first cycle and thanks to the loan and help from her husband, Elvio, she now has her own kiosk and she raises animals like pigs, chickens, etc. But, her specialty is raising pigs and she’s asking for the loan because she wants to build better pigsties thus increasing production.

loans.use: To buy mesh to build pigsties.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Victoria tiene 58 años, es madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos, ella tiene unos pequeños negocios de venta de cosméticos y tejidos, ella distribuye sus productos acredito a sus amigas, vecinos y familiares, quienes les pagan a fines de cada mes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Victoria desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Victoria que espera recibir $ 200 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar cosméticos y lana para sus tejidos. 

Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the communal bank called "Juntas y Unidas", (Together and United), an association in the city of Cusco where she lives.  Cusco is a charming city from the time of the ancient Incas.  Victoria is 58 years old and a single parent to her 4 children.  Victoria has a few small businesses selling cosmetics and fabrics.  She sells her products to her friends, neighbors and acquaintances, who all pay her at the end of each month.   It's been several years now since she's run her businesses and things have been going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.   Victoria is a hardworking and responsible mother.  With the new loan, she plans to grow her businesses by purchasing more cosmetics and wool for her fabrics.   Victoria appreciates the opportunity the communal bank provides to her, and she commits to comply with her payment schedule.

loans.use: Victoria will use the money to purchase cosmetics and wool to help grow her businesses.

loans.name: Ana Ersidia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 34 años D. edad, es empleada y además comercializa ganado, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, el mayor D. 15 años y el menor D. 6 años D. edad, residen en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, su negocio consiste en la compra y venta D. ganado su estrategia es comprar cuando esta barato el precio y los alimentan hasta que los precios suben para poder venderlos.
Ella quiere comprar más ganado para realizarlo solicita un préstamo y poder hacer la compra; con esta ayuda aumentara el número D. animales para alimentar y comercializar con la posibilidad D. obtener mejores ganancias.
El sueño D. Ana es ser una comerciante D. ganado en granD., estabilizar su condición económica y seguir con mucho entusiasmo progresando para mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, is employed; she also raises cattle.  She lives with her husband and four children.  The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 6.  They live in Jiquilisco, Usulután department.  Her business consists in buying and selling cattle.  Her strategy consists in buying when the price is low, fattening them up and then selling them when prices rise.

She wants to buy more cattle so requested a loan to do so.  This help will make it possible for her to increase herd size to raise leading to the possibility of better profits.

Ana’s dream is to be a large cattle merchant, to stabilize her economic situation and to continue making progress with much enthusiasm to improve daily.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Khandjamts

texts.en:
Khandjamts is 43 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She and her family live in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter, Subderdene 21, is unemployed, and looking after her child at home. Her second daughter, Oyunsubd, 19, works at a construction company and the youngest son, Bayandun, 18, stays at home.

Khandjamts operates a rented stall at the market, selling construction materials. She has been operating this business since 2000. Her husband is a plumber and also helps with his wife’s business. Over the years, Khandjamts has gained a lot of experience. She is a very helpful person with a good personality. This year she is planning to purchase a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, for her eldest daughter. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to increase current assets in her business.

loans.use: to increase current assets in her business

loans.name: Ohiniko

texts.fr: Ohiniko est marié et a 3 enfants.  Il est âgé de  36ans. IL est cuisinier de profession mais a créé  un restaurant que lui-même gère.  Il achète les ingrédients  au grand marché de Lomé et revient  préparer dans le bar dans le quartier Bè. IL sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de spaghetti, 8 cartons de lait et 5 cartons de tomates en boite pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Ohiniko is married and has three children. He is 36 years old. He is a chef by trade and has an eatery which he manages himself. He purchases the ingredients at the big market of Lomé and cooks them in the bar of the Bè district. He is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 boxes of pasta, eight boxes of milk and five boxes of canned tomatoes in order to be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est créé depuis 3 ans et demi lors de l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 13 femmes issues du même quartier. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TAKHIKAO

Madame ANTA G. assise au milieu du groupe avec une écharpe blanche sur les épaules et levant le doit est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de mil et d'arachides

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettrons de participer à la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple l'habillement des enfants et leur santé
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM was created three and a half years ago at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Takhikao, to which it belongs. It consists of 13 women from the same neighborhood. 

Mrs. Anta G. is the head of the group. She is seen sitting in the center with a white scarf on her shoulders and lifting her finger. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She makes a living by selling millet and peanuts.

With her new loan, she will increase her stocks and bolster her profits, which will allow her to help provide for the family, including the children’s clothing and healthcare.

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. is married. She has received a junior-high education. She makes rice into porridge and serves it with milk and bread in Abura. She has been selling rice porridge for three years. 

She is asking to use the loan to expand her business by buying more rice, milk and bread to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy land.

loans.use: To buy more rice, milk and bread to cook and sell

loans.name: Morena De Jesús

texts.es: Morena de Jesús G. R. 41 años de edad, reside en Suchitoto, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, una mujer muy emprendedora, la cual trabaja muy duro por salir adelante junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante, y así mismo vive junto a su hijo de 15 años de edad.  Morena es una mujer quien desea darle lo mejor a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora quien solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, cal para la elaboración de tortillas, lo cual le permitirá a Morena contar con más productos para vender y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Morena de Jesús G. R. is 41 years old and resides in Suchitoto, which is located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She is a very enterprising woman who works hard so that she and her family can get ahead. Her family consists of her husband, who works as a security guard, and her 15 year old son. Morena is a woman who wants to provide the best for her family, so she prepares and sells tortillas out of her home.

She is a hardworking individual who is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of corn and lime for making tortillas. This will enable Morena to have more product to sell and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase corn & lime for making tortillas

loans.name: Luzmabel

texts.en:
Luzmabel A. is a 57-year-old single woman from the city of Cebedo St. in Ozamiz City. Luzmabel has 2 school-age children. To earn a living, Luzmabel owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from operating a motor transport service. Luzmabel has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2011, Luzmabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she hopes to be better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Luzmabel is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP ($475), which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service for her customers. This loan would be her first loan taken from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is primarily comprised of farmers, fishermen and women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve her business and to provide better service by repairing her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El  Sr A. labora como técnico en sonido es casado tiene  dos persona a su cargo, es el octavo crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia las oportunidad que le  han brinda esta institución porque ha mejorado su nivel de vida,  este  desembolso lo ocupara  para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para hacer pared de su vivienda.
texts.en: This client is married and has 2 dependent children.  This is his 8th loan with CEPRODEL, and he is grateful for the opportunities that this institution has provided him because he has improved his standard of living.  With this loan he will buy construction materials such as: cement blocks, cement, sand, steel, gravel, braces, wire and labor to make a wall around his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Nueva Asunción Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva, que tiene como presidenta la señora Palmeira.   

La señora Palmeira, indica que trabajo con Pro Mujer doce ciclos asumiendo la responsabilidad de la presidencia de la A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN” en esta ocación. Ella nos cuenta que inicio su negocio hace quince años, mediante la compra y venta de muebles usados, donde le ofrecieron la venta de películas por mayor; desde entonces trabaja con este negocio.

Con el crédito que ahora sacara piensa ampliar su mercadería de venta de películas, las que compra en el Desaguadero (región fronteriza entre Bolivia y Perú); estas películas las venderá en la feria de la 16 de Julio, los días jueves y domingo, todo el día. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda para apoyar a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos, dos de ellos son casados y aún vive con siete.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la enseñanza de manejo de dinero, no gastar y como aumentar el capital; también piensa que la atención del consultorio médico es buena

Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: Venta de fruta, trenzado de manta, venta de películas, inicio de negocio (venta de comida), compra de grifos en Oruro y venta de rellenos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Nueva Asunción” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors. Sra. Palmeira serves as its president.

Sra. Palmeira worked with Pro Mujer for twelve loan cycles prior to assuming her responsibilities as president of the “Nueva Asunción” Communal Association. She says that she started her business fifteen years ago. Palmeira buys and sells used furniture and is also a wholesale vendor of movies.

With this loan, she plans to expand her inventory of movies. She buys these products in Desaguadero (a region located on the border between Bolivia and Peru) and then sells them at the July 16th Fair on Thursdays and Sundays all day. This business enables her to support her family. Palmeira is married and has nine children, two of whom are married while the other seven live with her.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Palmeira said she enjoys learning how to manage her money, limit her spending, and increase her capital. She also believes that the care provided at the health clinic is good.

The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses. These include selling fruit, braiding rugs, selling movies, starting a food business, buying faucets from Oruro, and selling stuffed snacks.

loans.use: To purchase movies to sell.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: Desde hace varios años María Esther lleva vendiendo artículos por catálogo y  mercancía, esta labor le ha permitido tener el sustento diario para ella y su familia, es por esto que ella necesita que su negocio crezca de manera que su calidad de vida pueda mejorar, además de poder incrementar sus ventas y clientes.
texts.en: For several years now, María Esther has been selling catalogue merchandise.  This work has allowed her as well as her family to have daily sustenance.  Because of this she needs the business to grow so that her quality of life can improve as well as increasing sales and number of customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 50 years old and married, with three children.  For nine years, he has been operating a hardware shop.  Besides this, he practices coffee farming.  Peter was previously employed as a clerk.  He decided to go into business so that he would earn enough income to meet his family’s needs.  

With his previous loan from Faulu Kenya, he was able to boost his business.  He has requested 60,000 Kes, which he intends to use to expand his business space.  Peter dreams of growing his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to expand his business premises

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 3 years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells as retailer to her local neighbours. In addition, she also sells green groceries with which she earns her other source of income. Salma faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 60,000 KES, she would like to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Alto Obrajes Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento alto obrajes se fundo en la zona que lleva el mismo nombre, esta compuesto por 8 socias que viven en la misma zona. Ellas fundaron su asociación con la finalidad de poder crecer en sus negocios y en algunos casos abrir un negocio nuevo. Tal es el caso de la Sra. Isidora que se dedica a realizar artesanías de lana e hilo de colores los cuales vende en el centro de la ciudad, con el dinero del crédito comprara lanas e hilos para realizar sus trabajo. Ella vive con sus dos hijos los cuales aun están en etapa escolar por lo que ella debe esforzarse el doble para poder sacar a su familia adelante. Todos los integrantes de la asociación están muy agradecidos con la colaboración y la confianza que se les deposita por lo que están muy seguros de cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en: The Alto Obrajes communal bank was founded in the area of the same name and is composed of 8 members who live there.  They founded their association with the goal of being able to grow their businesses and, in some cases, to start a new one.  That is the case for Isidora, who makes handcrafts out of wool and colored thread.  She sells them in the center of the city. With the money from the loan, she will buy wool and thread for her work.  She lives with her two children, who are still school-aged, which means she needs to work twice as hard to move her family forward.  All of the members of the association are very thankful for the collaboration and the confidence shown them, and they are therefore very sure to meet their repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wool and thread

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is 33 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 40,000 from NWTF to buy a new case and motor for her boat, and more netting to catch fish and crabs. She has been in this business for 13 years and would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a fishing business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. To earn a living, he operates a garbage collection business. He employs four people to assist him in the business.  His business is very competitive, but he is still able to retain his customers due to good service, and he thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer-care skills.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy polythene bags and service his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags and service his vehicle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 54 years old, married and has eight children.  

She has been farming for 13 years. She sells farm produce such as milk and vegetables. Besides that, she sells charcoal and firewood to earn extra income.  

Margaret attests that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business and has more income to cater to her family's needs.
  
Margaret hopes to improve her business and get enough capital to buy a piece of land. She has requested 30,000 KES to buy seeds, chemicals and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy seeds, chemicals and animal feed.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 64 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 niños y vive en el distrito D. Oyotún en Chiclayo. Oyotun es un distrito rural donD. las principales actividades son la ganadería y agricultura, sus pobladores son personas pujantes y trabajadoras.

Dora posee una pequeña bodega en la que venD. golosinas y bebidas. Además se dedica a la venta D. flores en las afueras del cementerio D. su localidad. Dora  cuenta con clientela establecida, y es una mujer D. buenas referencias personales, tiene más D. 10 años D. experiencia en ambos negocios.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su bodega y su puesto D. flores. Además parte del préstamo será utilizado en mejorar el interior D. su casa y en gastos personales que le son D. suma necesidad.
texts.en:
Dora is 64 years old.  She is the mother of 2 children and lives in the Oyotún district in Chiclayo.  Oyotun is a rural district where the main activities are agriculture and raising livestock.  

Dora has a small store where she sells candy and beverages.  In addition, she sells flowers outsiD. the town cemetery.  Dora has an established customer base and good personal references.  She has been working in both businesses for more than 10 years.
