Mrs. Tania buys and sells clothing independently and has regular customers that she frequently shows the latest fashions like sweaters, polos, pants among other items. The member needs the loan to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium, and she is also committed to meet her payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elena Cecilia

texts.es:
Elena vende comida rápida para poder mantener a sus hijos. Vive en una casa de cemento  en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Poco a poco con algunos ahorros compro víveres para vender comida rápida y poder mantener a sus hijos. Ahora tiene su pequeño puesto de comida en donde trabaja todos los días con ayuda de sus hijos. Vende hot dog, salchipapas, (salchichas con papa) papipollos, hamburguesa. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una papas, abastos pero también quiere arreglar su casa comprando con una parte del préstamo cemento. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa para que sus hijos se sientas muy cómodos viviendo en su casa.
texts.en:
Elena sells fast food to support her children.  She lives in a cement house in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran which is characterized by its deteriorating ecosystem.

Little by little with some savings which she had, Elena bought supplies for selling fast food so that she could support her children.  Now she has a little food stall where she works every day with the help of her children.  She sells hot dogs, 'salchipapas' (a fast food made from thinly-sliced, pan-fried sausage or hot dog, french fries and condiments), 'papipollos' (a similar fast food but with chicken) and hamburgers.  She would like to continue with her business and for that reason she would like to use her loan to buy potatoes and provisions but she would also like to fix her house, using part of the loan to buy cement.

In the future, she would like to finish building her house so that her children feel comfortable living there.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cement

loans.name: Prek

texts.en:
Prek V. is 25 years old, and her husband, Pout Kim Sour, is 26. They work from home making furniture to sell. Most of their output consists of beds and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. 

The couple has one child, still learning in school. This family can earn an average income of $8 per day from their selling.  Prek V. runs her business well from day to day because she has good communication skills with her clients, and she always gets good results in selling her items. 

In order to earn additional profit, she would like to request some capital to purchase wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make beds for sale

loans.name: Kiira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Sunday S. has been in charcoal sales for the last decade in Kiira Town-Mukono. He earns 150,000 UGX monthly. The idea for starting the business came from a close friend. Before that, he was operating a grocery store. To obtain a solid footing in this business, he has had to rely on hard work and a sense of determination. Sunday is happily married with two kids. With this loan, he plans to purchase more bags of charcoal. He belongs to the Kiira development group.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es: Maria Eulalia tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ella vive en una zona que se encuentra algo alejada de la ciudad, por lo que ha sido muy difícil trasladar todos los productos que tiene que ofrecer en los diferentes lugares que recorre, pues va a los mercados, buses, entre otros. Por lo que desea adquirir una buena calidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes para niños. Maria es una mujer bastante activa y que gusta mucho de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en: Maria Eulalia is 35 years old.  She sells clothing for a living.  She lives in an area that is somewhat removed from the city.  Since she travels to the market by bus or other means of transportation, it has been very difficult to transport all of her products to the various locations where she sells them. So, she wants to buy good quality products to offer her customers.  For this reason, she believes it is appropriate to request a loan to buy undergarments, pants, shirts, skirts, and children’s suits.  Maria is an active woman who really enjoys working in order to help her husband get ahead in life. The people who know her hold her in high regard and consider her a confident woman.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and bags of charcoal in Abura. She is a widow responsible for six dependents. She provides for the needs of her dependents with the income she makes from her sales. 

Her loan will be used to acquire extra bags of charcoal for resale. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: To acquire extra bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is 36 years old and married to Ljaz who has a business providing carton packing material like tapes, ribbons etc to different factories and shops. He takes orders from customer and fulfills them on time to earn an income.  

Shahida is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her sons left their education after 5th grade and started work to financially support the family. Her elder son helps his father in his business while the younger one operates a computer sales and services shop. Her daughters are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 
 
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more packing material like adhesive tapes, ribbons, to offer better quality material to his clients to make an extra income.  Shahida is hopeful that through a loan investment, her husband will be able to grow his business  and improve the financial condition of his family.  

Shahida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  She lives in Faisalabad which is a big city in Pakistan known for its textile industry. Her house is located in the area of Mai-de-jughi where she came with her family 10 years ago.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Shahida”.

loans.use: To buy cartons of packing material like adhesive tapes, ribbons etc for selling

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en:
Belenda A. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Belenda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Belenda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, milk, sugar, salt, spices, soft drinks, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Belenda has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belenda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional products to sell. Belenda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Belenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a widow who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a tricycle business. She has two children who are 22 and 26 years old. Amada joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amada has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to use as funds for her business operation so that she can continue to save up for the future, house repair and household expenses. Amada is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Vilma Lizet

texts.es:
la señora Vilma P. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a su familia y a su negocio.
Vilma vende ropa nueva para cama, su producto lo distribuye en su misma comunidad y en aldeas aledañas.
sus ventas son la mayoria al credito,  mantiene un gran numero de clientes que le hacen pedidos de lugares como el Corpus, El Espino y El Triunfo.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa para cama al por mayor y asi obtener mejores precios y mayores ganancias.
su deseo es darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Vilma tiene 45 años de edad y vive en la colonia 21 de septiembre en San Marcos de Colon.
texts.en:
Vilma P. is an enterprising woman who spends her time looking after her family and her business.  Vilma sells new bedclothes.  She distributes her products in her community and neighboring villages.  She makes most of her sales on credit.  She has a large number of customers who make orders with her from places such as El Corpus, El Espino and El Triunfo.

Vilma will use her loan to buy bedclothes wholesale and thereby obtain better prices and more profits.  Her wish is to provide her children with a good quality of life.  Vilma is 45 years old and lives in '21 de septiembre' neighborhood, in San Marcos de Colón.

loans.use: to buy bedclothes

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor de Puquin” tiene 9 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses) entonces tiene 3 años juntos como grupo,  el banco comunal está conformado por personas humildes y colaboradores. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en los diferentes distritos de la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es una de las ciudades más visitadas de nuestro país. El Cusco cuenta con una infinidad de atractivos turísticos cercanos que han encantado al mundo entero. Uno de los principales es Sacsayhuamán, que posee murallas de 300 metros de longitud hechas con rocas de hasta 5 metros de altura y 350 toneladas de peso. 

Los socios son personas que se sientes muy orgullosos de vivir en la ciudad del Cusco y aprovechan las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de chicha de jora, comestibles, artesanía, ropa, comida y otros se dedican a brindar servicios.  
 
La socia Georgina nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 40 años de edad. Actualmente, Georgina vive junto con su pareja y sus dos hijos en la ciudad  del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Georgina es la venta de artesanía, ella elaborara tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, mantas y otras cosas más, ella de veces en cuando compra mantas cuando los pedidos de la artesanía son en gran cantidad. En esta oportunidad Georgina requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar materiales como lana y artesanía. 

Los socios que faltan en la foto no están porque pidieron permiso para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Señor de Puquin” (Lord of Puquin) communal bank has been in operation for 9 cycles (each cycle lasts four months); they’ve been together as a group for three years, then.

The communal bank is composed of humble, cooperative people.  The bank meetings take place every thirty days at Cusco’s Asociación Arariwa’s central offices.  Most of the members live in different districts of the city of Cusco.  Cusco is one of our country’s most visited cities.  Cusco has infinity of tourist attractions nearby that have enchanted the entire world.  One of the main ones is Sacsayhuamán that has 300 meter long walls made from stones that can be up to 5 meters tall and weigh 350 tons.

The members are people who are proud to live in Cusco and they take advantage of the opportunities to get ahead and to provide a better future for their children through their own efforts.   The economic activities which some of the members are involved in are:  jora (corn based typical beverage) sales, food sales, crafts sales, clothing and food sales; some are service providers.

Georgina was born in Cusco; she’s 40 years old.  She lives with her spouse and two children in Cusco.  Her main economic activity is crafts sales.  She weaves such items as sweaters, blankets and other things.  Sometimes if her orders are very big she buys blankets.  On this occasion, Georgina needs the loan, as do her fellow members, to increase business capital; she wants to buy wool and crafts.

(The missing members of the photo requested permission to be absent from the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy wool and crafts.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her husband and only daughter in a house in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, age 56, is a retired man and her daughter is a student. She manages a taxi service business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2007. 

Since then she has been able to stabilize her business and is planning to continue her business in the future. Now her monthly net profit is 330,000 MNT with daily earning of 30,000 MNT. Her husband is very supportive with her business and provides much advice on how to improve her service. Altantsetseg herself is a very hardworking and honest woman who provides safe and comfortable service to her customers. She says. "I am thankful to Xacbank for trusting me and lending me some money which helped me to improve my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT of loan to purchase some construction materials to fix her house.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His two older sons, age eight and 14, attend a local secondary school while his two younger daughters go to a kindergarten. 

He manages a transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2001 by transporting garbage to landfill sites. Sometimes he transports imported goods and products to their destination area. Since 2001 he was able to stabilize his business and is planning to continue it in the future. He is a hardworking man who says, "I am doing my best to feed my family. " He is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase auto parts for his truck and to do some repair work.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts and pay for repairs

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es:
Magdali, es casada con el señor José Ariel, con quien procreo  tres hijos Edna Karina de dieciocho  años, linda Areli de trece años y José Ignacio de siete años.

    Ella se dedica  a su pequeño negocio de tacos  en donde lleva dos años y cuatro meses y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son:  carne, tortilla, repollo, tomate, chiles, y así poder elaborarlo como sus clientes lo desean.

    Comenta que fue su mama quien la enseño  a ser dependiente  de sí misma porque cuando se casara  ya sabría dedicarse a un trabajo del cual pudiera  apoyar a su esposo y así lograr  tener ingresos en su hogar.

     Su más grande sueño es salir adelante y con el tiempo tener más grande su taquería así poder apoyar a su hijos estaña estudiando.
texts.en:
Magdali is married to José Ariel, with whom she has three children, Edna Karina, 18, beautiful Areli, 13, and José Ignacio, 7.

She has a small taco business which she has run for 2 years and 4 months. She requests the loan to invest in purchasing ingredients, including meat, tortillas, cabbage, tomatoes and chiles, so she can make her tacos however her customers want them. 

She says it was her mom who taught her to be independent because then when she married she would already know how to work at something and would be able to help her husband and have an income for her household. Her greatest dream is to get ahead and eventually expand her taco business so she can help her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, including meat, tortillas and cabbage, to make tacos.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Lisbeth  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 30 años quien tiene un salón de belleza desde hace tres años  el cual inicio con unos ahorros que tenia de su trabajo en belleza (pistoliados, manicure, pedicure, alisados…etc.) a domicilio. Además de su salón hace dos años tiene una pequeña pulpería.
Ella invertirá para poner aparte su salón con una mejor instalación para comodidad de sus clientas.
texts.en:
Rosa Lisbeth is a hard working, enterprising, 30-year-old woman who has had a beauty salon for the last three years that she started with savings she earned providing in-home beauty services (highlighting, manicure, pedicure, hair straightening, etc).  Aside from her beauty salon, she’s also had a small grocery store for the last two years.

She will invest her loan in making her beauty salon stand-alone for increased comfort of her customers.

loans.use: to make her beauty salon independent.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
For the last two years, Harrison has been operating a greengrocer's shop in Naivasha town. He is 45 years old. He and his wife Grace have seven children.

Harrison was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in full and in good time. He plans to use his new loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his income by selling milk.

In the future, Harrison aspires to buy a transport vehicle.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his income by selling milk.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old and has a fish selling business.  This business has been running for 2 years.  Alicia has 4 children.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Alicia sells his catch at the market.  She works hard to support her family.

Alicia has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and hooks.  She also plans to buy additional fish containers.  In the future, Alicia hopes for her family's life to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and fish containers

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Odalia tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva. Desde hace 7 años trabaja en esta actividad, sale a vender sus productos a diferentes clientes que tiene y que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Así se genera las ganancias y busca como proporcionarles a sus 3 hijos el pan de cada día. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes.
texts.en: Odalia has owned a clothing sales business for 7 years.  She sells her merchandise to her regular customers and they want a wide range of clothing to choose from.  The business is Odalia's main source of income and her means of providing her 3 children with their daily bread.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business: shirts, trousers, skirts, dresses and suits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Juana Micaela

texts.es: Este cliente es profesora de educación primaria tiene 38 años de trabajar para este ministerio, es viuda, tiene dos hijos, se le han financiado nueve crédito los cuales los ha invertido para mejora de vivienda y para la compra de medicamentos, este nuevo crédito lo solicita para la compra de zinc y perlines para cambiarle el techo a su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y con las lluvia se le esta pasando el agua. Dice este cliente sentir muy bien de trabajar con ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado de mucho en su vida familiar.
texts.en: This borrower is a primary school teacher who has worked for the education ministry for 38 years. She is a widow and has two children. She has taken out nine loans, which she has invested in home improvements and to buy medications. She is requesting this new loan to buy corrugated metal sheets and beams to replace the roof of her home. It is in a very bad state and when it rains, water passes through. This borrower says she feels very good about working with CEPRODEL because it has helped her family life a great deal.

loans.use: to buy beams and corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Daisy Jane

texts.en:
Daisy Jane is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. Daisy Jane has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Daisy Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Daisy Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Seata

texts.en:
Seata is 47 years old and married with six children. Seata owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Seata needs a loan of 2000 Samoa tala (WST) to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Seata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Seata's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married to Helen who is a business woman. They are blessed with one child aged two. James has been running a hotel for the past two years, generating a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family members. 


He is applying for his 4th loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil for his hotel. Anticipated profits from the business will help him venture into dairy farming. His hopes are to educate his child and open a restaurant, while his wife concentrates on dairy farming to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil for his hotel

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
Kadek is 41 years old and lives in Pejarakan, North Bali.  She is married and has three children, aged 25, 17  and 10.  Her two sons are in school and her older son is already married.   Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Kadek often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Kadek is the head of the Melati Putih group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s first loan with MUK.  With the Rp.1,000,000 that Kadek receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after five months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 
Dominga has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Dominga has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rossi-Let Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "ROSSI-LET" est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent de part leur activité. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Lucrèce Ablavi est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Lucrèce Ablavi est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucrèce Ablavi est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, dont un reste encore à sa charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Lucrèce Ablavi a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et à celui de son enfant encore à sa charge, Lucrèce Ablavi mène comme activité la vente des jouets. Lucrèce Ablavi exerce cette activité depuis douze ans. Lucrèce Ablavi s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité surtout à l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Lucrèce Ablavi et les autres membres du groupe "ROSSI-LET" sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group "ROSSI-LET" is composed of three persons who know one another through their work. The representative of this group, by the name of Lucrèce Ablavi, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. With the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, this group is requesting financial support for the first time from ALIDé. 

Lucrèce Ablaviis 54 years old and lives in Benin. She is a widow who has four children. One of the children is still in her care; some are in school. Lucrèce Ablavi has attended middle school. To meet her various needs and those of her child, she has a business selling toys. She has been in this business for twelve years. Her supplies are from one of the markets of Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business, especially as the year-end holiday's approach, as well as satisfying their customers, Lucrèce Ablaviand the other members of the group "ROSSI-LET" are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow their business.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina sells cooked rice in Takoradi. She is married and has three children. She has been in the cooking business for thirteen years. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice and other food items to cook to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and other food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Terimbere Muhinzi Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Désire fait partie du groupe Terimberemuhinzi Zone2. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant de 6 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Désire est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée.  Dans les prochaines années, Désire voudrait agrandir la surface de la culture du riz en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’ d’éduquer et soigner son enfant.
texts.en:
Désiré is part of the Terimbere Muhinzi Zone 2 group. He is 28 years old and is married with a 6-month-old child. His level of education is four years of primary school.

Désiré is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit loan to buy fertilizer for his rice-farming activity.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected seedlings. In coming years, he would like to extend the area devoted to rice farming by acquiring other fields. With the profits he plans to educate and care for his child.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his rice-farming activity.

loans.name: Mariela Rocio

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casada y  tiene dos hijos, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la panadería y venta de vajillas.

Mariela solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de ocho cajas de vajillas (platos, cucharones, tazas, ollas).  Trabaja junto con su esposo, la señora cuenta que su esposo se encarga de comprar las vajillas en Tacna y las venden en Puno.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su casa y carro propio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank "Kapia Marca," located in the Yunguyo province and department of Puno. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She studied secondary education.

She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than four years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevo soles. This money increased her business' capital. She makes a living baking bread and selling dishes.

Mariela is requesting a new loan for S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles. She will invest this money in the purchase of eight boxes of dishes (plates, large spoons, mugs, pots). She works together with her husband. She says that her husband is in charge of buying dishes in Tacna and selling them in Puno.

Her dream for the future is to have her own home and car.

What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the ease of obtaining loans.

loans.use: to buy eight boxes of dishes (plates, large spoons, mugs, pots).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 31 years old and married with four children ages 4 to 14. The two eldest children attend school. He is a moto taxi driver and has been running this business for 1 year. Faustin would like a loan to buy another motorcycle so he can make more profit in his business. He will use any profit to buy a plot of land to build a home on. He dreams of one day owning a car.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme  âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et a 01 enfant.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale depuis 2005.  Elle vend seule dans une boutique et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et  s’occuper mieux de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 33-year-old woman.  She is married to a shopkeeper and has one child.  Akossiwa has been working as a reseller of grocery products since 2005.  She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé and sells alone in a shop.  Akossiwa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products.  She wants to reinvest in the business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 31 years old. She has four children between the ages of nine months and 13 years. 

Esperance has been making clothes for the past three years. She is a tailor. 

With the loan, she will buy more fabrics and thread for making clothes. She plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and thread so she can make more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 28 years old, married with an only child and resides in Tangub City with his family. He operates a motorcycle transportation service in their community, while at the same time working in a private institution to make a living. He has been doing this for many years and he has been able to provide for his family well. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2013 and recently took a loan to purchase spare parts for vehicle maintenance. His plan is to expand his business by having more units of motorcycle in order to have savings for his child's future education.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 40-year old lady with two beautiful children aged 17 and 9 years old. They are her inspiration to keep moving forward every single day. She wants to provide them with a good education and a better life. Viviana worked for a company for some time but she was laid off. She then decided to start selling clothes to make a living for herself and for her children. She started her sales among family and friends, but with time her clientele has grown.

She requires $275USD to buy merchandise, permitting her to increase her inventory especially during this time of year when demand is so high. She needs your support and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Viviana tiene 40 años de edad, tiene dos hermosos hijos de 17 y 9 años y son su inspiración para seguir adelante todos los días; ella quiere ofrecerles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Viviana tenía tiempo trabajando para una empresa, pero se quedo sin empleo por lo que decidió empezar a vender ropa ya que de esta manera podía recibir un ingreso y cuidar de su familia al más tiempo. Comenzó vendiendo entre familiares y amigos, tiempo después fue creciendo el número de sus clientes.

Ella requiere de $275 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita aumentar la cantidad de ropa para vender ya que en estas fechas navideñas su demanda se ha visto incrementada. Ella necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en:
Adalat is a father of 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
He has been engaged in this business since 2004. Having borrowed $400 he started this business.
He bought tea-pots, chairs, tables. His tea-house is a small and he wants to expand the area of his tea-house.
This 36-year-old man needs a loan of $800 to repair a tea-house.

loans.use: To repair a tea-house

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This borrower is 31 years old and lives with his family in Kirkuk. He has a small shop inside Kirkuk market to sell and repair watches. He is young and active and works hard to earn money to develop himself and improve his family life. This borrower is applying for his first loan from AL-Aman to paint his shop and purchase more goods.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy's family has 5 members; her husband grows green dragon plants (for fruit) while she sells fruits at a small market. They borrowed $312.50 from a bank to buy 2 cows. Their children are in school (4th, 5th, &7th classes). Their average income is $ 12.50 per month per person. They want to borrow $ 75 to increase Thuy's capital so as to get more income from the fruit stand to be able to continue their children’s schooling. They plan to pay back the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for Thuy's fruit stand

loans.name: Koim

texts.en:
Mrs. Koim Buntheng is a 51-year-old woman living in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband, 53, and their six children. Koim Buntheng works selling vegetables and earns $2 a day from this activity. Her husband currently earns $1 a day as a farmer.

Koim Buntheng has applied for this loan because she would like to purchase a car for her husband so that he can work transporting clothes from a factory to the wholesalers. The money he will get from this will be very useful additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport clothes from a factory to a wholesaler

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana Maria's husband works selling wood. With this job, they do not make enough to cover their children's expenses. This is why Ana Maria decided to start a business to have extra income for the household, because Ana Maria hopes her 5 children will have a successful future based on schooling. After thinking for a while about which business would work out better for her, she decided to start selling natural products door to door, because she knows there are many people who like these products.

Nowadays she has many clients who ask her for salves and herbs and other products. However, there are some herbs that can only be found in the winter season, and this is why Ana Maria is requesting a loan for US $ 925, which she is sure she can pay in 6 months. She will use this money to buy merchandise that is on sale for a very good price in this season, so she can have it for the whole year.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

El esposo de Ana María se dedica a la venta de madera, y con este trabajo, no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus hijos, es por eso que Ana María decidió poner un negocio para poder tener ingresos extras para el hogar. Puesto que Ana María desea que sus 5 hijos puedan tener un futuro próspero a base de estudios. Después de pensar un tiempo en qué negocio sería el que le funcionaría mejor, decidió comenzar a vender casa por casa productos naturistas, puesto que sabe que hay muchos seguidores de estos productos.

Actualmente tiene muchos clientes que le piden ungüentos, hierbas y otros productos, sin embargo hay hierbas que sólo se consiguen en la temporada de invierno y es por eso que Ana María está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está segura va a poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y este dinero lo utilizará para poder comprar la mercancía, que en esta temporada está en un muy buen precio, para tener en todo el año.

loans.use: Buying herbs that are available in the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his business

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es:
Catherine belongs to the “Líderes Triunfadoras” (Successful Leaders) community bank. She lives in the Callería district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and is the mother of minor children who are dependant on her. She is separated and the income she has isn’t enough to cover the household expenses. For this reason, Katherine decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan, of S./300.00, in motor lubricants.

She currently has a business buying and selling wood. She gets up very early to help her children get ready and then takes them to school. She then goes to the mills in Manantay and seeks out her customers. In the afternoon, she takes care of her children.

With a loan of S/. 3,000.00, which she will pay in 6 months, she will buy a larger quantity of raw material (wood) of different species, such as quillobordon, quinilla, and capirona.

Katerine has been very content since she began working with Manuela Ramos. She feels like a self-realized person in all aspects of her life and she asks that you continue supporting women so that they can learn to value themselves for who they are.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Katerine pertenece al banco comunal Líderes Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr. César Vallejo 368 del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es separada y el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gasto del hogar, es así que Katerine con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en lubricantes de motos. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de madera, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para alistar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela, luego se va a los aserraderos de Manantay en busca de sus clientes. En las tardes se dedica a su sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de materia prima (madera) de las diversas especies como quillobordon, quinilla y capirona. Katerine está muy contenta desde que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos, se siente una mujer realizada en todos los aspectos de su vida y pide que sigan apoyando a las mujeres para que aprendan a valerse por si mismas.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Mrs. Elisabeth Djoné is a 46 year old married woman. She is the mother of 7 children (the oldest is 26 and the youngest 6 years old). Of her 7 children, six are in school. She lives with her husband and some of her children in the village of Mana.

Elisabeth’s main activity is market gardening. She has over ten (10) years of experience in this field and she has mastered all the market gardening methods. In the three hectares she works just behind her house, she grows lettuce, onions, cabbage, chili, tomato, and eggplant. She has also planted a lot of papaya shoots. This production is sold off in the market of Ouelessebougou, a town close to Elisabeth’s village, except for the chili, which are sold in Bamako (the capital of Mali). This activity generates a profit of 120.000 FCFA (~USD 267) per cycle of market gardening (six months period). For each weekly transaction Elisabeth makes an average net profit of 35.000 FCFA 35.000 FCFA (~USD 78) or 140.000 FCFA (~USD 312) per month.

Mrs. Elisabeth Djoné is on her 16th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She started with an interdependent (group) loan in a women’s association before qualifying for an individual loan. All the loans have been properly repaid. Elisabeth is the initiator of the involvement of over 40 women in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso.

With the profit she makes, Elisabeth provides for most of the household expenses and takes care of the school fees of three of her children who are in a secondary school in Bamako (the capital of Mali). Finally, she has been able to buy an animal drawn cart.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

• Madame Elisabeth Djoné est une femme mariée de 46 ans, mère de 07 enfants (le plus âgé à 26 ans et le plus petit à 06 ans). Sur les sept enfants six fréquentent l’école. Elle vit avec son mari et une partie de ses enfants dans le village de Mana.

• Elle exerce le maraîchage comme activité principale. Disposant d’une expérience de plus de dix (10) ans dans le domaine cité, elle maîtrise toutes les techniques du maraîchage. Dans les trois hectares exploités juste derrière sa maison, elle y cultive de la salade, des oignons, des choux, du piment, de la tomate, de l’aubergine. En plus elle a planté beaucoup de pied de Papaye. Cette production est écoulée sur le marché de Ouelessebougou (localité proche du village de résidence d’Elisabeth) sauf pour le piment qui est vendu à Bamako (la capitale du Mali). Cette activité engendre un bénéfice de 120.000 FCFA (~USD 267) par cycle de maraîchage (durée six mois).

Pour chaque opération hebdomadaire, Madame Elisabeth réalise en moyenne un bénéfice net de 35.000 FCFA 35.000 FCFA (~USD 78) soit 140.000 FCFA (~USD 312) par mois.

• Madame Elisabeth Djoné est à son 16e prêt avec l’Institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle a commencé avec le crédit solidaire (Dans une association de femmes) avant d’obtenir un prêt individuel. Tous les prêts se sont correctement dénoués. Elle est à l’origine de l’intégration de plus de 40 femmes dans le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.

• Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle assure l’essentiel des dépenses de la famille et assure les frais d’éducation scolaires de trois de ses enfants qui fréquentent actuellement des écoles supérieures à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Enfin elle a pu acheté une charrette à traction animale.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds (potato and other), gardening tools, fertilizers and manpower for market gardening

loans.name: Murabe

texts.en: Murabe I. lives Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. Rena rented a small booth in Beylagan city bazaar and sells butter, cheese, sour milk etc. She has been engaged in this business more than four years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business selling butter, cheese, and sour milk

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.es:
Teofila, Aleeda and Dora have belonged to the Sumaq Wasi (“Pretty House”) Communal Bank for 6 months.

Teofila lives in a shared house. She is 28 years old and has 1 son of 4 years. Teofila sells food on foot. In addition, Teofila is a cashier in the city transportation department.

On the other hand, Aleeda is a single woman. She is 22 years old and is pregnant. Aleeda prepares decorative chocolates that she sells in institutions. In addition Aleeda has a family business selling wood. With the loan that she will obtain, she plans to fix up a family car for the transportation of the merchandise.

Meanshile Dora also lives in a shared house. She is 32 years old and has 5 children. Dora sells clothes to order. She sells her products to friends and family. In addition Dora works as housemaid in the mornings.

Teofila, Aleeda and Dora need loans of 1000 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of dishes, an oven, rice, sugar, polos, blouses, sweaters and for the repair of the car.

The dreams of Teofila, Aleeda and Dora are that their children study, to improve their economic situation and to have more supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Teofila, Aleeda y Dora pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que significa “ Casa Bonita” hace 6 meses.

Teofila es conviviente, tiene 28 año y 1 hijo de 4 años, Teofila vende comida de manera ambulatoria. Además Teofila es cobradora en las unidades de transporte urbano.

Por otro lado Aleeda es soltera, tiene 22 años y esta embarazada, Aleeda prepara chocolates artesanales que vende en instituciones. Además Aleeda tiene un negocio familiar de venta de maderas. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado hacer arreglar un carro de su familia para el transporte de la mercadería.

Mientras que Dora es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 5 hijos, Dora vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los vende a amigos y familiares. Además Dora por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar.

Teofila, Aleeda y Dora necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos, cocina, arroz, azúcar, polos, blusas, chompas y para la reparación del carro.

Los sueños de Teofila, Aleeda y Dora son que sus hijos estudien, mejorar su situación económica y surtir más su negocio.

loans.use: To buy dishes, an oven, rice, sugar, polos, blouses, sweaters and for the repair of a car to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Thị Thuỷ

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thị Thuỷ (MS: 09040040), 39 years old, sells grocery. Her husband is a farmer. They have two school aged children. Her daily income is 6-7USD. She is applying for a loan of 125USD to invest in her business. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị In (MS: 0904004), 56 years old, is applying for the same amount to help her “đi chợ”.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị H. Thị Thuỷ (MS: 09040040), năm nay 39 tuổi. Chị làm nghề bán hàng tạp hoá, chồng chị làm ruộng. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 100.000-120.000 VND/ ngày. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để có thêm vốn bán hàng. Cô Nguyễn Thị In (MS: 0904004), năm nay 56 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng ở chợ

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Julio Julião

texts.pt:
Julio is 29 years old and is from Manjacaze in the province of Gaza. He is married and is the father of 2 boys, the oldest of which is 9 and the youngest, 6. Only his oldest son goes to school as in Mozambique children don't start going to school until they are 7 years old.

In 1999 Julio and his family moved to Boane in the province of Maputo, looking for work and to better their quality of life. Initially, Julio worked as a traveling salesman, but in 2001 he decided to open his own stall in front of the main market in Boane. Julio sells various products such as household utensils and some clothes. His most popular products are plates (which he sells at 25 MZN each), spoons (which he sells at 10 MZN each) and drinking glasses (which he sells at between 12.5 MZN and 20 MZN). Julio goes to the capital of Maputo by bus twice a week to buy products. He earns between 300 MZN and 1,000 MZN a week, depending on the season and how much it rains. He earns around 7,800 MZN a month but has not yet managed to start saving any money as he has re-invested everything in his stall.

This will be his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. Prior to this, Julio had a loan of 6,900 MZN from another microcredit institution named Pro-Credit. He used this money to expand his stall. Julio heard of Hluvuku from friends and chose to ask for a loan as Hluvuku is nearer his place of work.

Julio intends to grow and expand his commercial activities and one day build his own fixed store within the market.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer

Julio tem 29 anos e é natural de Manjacaze na província de Gaza. Julio é casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos, o mais velho tem 9 anos e o segundo tem 6 anos. Somente o primeiro estuda, dado que a idade inicial de estudo em Moçambique é 7 anos de idade.

Em 1999 Julio e sua família se mudaram para Boane na província de Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, isto é, de trabalho. Inicialmente Julio trabalhava como vendedor ambulante, mas em 2001 decidiu ter sua própria banca na frente do mercado central de Boane. Julio vende produtos diversos como utensílios domésticos e algumas roupas. Os produtos mais vendidos são os pratos (vende a MTn 25 cada), colheres (vende a MTn 10 cada) e copos, que são vendidos entre MTn 12.5 e MTn 20. Julio vai 2 vezes por semana a capital Maputo para comprar produtos, utilizando-se dos mini-ônibus públicos. Julio tem um rendimento semanal entre MTn 300 e MTn 1,000, dependente muito da estação do ano e das chuvas. Por mês consegue aproximadamente MTn 7,800, mas por enquanto não consegue poupar porque tem investido tudo o que sobra na própria banca.

Este será o primeiro empréstimo de Julio na Hluvuku e com o Kiva. No passado Julio teve um empréstimo de outra instituição de microfinanças chamada Pro-Credit, no valor de MTn 6,900. Este dinheiro foi usado para a ampliação de sua banca. Julio ouviu falar da Hluvuku por amigos e optou por pedir um empréstimo por ser mais perto de onde trabalha.

Julio tem por objetivo crescer e ampliar sua atividade comercial, um dia construindo o seu próprio estabelecimento fixo dentro de um mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of products for sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 56 year old business woman. She is married with four children. Currently, two of them have successfully completed teacher training school. She has been a seamstress for twenty years. She sews all forms of womans clothes with various kinds of styles that suit the tastes of her customers like kabas and slits, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. She also sells clothing materials and trains two apprentices in sewing. She would like to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, and thimbles to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to provide her daughter with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called Royal Priesthood Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans.  Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount. Janet is the photograph standing and wearing green outfit with one of her apprentices.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing material

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is 48 years old. She is a wife and the mother of seven children, six of whom are stepchildren, and all of whom are currently in school. 

Patricia has been selling rice and soft drinks at a bus stop in Obuasi, Ghana for the past seven years. She has been very resourceful and support her husband in taking care of the family. She believes in hard work.

Patricia wants to use the loan to buy more rice and soft drinks to serve her customers and to earn her more income. She is a member of the "Nyame na aye" trust group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Djidja (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq ( 5 ) femmes du groupe Djidia ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent en générale dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et soeurs et enfants  dans le village de Farakala sous préfecture de Nièna région de sikasso ( République du Mali).
Elles ont une activité économique qui tourne essentiellement autour du commerce de tissus et divers articles (pains, lait en poudre, sucre etc.). Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe Djidia sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent achèter, 4 pièces de tissus (pour homme et pour femmes), 25 kg de sucre, 5 kg de lait en poudre, 10 miches de pains. Elles s’approvisionnent en articles de boutique tel le sucre et le lait auprès des forains venant de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et quant aux tissus à Sikasso auprès de grossistes du grand marché. Ces produits sont revendus sur place au  village et dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants en détail et au comptant généralement à une clientèle constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de la localité. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  aider les maris dans les dépenses de la famille et injecter le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the Djidia group are 38 years old on average, have on average 3 children, and live in general in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sisters and children in the village of Farakala, Sous-Prefecture of Nièna, Sikasso region (Republic of Mali).

For the most part, they sell cloth and various other articles (bread, powdered milk, sugar, etc.). They met each other because of links of neighborhood and family ties. The members of the Djidia group are on their ninth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso; all the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, they intend to buy 4 lengths of cloth (for men and women), 25 kg of sugar,5 kg of powdered milk, and 10 loaves of bread. They buy items generally sold in stores such as sugar and milk from itinerant salespeople who come from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) to the weekly markets and as for cloth, they purchase it in Sikasso from wholesalers of the big open-air market. These products are re-sold where they live in the village and in the weekly markets of surrounding villages, retail and for cash, generally to a clientele constituted of all the social ranks of the area.

They hope to make a profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be used to help their husbands with family expenses, re-investing any remainder into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth and various items for re-sale

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia F., 26 and married with two children, has three years of experience in the fish business, selling to the village and general public three days per week. She has received one previous loan from SPBD, her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.  

Malia expects her weekly net cash flow to soon rise to $187,  and any additional earnings that arise from her loan request will be reinvested in her business and contribute to the renovation of her home.

loans.use: To purchase fishing rods, spears, a canoe, and cement for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour, cheese, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Robier

texts.en:
Robier is a 40-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Robier owns a restaurant and a wood-fired bakery. He sells sandwiches and "mankoucheh". A "mankoucheh" looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Robier requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Masjmoua in order to purchase flour and raw materials. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Robier expects from the loan that it will help him improve his capital in the shop. He is very knowledgeable in the restaurant business. He plans in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: Robier needs the loan to purchase flour and raw materials

loans.name: Dani Justina

texts.es:
La señora Dani es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” del distrito, provincia  y departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años de edad, es separada y madre de 4 hijos estudiantes que mantiene económicamente. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 compró productos de medicina natural para venderlos en su quiosco. Nos cuenta que inició su negocio hace 8 años en un quiosco y hace 3 años tomó en alquiler el local donde labora actualmente.  
Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más mercadería para ser vendida en las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.
Dani desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Dani is a member of the "Flor de Canela" Community Bank in Puno. She is 41 years old, is separated, and is the mother of 4 school-aged children whom she supports. With her first S/. 300 loan, she purchased natural medicinal products to sell at her kiosk. She says that she started her business 8 years ago in a kiosk, and 3 years ago she rented the place where she currently works. With this S/. 500 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase more merchandise to sell for Christmas and New Year's. Dani wants to keep working to support her children in their studies so that they can have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more natural medicines

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. is 51 years old, a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She makes a living as a rice cultivator, while her husband, Chin Thol, 53, works with her. He also catches fishes for his wife to sell at the local market and he depends on fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. He began his businesses a long time ago, and currently earns average of $2.50 per day.

The couple has five children. Two of them are single and three are married. Two of their children are employed: one is working as a security guard and another one is a mushroom grower. To make the family's transportation easier, S. needs a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: E. is 58 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year during the dry season and rainy season. She is widowed and is the mother of three children. All of her children are single. To help the family, three of her children are employed. One of her employed daughters is running a small grocery store. To earn additional income, E. is requesting a loan for her daughter so she can buy more grocery inventory for sale.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Mirtha Marisol

texts.es:
Mirtha   es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Mirtha es casada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Mirtha se dedica a la elaboración de papa seca (papa sancochada y secada al sol), la papa lo compra de los productores, cuenta con un local alquilado en donde procesa la papa, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima.
Mirtha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Mirtha sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the Legioncito cooperative bank. Mirtha is married, 38 years old, and has one daughter. Mirtha dedicates herself to making dried potatoes (parboiled, then dried in the sun). She buys the potatoes from the producers. She has a rented location where she processes the potatoes, and she sells her products in the city of Lima. Mirtha needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of potatoes. Mirtha dreams with improving her business and continue educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potatoes.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is 44, married and lives in Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a driver and mechanic. She has six children and five of them are in school. At first, she was just a mere housewife, taking care of her husband and children. Later on, she grabbed the opportunity of having vacant land at the back of their house. After joining Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in April, 2008, the idea of planting vegetables cropped up.

Hard work is the key for success, that’s what Mrs. D. remembers, for her nothing is impossible. During her free time, she is planting vegetables. Now she applies for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers. She’s hoping that someday, she could deliver her vegetables to other places. Seeing all her children finish their studies will be a great achievement for her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her garden

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka has been an animal keeper and has owned a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Salmina group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.

She is requesting her third loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwaka is 45 years old, married, and has five children: ages 22, 18, 16, 11 and 8.

loans.use: To add to her current stock

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio B., es un hombre que trabaja  desde muy joven para apoyar a su familia, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia. El se desempeña como recamarero desde hace cinco años, su trabajo anterior era de vigilante y también trabajaba de albañil por que todo ingreso es útil para su familia. Ya que su anhelo es poder darle una casa digna. Con este crédito va  a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer sus proyecciones realidad, a futuro espera poder seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
José Antonio B. has worked since very young to support his family. He is 38 years old and lives in stage 4 of the Hialeah neighborhood in the city of Managua. His wife has a 9-year old child that is in school. He has gotten by as a housekeeper for five years. His previous work was in security, and he also was working in construction because any income helps his family. His desire is to be able to give them a decent home. With this loan, he is going to buy construction materials to build a room. He gives thanks to the institution for making his projections a reality. In the future he hopes to continue making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to construct a room

loans.name: Msimu

texts.en:
For the last year, Msimu has owned a small firewood store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours. She belongs to the Tujikomboe group loan.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood to add to her current stock, hoping to expand her business. She is hopes to increase her profit through this loan so that she can grow her business and save money for future use.

Msimu is 27 years old and married, and she has three children, ages three, six, and nine.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to add to her current stock

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 21 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive sola en una cuarto que alquiló cuando llego a Juliaca desde su natal Cabana (Distrito de Puno) y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, es una actividad muy rentable y divertida, ya que tiene muchas clientas a quienes venderle y con quienes disfruta mucho conversando, sale todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, y con su bolsa repleta de cosméticos comienza su venta diaria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre qué crema les harán mejor o qué colores les darán mayor realce a su rostro. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y espera en el futuro pueda tener una tienda de productos de belleza, donde pueda ofrecer con mayor comodidad todos sus productos, ya que lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol. Este es el primer préstamo de Elsa con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que desea obtener más créditos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos de belleza, y así podrá incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Elsa is 21 years old, is a young very hardworking person, and lives alone in a room she rented when she arrived to Juliaca from her hometown of Cabana (District of Puno). What she most wishes is to improve her quality of life. Her business is in the sale of cosmetics; this activity is very fun and profitable given that she enjoys chatting with many of her clients to whom she sells her products. She leaves every morning very early, and with her bag full of cosmetics she begins her daily sales. What she most enjoys about her job is giving her clients advice on what cream will be best for them or what colors will make their faces gleam the most. She has been carrying out this activity for the past 3 years, and hopes to in the future be able to have a beauty shop where she will be able to offer her products more comfortably, given that what she likes the least about her job is that she has to walk all day under the glaring sun. This is Elsa’s first loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and is willing to do so given that she hopes to obtain more loans in the future. In her communal bank she is very responsible. With the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting she will purchase more beauty products and will be able to in this way increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add to her merchandise (beauty products).

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn L. manages a 2-hectare farm. Knowing the topography and the soil profile of their location, she is doing her best to improve the soil conditions of her farm to obtain a high yield. The harvest is mainly intended for their family's use. She uses the excess to earn additional income for the family. 

She needs a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 4 sacks of complete fertilizer and insecticide. She is looking forward to having the best return possible from her loan. She hopes to achieve a better yield of her crops to better support her family.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide credit, training, and insurance coverage services to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sacks of complete fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: By

texts.en: The two low-income people who are standing in a pig stall shown in the picture above are Mrs. By S. and her husband. They are providing some feed for their pigs. By S., 33, is a farmer who raises pigs and plants a few crops to earn a living. Since 1998, she has been taking those sectors. She is married with three kids who attend school, while her husband is the one family leader who helps provide what the family needs by driving a motorbike taxi. By S. hopes to enlarge the size of her investment by using a loan from Kiva in order to build a pigpen and to buy feed and piglets to breed. This family lives in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a pigpen and to buy feed and piglets to breed

loans.name: Хомид

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Хомидчон парень, который торгует на рынке Худжанда  сахаром  в розницу. Он закупает у поставщиков оптом сахар и продаёт в развес в розницу. Хомидчон имеет постоянных клиентов , потому что торгует уже десять лет. На следующий кредит Хомидчон хочет оптом закупить несколько мешков сахара по оптовой цене.На снимке Хомидчон в час пик , когда торговля кипит.

loans.use: на закуп сахара  оптом

loans.name: Inosencia De

texts.es: Inosencia tiene 47 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Teofilo tienen 5 hijos  su vivienda es en la localidad de Entre Ríos en la calle valle hermoso s/n. Nuestra cliente se dedica  al comercio de ropa nueva dentro el mercado central de la localidad y la venta de ganado vacuno, el ganado lo vende a los carniceros de la zona, aproximadamente 3 cabezas al mes, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la empresa termoeléctrica valle hermoso como jardinero. Cuenta con dos operaciones crediticias anteriores en las que demostró, puntualidad y cumplimiento en sus cuotas, el nuevo crédito solicitado destino en la compra de mercadería (ropa nueva).
texts.en:
Inosencia is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Teofilo. They have 5 children and live in the town of Entre Ríos on Valle Hermoso Street. Our client sells clothing at a street market, and has a cattle ranch. She sells approximately 3 head of cattle a month to the butchers in the area. Her husband works as a gardener for the Valle Hermoso Thermoelectric Company. She has had two previous loans, and she demonstrated to be punctual in repaying them. This new loan will be used to purchase merchandise—new clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital—purchase new clothing

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Auxiliadora  es una mujer trabajadora desde joven, ayudaba a su mama para el alimento diario, tiene dos hijos es madre soltera y se ha dedicado en estos siete años a vender ropa usada en su casa como ambulantes para poder apoyar  a sus hijos que estudien, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio lomas de san Judas en la capital de Managua. Sus planes es poder mejorar su vivienda para dar mejor seguridad a sus hijos, este es su octavo crédito en Afodenic y lo quiere para comprar dos pacas en donde viene variedad de ropa para seguir ofertando sus productos y vender mas ya que la ropa es bonita, fina y de bajo costo y a como esta la situación de los Nicaragüense sin empleo ahora se vende bastante. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Auxiliadora V. is a very hard-working woman. When she was young, she used to help out her mother for their daily sustenance. She is now a single mother with two children. For the past 7 years, she has been selling used clothing for a living—both from home and as a street vendor—so that she can support her children’s education. She is 38 years old and lives in the Lomas de San Judas neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her goal is to be able to improve her home so that she can provide a safe environment for her children. This is her eighth loan with Afodenic, and she needs it to purchase two bundles of an assortment of clothing so that she can boost sales because she offers fine-quality clothing at an affordable price. Since some Nicaraguans are unemployed, many are selling things. She gives thanks to this institute for supporting her with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two bundles of secondhand apparel

loans.name: Felipa Tomasa

texts.es: Doña Felipa es originaria del canton Chuisuc del Municipio de Totonicapan ella es de 40 años de edad es casada con tres hijos, cuando ella tenia 18 años inicio su propio negocio en la venta de ropa como ambulante de casa en casa, pero hera muy cansado hace cinco años solicito su punto de venta en el Municipio de San Cristobal Totonicapan, que hasta la fecha todo le marcha de la mejor manera hoy necesita surtir su mercaderia con otro producto para la satisfaccion del cliente.

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es empleada domestica, y también lava ropa en diferentes domicilios, 
Vive en la zona de villa copacabana de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada
El crédito será destinado para capital para iniciar una actividad de comercio ya que venderá harina, arroz, azúcar, etc., al crédito, lo cual  mejorara sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: compra de articulos de primera necesidad, como harina, arroz, azucar, para su venta al crédito.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is 48 years old and married with four children. She sells kerosene at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is determined to improve her business and to lift her family above poverty. She says "Thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine B. is from the village of Batangan , Valencia Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Geraldine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
