Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is married with two children. He runs a shop selling household goods in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He also earns some extra income through small-scale farming. He is requesting a loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings to increase his inventory of sugar, wheat flour, and rice.

In the future, Paul hopes to own more livestock to enable more farming and to become a wholesale supplier of household goods. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: Add to stock of sugar, wheat flour, & rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her bar

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks in the local community known as "suman". These are made of rice with coconut milk wrapped with banana leaf. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and for her children’s education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Roseline Akinyi

texts.en:
Roseline is married to Joseph and they have four children: Reuben, Maxion, Phoebe and Jovan who are 14, 8, 5 and 2 years old, respectively.

Roseline was introduced to KADET by other already existing clients, and she is servicing her first loan with no previous credit history. 

Roseline has been in wholesale and retail shop businesses for three years. With the loan, Roseline will increase her stock of maize and wheat flour in her shop. With the extra profits, Roseline shall further the education of her children and increase the rental houses that she has put up as a side business.

Roseline hopes to own a supermarket, as she believes she is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to increase her stock of maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Ma. Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a tenant on a 2-hectare rice farm. She is a widow and has five children to take care of. Her oldest, who is 27 years old, helps her on the farm. Cynthia needs additional capital so she has applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and others.

loans.use: buying farm inputs for her rice farm

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann C. is from the village of Kinangay in Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Joann is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Joann is starting a motorcycle transportation service.

In 2010, Joann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joann is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to repair her vehicle so she can provide better service. This will be Joann's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Apu Anta Killka Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU ANTA KILLKA”, ellos están ubicados en el distrito de Chinchero a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a socios que se dedican íntegramente a la artesanía casi el 70%, otros son guías de turismo en la zona, tenemos 2 profesoras, uno de los socios es albañil, otro socio carpintero, otra socia vende comida y otra vende salchipapas.  Nuestra socia es la Sra Celsa A., ella tiene 3 hijos y es casada, su esposo es albañil, la socia tiene una tienda de artesanía cerca a la plaza antigua de chinchero, nuestra socia tiene planeado agruparse con otros artesanos y en este grupo ellos darán alojo a los turistas, están realizando el turismo vivencial participativo en la zona de chinchero, tiene a guías de turismo que hablan ingles y explican a los visitantes sobre las costumbres de la zona, los tejidos, artesanía de la zona y la gastronomía, ellos darán hospedaje a los visitantes en sus respectivas casas entonces están implementando todo y también incrementando sus productos para implementar sus negocios. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de artesanía y mejorar su vivienda, para recibir a turistas en su casa y hospedarlos con todas las comodidades posibles.

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the Apu Anta Killka communal bank. They live in the Chinchero district, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The group members work in retail sales. Among the bank members, 70% of the members work completely in handicrafts, others are tour guides in the area, two are teachers, one is a builder, another is a carpenter, another sells food and another sells salchipapas. Celsa A. has 3 children and she is married. Her husband is a builder and she has a handicraft shop near the former plaza of Chinchero. She plans to join together with other artisans and among them, they will provide lodging to tourists. They are active in homestay tourism in the Chinchero area – they have tour guides that speak English and explain the area customs, weavings, handicrafts and gastronomy to the visitors. They will provide lodging for the visitors in their respective homes, thus implementing everything and increasing their products to set up their businesses. Celsa is requesting a loan to set up her handicraft shop and make housing improvements so that she can receive tourists in her home and house them with all of the possible commodities.

All of the group members are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to make their loan repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her handicraft and homestay tourism business

loans.name: Luz Elvira

texts.es: La Sra. Q. T. Luz Elvira de 48 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Cuenta con un hijo a cargo, ya que sus demas hijos son independientes.Tiene casa propia ubicada en el Sector de Cantoral del Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño a logrado adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Elvira Q. T. is 48 years old and a single mother with one dependent child. Her other children are independent. She has her own home in the Cantoral area in the District of Santiago. Luz works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial business. She is an enterprising person who, thanks to her efforts, was able to acquire her own property.

Luz needs a loan to finish the construction of her house. Her dream is to have her entire house finished so that she can finally achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we have provided through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the construction of her home

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is a wife of A. H.. Her husband runs a barber shop where he offers his services, cutting hairs and facial treatments.
He has been in this profession for the back 5 years. Sugran operates her decorative embroider business. She prepares embroider dresses on order. She obtains order from the cloth shops and gets income. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. They both feel happy to have each other in their lives. 

She is applying for a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors and shaving blades) to increase the income of her husband’s barber shop.

loans.use: To buy itmes for barber shop

loans.name: Roem

texts.en: Mrs. Roem S. is a widow with two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. She and her family live in Pratheat-VB village in Kandal province and she was born in 1948. She is a farmer who owns 0.7 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She has a problem because her house is dark and so is difficult to live in. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Roem S. decided to seek a loan to buy an electric machine.

loans.use: To buy an electric machine

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mr. Yin R. generates his daily income by driving a motor-taxi around his community. He started his job in early 2001 and is able to earn US$4 each day.

Yin R. is 40 and is married with three school-aged children, while another one is now married and lives independently. Yin R. has a life partner in his wife who is a sewing laborer in the garment factoR..

The family’s income is not enough to serve daily food frequently. That is why Yin R. desires to invest as a fisherman but this action needs some accessories for fishing. Thus, Yin R. has decided to seek a loan to purchase nets, traps, and a boat to use for his fishing activity.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and a boat to use for his fishing activity

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.ru: Хайдаров Равшанбек проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. Образование среднее. Занимается выпечкой уже 2 года. Кредит берет для приобретения духовки. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить большую прибыль.
texts.en:
Ravshanbek H. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 23 years old, single. He has a secondary education. He has been involved in baking for 2 years. Ravshanbek is requesting this loan for the purchase of an oven. He wants to expand his business and make a big profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an oven

loans.name: Patina

texts.en:
Patina F. is currently in the business of selling both fresh and dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell.  Patina is 39 years old and is widowed.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education,  and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Madame Codou D. est âgée de 53 ans et s'active depuis plus de 10 ans dans la vente de bissap (oseille. Elle reconnait avoir fait ce commerce par l'abondance de cette culture dans la zone de Bambey et le caractère lucratif de la vente à Dakar.Elle sollicite cependant un prêt de 50 000 FCFA pour s'approvionner en bissap
texts.en:
Ms. Codou D., aged 53, has been active for over ten years in selling bissap (dried hibiscus flowers).  She acknowledges being in this business due to the abundance of this produce in the Bambey area and the lucrative aspect of sales in Dakar.   She is however requesting a loan of 50,000 francs CFA for stocking up on bissap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hibiscus flowers (bissap)

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo B. is from the village of Tabinar. He is 39 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Romulo owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods in the local community. Romulo has been engaged in his business for 7 years.

In 2009, Romulo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romulo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which was used as additional capital for his business. Romulo is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Romulo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expansion of the business

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es:
Henry Alberto T. C. tiene 39 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, de 10, 14, 16 y 20 años.

Henry es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Henry trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en ciclo corto: comprar abonos, semillas y fertilizantes. Su sueño es tener una buena producción y pagar los estudios de sus niños.  Enfrenta desafíos en los cultivos, como plaga y langosta. 

Le gusta jugar indoor fútbol.
texts.en:
Henry Alberto T. C. is 39 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. He has 4 children, aged 10, 14, 16 and 20. Henry is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. The group has a total of 20 members, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with harvests after 6 months). This is their first loan with the Cooperative. Henry works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He sells his crops in Ventanas every 6 months. He is requesting the loan to support his short-cycle agricultural work, buying compost, seeds and fertilizers. His dream is to have a good level of production and to pay for his children's studies. He has faced some challenges with his crops, such as pests and locusts. He enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying compost, seeds and fertilizers for his short-cycle crops

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Doña Ángela de 61 años de edad, es una madre esforzada, y de pocos recursos económicos, vive con su familia, siete hijos, su esposo trabaja como técnico de pista.
Desde joven trabaja, como conserje pues es el medio para lograr obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos.
Su casa aun no ha logrado hacer de concreto, es de madera y zinc, y su objetivo es levantar una pared de concreto logrando así un mejor techo
El cual lo hará mediante el financiamiento, que el medio viable a plazos.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: doscientos bloques, dos quintales de hierro, arena, cemento para iniciar la obra.
Gracias al apoyo de su familia y la institución podrá comenzar a mejorar su casa, lo que es de necesidad.
texts.en:
Ángela is 61 years old, is a mother who works very hard, and she has few economic resources. She lives with her family, seven children and a husband who works as a road technician. She has worked as a janitor since she was young. It is her means of getting income to cover the expenses. She still has not managed to make her house in concrete. It is made of wood and zinc sheeting. Her objective is to raise a concrete wall, which will make a better roof. She will do this through the loan, which is viable with installments. She will buy construction materials like 200 blocks, 2 “quintales” (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of iron, sand, and cement to start the work. Thanks to support from her family and the institution she will be able to start improving her house, which is a necessity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like blocks, iron, sand, and cement cemento, to raise a concrete wall and improve her house

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un S., 26, is married and lives with two young children in the Takeo Province. Since 2003, she has been working in a garment factory. She is able to make about $3 USD per day. Her husband is a taxi driver. He earns $5 USD a day.

Un S. would like to take out a loan of $800 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred D. is from the village of D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Mildred is married and has 3 adult children. She owns & operates a business selling seafood like fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mildred joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gnem

texts.en:
Gnem M., 32, is married and lives with her two young children in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$ 1 each day, while her husband is employed as a garment factory worker making US$ 3 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Gnem M. included.

 Since her family spends a lot on transportation, she needs to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo M. lives in the town of Banga. He has been a farmer for 10 years. He is doing this to make a living. He has two children. He is doing his best to be able to provide for the needs of his family. Being a father, all responsibilities are pointed unto him.

His business enables him to earn at least 15,000 Philippines pesos (Php) per harvest. The income he is able to generate from growing rice helps a lot with buying the daily needs for his home. He is also able to support his children in their studies.

At the moment, he would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000. He will use it to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. hace 10 años tuvo la idea D. dedicarse a un negocio y aprovechando además el amplio espacio D. su casa, pudo instalar una tienda D. abarrotes; sin embargo y por motivos familiares no le dedicó el tiempo que necesitaba, por lo que tuvo que cerrar temporalmente. Paralelo a este negocio, tiene otro, que es la venta D. ropa y cubrecamas, las cuales los venD. D. casa en casa, o cuando es para un amigo o familiar, que tenga la seguridad que dicho cliente le va a pagar. Este negocio le ha resultado rentable, debido a que las ventas que tiene son rápidas, además que sus clientes cumplen con las fechas pactadas para pagar por el producto que escogió. Es por esta razón que su deseo es aumentar la cantidad D. mercadería que tiene, asimismo desea reabrir su tienda D. abarrotes. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería en ropa y cubrecamas.
texts.en: Ana is 61 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. Ten years ago she had the idea of starting a business and, taking advantage of the ample space in her home, she was able to set up a grocery store. However, because of family reasons she was not able to dedicate the time she needed to the store, so she had to close it temporarily. Along with this business she also has another one selling clothing and bedspreads, which she sells from home to home or to a friend or relative whom she is sure is going to pay her. This business has become lucrative and her sales have been swift, and her customers have complied with the payment dates for the products they choose. It's for this reason she wishes to increase her product stock and at the same time reopen her grocery store. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very pleased knowing that she has financial support. Furthermore, she likes being part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and stick together, and she is grateful to those people who will be managing the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of more clothing and bedspreads.

loans.use: Stock her business with more clothing and bedspreads to have a wider variety of merchandise to offer her customers

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Luisa tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto es esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio familiar de venta de libros de culturales, ella en su domicilio tiene una empresa en donde venden sus productos a las instituciones privadas y al público en general. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Luisa es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca a delante a su familia. Con su próximo préstamo, Luisa que espera recibir $ 450 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más libros. 
 
Luisa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to the time of the Incas.  It is built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Luisa is 42 years old.  She is married and has three children from the marriage.  She divides her time between her household activities and her small family business selling 'cultural books' (works of literature).  In her home she runs a company which sells her products to private institutions and to the general public.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Luisa is a hard-working and responsible woman who is getting her family ahead in life.  With her loan for $450, Luisa would like to increase her business and buy more books.

Luisa is grateful for the opportunity she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more books

loans.name: M. Lucie

texts.en:
M.Lucie is 44 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children who are between the ages of four and twenty. All her children attend school except the youngest. 

M.Lucie has a shop which is composed of different commodities such as sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and soaps. She has spent eleven years in her business and is requesting this loan to expand her inventory. She has done well from her business, having bought two plots of land, and she would like to have a large shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maizeflour, and wheatflour to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not currently in school. Sarah has a business of a hotel, which she has had for eight years. She also sells charcoal.   

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 200000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a charcoal stove for the hotel and also to buy clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. 

In the future, Sarah hopes to own a retail shop. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which is helping her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To buy a charcoal stove for the hotel and also clothes

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en:
Placidie owns a business that sells fish and also clothes, which she has been doing for 4 years. She is 47 years old, married, and has five children who are between thirteen and twenty-two years old. All her children currently go to school, and her husband is a soldier. 

Her loan will be used to buy more fish. With any profits from the loan she plans to build a residential house. She has a dream to buy a premise for her own business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and fish to sell.

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es: Juana Rafaela tiene 52 años, ella se dedica a una pulpería. Desde hace más de 9 años, pues tenía unos ahorros así fue que empezó con muy pocos productos sus vecinos, amigos y familiares siempre llegaban a buscar lo que ella ofrecía. Juana es una mujer responsable y disfruta de realizar este tipo de trabajo. Ella tiene pensando ampliar su negocio cada día más para que sus clientes puedan apreciar su muy bien sus productos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Rafaela is 52 years old. She runs a general store. More than 9 years ago, she had some savings to start with a few products. Her neighbors, friends and family always came to look for the products that she was offering. Juana is a responsible woman and enjoys the work that she does. She has been thinking of expanding her business more every day so that her customers can enjoy her products. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of candies, sodas, bread, basic grains and others.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is married with three children. She lives and works in Khujand, selling women’s clothing in the central marketplace. Zarrina launched her small venture 8 years ago and has gained much experience and a loyal clientele in the meanwhile. Zarrina is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to increase her working capital. She hopes to continue developing her business and improving her living standards. Zarrina has proved to be a reliable and solvent client.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital to develop her business

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon K., 45, is married with fifteen children whose ages range from one to 28. Eight of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His main products are eggs, maize and beans that are all sold locally. He is also employed as a cook in a local school.

Saimon has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry project. The extra income from this loan will enable him to provide for the basic needs of his family as well as pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the next five years he will be able to be a large-scale poultry farmer.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Mfano Group

texts.en:
Mbassa Y., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with two children. She has been selling food to teachers at a primary school for one year. She works from 4.00am to 10.00am daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mbassa's first loan from Tujujinge Tanzania. She wants a loan in order to increase her capital. Her dream is to open a big cafe/shop.

Mbassa will share this loan with her loan group, Mfano, which has 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the picture Mbassa is in the middle wearing brown and yellow.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Koemsour

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsour S. and her husband, Mr. Champey Ngann, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1989 and have two daughters. 

Koemsour runs a grocery store in her village. She asked for a Kiva loan once to purchase more grocery items to resell. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase more grocery items to respond to her customer’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa familiar, tiene 2 hijos menores, se dedica al servicio de transporte ya que alquila su mototaxi, eligio dedicarse a esta actividad ya que su conyuge tambien es chofer alquila una movilidad la señora tiene la meta de tener otra unidad de transporte para alquilarla y asi obtener mayores ingresos, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, Juana Rosa invertira el dinero en comprar accesorios para mejorar su movilidad
texts.en: Juana Rosa is 25 years old, is in a domestic partnership and lives in her parents home. She has two small children. She works in the transport service industry renting out a mototaxi. She chose to pursue this line of work since her partner also rents a vehicle. Her goal is to have another vehicle to rent and to improve her income and obtain her dreams and objectives. Juana Rosa will invest the money in purchasing accessories to improve her vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to improve her vehicle

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es:
Emilse A. es una mujer D.  55 Años que vive en el   Municipio San  Jacinto  Bolívar, allí ha continuado su tradición cultural En el oficio D. artesanías,  tal como le enseñó su abuela desD. que cumplió sus 15 años y con esta actividad  Emilse ha continuado aunque   mejorada  con nuevas técnicas, aprendidas, que en la actualidad aplica a sus productos como hamacas, mochilas, sombreros todos estos en tejido vertical y con sus propias manos.  Emilse es Viuda  y madre D.  7 hijos  en las edades D. 23 años a 35 años; 6 terminaron sus estudios D. secundaria y una D. ellas  estudia enfermería; todo viven independientes en varias ciudades del país y trabajan.  Emilse es muy trabajadora y D. mente independiente por eso se propone  seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo, con tal D. sentirse productiva y no depender D. sus hijos, aunque ellos se esmeran por ayudarla y están siempre  pendientes D. ella.  Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, y para eso está a un paso D. recibir   un subsidio del gobierno nacional, para completar su mejoramiento.
 Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas para hacer hamacas, bolsos y mochilas; en su negocio aprovecha que  sus hijos viven en las ciudades D.   Barranquilla, Cartagena y Bogotá y  allí ha construido un mercado con su ayuda en la comercialización D.  sus  productos  que mucho gustan y es esta la razón por la cual permanentemente tiene  buenos pedidos en estos momentos y también tener en existencia para exhibirlos y aprovechar la temporada D. semana santa,  lo cual   garantiza la venta D. los productos  por el gran turismo que arroja esta época.  DesD.  que comenzó con F.M.S.D, ha logrado  mantener su negocio y cumplirles a sus clientes con los pedidos, también con sus utilidades ha mejorado su casa construida en  Bahareque  y  palma y está a punto D. terminarla completamente. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital con el que cuenta  y lo mas difícil que ha vivido fue el ser madre soltera  y educar sus 7 hijos ; esto fue todo un desafío. Mientras tanto Emilse sigue creciendo personalmente y empresarialmente  presenta una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor a un 23% , esto la impulsa todos los días a seguir trabajando para    aumentar su capital cada día mas.
texts.en:
Emilse A. is 55 years old and lives in the town of San Jacinto Bolivar, where she continues the cultural tradition of making crafts just as her grandmother taught her when she was 15 years old.  Emilse has continued the art but new and improved techniques she has learned.  She uses her manual technique to make hammocks, backpacks and hats, especially in a vertical weave.

Emilse is a widow and the mother of seven children whose ages range from 23 to 35.  Six of them finished their secondary education and one is now studying to be a nurse.  They all live and work independently in different cities.  Emilse is a hard worker and independent and therefore wants to continue working for a long time so she can feel productive and not have to depend on her children; although they always try to help her and stay in close contact.  Her dream is to remodel her home and she is on the verge of receiving government subsidy to carry out her project.

This is her second loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and her first CrediKiva loan.  She plans to use it to buy materials to make hammocks, bags and backpacks.  She takes advantage of the fact that her children live in the cities of Barranquilla, Cartagena and Bogotá and with their help has put together a customer base for selling her products which are very popular.  This means she has constant orders and also keeps an inventory of her merchandise to display it and take advantage of the Easter tourist season.  Since she began with the foundation she has been able to maintain her business and fill customer orders.  She's also been able to improve the house built in Bahareque y Palma which is almost finished.  

Her greatest challenge is the fact that she does not have a lot of capital.  It has been hard being a single mother and having to educate seven children, a true challenge.  Meanwhile Emilse continues to grow personally and business-wise and has a profit-on-sales rate of 23%.  This is what gives her the daily impulse to continue working to increase her capital day by day.

loans.use: To buy materials to make hammocks, bags and backpacks

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a member of Faulu Kenya under a group.  He joined Faulu Kenya as a businessman who runs a retail shop.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he is able to save his money with the group, share business ideas, and access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  He has employed two people in his business.  Apart from running a retail shop, he operates a van (matatu) transport business.  He hopes to open a supermarket in the future.  He has requested  80,000 Kes to install a kerosene pump.

loans.use: to install kerosene pump

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. Bilal lives with his parents. He started working recently and wants to help his father replace old appliances in the house.

Bilal took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge, a kitchen table and some chairs as now he can repay from his salary.

Bilal appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jabalai refugee camp.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture: fridge and kitchen table and chairs.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona comes from the village of Zanati, Abasha District. She is 52 years old and lives with her 26-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter. Madona works as a teacher in a local school. In addition, she is leading her family’s agricultural activities. Her son and daughter help her.

Madona’s family has small dairy and pig farms. They have three milk cows which give them 15 kg of cheese per week. Cheese is sold to the dairy products retailers. The family also sells calves on the local market. The pig farm consists of one pig and 15 piglets. The piglets are sold locally as well. The family also has 2 hectares of agricultural land where maize and soybean are grown. Half of the harvested corn is sold and the rest is used for feeding the domestic animals. The total monthly income of the family is approximately 1000 laris. 

With 60% of the requested credit, Madona will till and fertilize the land. After cultivation, maize and soybean will be sown. The remaining 40% will be used for renovation of the bathroom in Madona’s house. 

According to Madona’s estimations, she will get 7 tones of corn off the cultivated land:  4 tones will be sold, bringing in approximately 3,200 laris income for the family. With the profit, Madona will renovate other rooms of the house. This will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and purchasing fertilizers, as well as materials and workforce for a bathroom renovation.

loans.name: Hilario Lucas

texts.pt:
Hilario Lucas nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo,Sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade. Estudou ate a 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras para ingressar a faculdade. Vive na casa propria e sustenta seus pais e sobrinho que vivem com ele. 

Nunca saiu de Boane, estudou e iniciou sua carreira profissional neste Distrito. Trabalha como funcionario permanente ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario mensal de 7.997.00mts por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria

Nunca  teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conhece a Hluvuku atraves de um colega que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 22.000mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção(chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, pedras  e outros) para continuar com o melhoramento da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00m e foi para habitação.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro.
Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa, mobilar e iniciar um negocio proprio.
texts.en:
Hilario Lucas was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is single and has a five-year-old son. Hilario finished 12th grade but did not continue with school because he did not have the money to attend college. He lives in his own house and supports his parents and his nephew, who live with him.

Hilario has never left Boane; he went to school and began his professional career in this District. He has worked as a permanent employee for more than five years and has salary of 7,997.00 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He is also able to save some money in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through a coworker who is a customer of this institution. This is Hilario's second loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 22,000 meticais to buy construction material (zinc sheets, cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue improving his house. The earlier loan was for 15,000 meticais and was for housing.

Hilario promises to make his payments on time so he can take out other loans in the future. He intends to ask for new loans so he can finish his house, furnish it and start his own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement, sand, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, age 35, is a single mother with one child.  She sells handicrafts which she has been doing for one year.  The business earns her a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more handicrafts for resale.  Miriam intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her child and hopes to join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 11 years. He is 39 years old, married to Esther and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to lease land where he will plant potatoes during this planting season.  He will sell his produce in the local market.

In the future, Stephen hopes to buy his own piece of land and a lorry, which he will use to transport farm produce from other farmers to Nairobi.

loans.use: To lease land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka comes from the village of Nakhshirghele in the Imereti district. He is 34 years old and lives with his wife, Maya, their 7-year-old daughter, Lika, and his mother. 

Mamuka and Maya head the agricultural business of the family. They have two milk cows and sell approximately 50 kg of cheese per month to local dairy products retailers. Also the family owns 0.7 hectare of agricultural land, where they grow tomatoes, strawberries and other crops. The sell the harvested fruit and vegetables locally. 

Along with working at their own farm, Mamuka and Maya also work in neighborhood farms as milkers. Each of them gets a monthly salary in the amount of 100 GEL. 

With the requested credit, Mamuka plans to renovate the cattle shed, as it is already old and needs to be renovated before winter starts. Otherwise it won’t keep a warm temperature in the winter and the cows may be damaged. 

In the future, Mamuka plans to save and renovate his house to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate the cattle shed.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 7 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en: This group is composed of 5 members who live in the village of Pire, 100 kilometers from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal.  Their main business is selling agricultural products, such as manioc tubers.  They are experienced in this field and have a strong client base.  Their days begin at 8 a.m. and end around 8 p.m.  With this funding, they plan to buy 100 bags of manioc that they will resell at the market.   The income earned from the sale of manioc will enable them to expand their business and to take care of their children’s needs (payment of school fees and medical expenses and helping with home maintenance).

loans.use: To buy manioc, ground nuts and millet

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Gloria es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la ayuda que recibe.  Tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un  hijo de 5 años de edad que este año empezó a estudiar en  escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella para ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar que son muchos hace 7 años se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas ya que es más fresco, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente.  Lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos y de aroma agradable.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.
 
Sus sueños son darle a su hijo lo mejor y que a él nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of traditional products. These include toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), which are famous both inside and outside the country. The members of the Mi Banquito communal bank in that city meet every 15 days.  Gloria is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes that she can get loans easily and receive help.

She is 32 years old, married, and has a 5 year-old son who began school this year. Her husband is a craftsman. In order to help her husband with household expenses (which are many), she has for 7 years sold products from the Avon and Yanbal catalogues (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and  women's accessories).  She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings, since it is cooler then.  She sells door-to-door and also fills orders.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly. Perfumes are what she sells the most, since they are very good and have a nice smell.  She will use this loan to buy perfumes, jewellery, cosmetics and creams. 

Her dream is to provide the best life she can for her son, so that he never lacks anything.

loans.use: To buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics and creams

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Socorro has a food shop that sells pork & chicken barbecue, caldereta & afritada. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Socorro is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Socorro hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making prepared foods.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a farmer who tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 35 years old and married, with 3 children, ages 8, 7 and 6. Tomas grows rice and cassava crops to sell. He works hard to feed his family and send his children to school.

Tomas has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. In the future, Tomas would like to own a bigger farm. He also wants to see his children finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Sophoin (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, and her husband Sin is a farmer. They live in a small village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

They have three children - two sons and one daughter. One child is a construction worker, another is hired to sell desserts and gets paid with fees, and the third child is in school. 

Sophoin is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Sumber Rahayu group is located in the village of Pejarakan, North Bali. This area has very low rainfall, so this dry season  a lot of the farmers' produce was not optimal. Seeing this situation, the Sumber Rahayu group which consists of 10 women, took the initiative to raise pigs in an effort to support the family economy.

Ni Luh, head of the group, 34 years old, has two children. She will uses the loan to buy three piglets to be sold for pork. Pigs are maintained for two months and then are ready for sale. Profits will be used to buy a pig again, so after six months she is ready to make repayment of the loan. She hopes these efforts will help her husband's income, working as a farmer.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Melabu

texts.en:
Melabu is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, aged 33. She has been in farming for seven years and currently employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk and eggs, both sold to the local market. She is married and has six children between 12 and 1 year.

Melabu has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds and boost her poultry farming business. She says her focus is to have more than 700 birds and expand beyond the local markets.

She laments of challenges posed by animal diseases, but she is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans have made life much better. This is her fourth loan request.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Derick

texts.en: Derick is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last nine years, he has been taking photographs to make a living. Previously, he was baking cakes. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy frames, films and batteries.

loans.use: To buy frames, films and batteries

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the providing the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mariam has operated a business selling leso (kanga) for the past six years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transporting her products from point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more pairs of lesos to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because their policies suit low-income earners.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of lesos to sell

loans.name: Perficta

texts.en:
Perficta is 58 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Pines Oroquieta City. Perficta  has a nipa hut business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. 

Perficta is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase bamboo for making nipa huts. Perficta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to increase her capital. Perficta is a hard working mother and takes good care of her family. She is thankful that PMPC can help her with her financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo use for making nipa huts.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
el grupo Dios es Amor esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 3 personas, dos mujeres y un hombre, todos comerciantes, que se dedican a diferentes actividades generadoras de ingresos, la sra. Francisco Suyapa muele maiz para elaborar tortillas, todos los dias se levanta temprano para empezar su produccion de tortillas, dicho alimento se consume en los tres tiempos de comida de muchos hogares en esta zona, tiene muchos clientes ya que el sabor de las tortillas es muy bueno, ademas los precios de venta son accesibles. los otros dos integrantes son doña maria que vende ropa usada y pescado y por ultimo don Paulo que se dedica a vender agua purificada.
el grupo utilizara el credito para comprar leña, maiz, cal, ropa usada, pescados y agua en botes, la meta que ellos mantienen, es ser un grupo muy unido y de esa manera seguir creciendo con sus negocios, salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) is located in the subdivision of Buena Vista in the city of San Lorenzo.  This group consists of three people, two women and one man.  All of them are merchants who engage in different income-generating activities.  Sra. Francisco Suyapa mills corn for making tortillas. Every day she gets up dearly to start making tortillas, which are eaten for all three meals in many homes throughout the area. She has a lot of clients since his tortillas have a very nice flavor, and her prices are good. 

Doña Maria sells used clothing and fish that she transports using her bicycle.  Finally, Don Paulo sells purified water.  

The group will use this loan to buy firewood, corn, lime, used clothing, fish, and bottles of water.  Their goal is to remain a unified group so that they can continue to grow their businesses, move forward, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and lime.

loans.name: Nour Aldeen

texts.en:
Nour Aldeen is a 19-year-old young man, who is one of six brothers and sisters in his family. 

Nour Aldeen is a student in his second year studying how to make electricity extensions in buildings. Now he has applied for a loan to pay his semester tuition so he can continue and get his bachelor's degree and work in his major field.

loans.use: to pay his semester tuition.

loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela, es comerciante de ropa, actualmente vive con su suegra, ella inicio su negocio hace varios años, solamente vende dos días a la semana, lo aprendió de familia, y es su única fuente de ingreso.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa: blusas, faldas, ropa interior,  entre otras prendas que son demandadas por los clientes, su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, expandirse para obtener mayores ganancias. La aspiración de Maricela es crecer a través de prestamos y velar por las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Maricela es a clothes merchant.  She currently lives with her mother-in-law.  She started her business several years ago.  She only sells two days a week.  She learned from her family and it’s her only source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes: blouses, skirts and underwear, among other articles of clothing that are asked for by her customers.  Her goal is to grow in business expanding to earn higher profits.  Maricela hopes to grow through the loans and to watch over her household’s needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes: blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Víctor a sus 27 años de edad es un emprendedor quien inicia desde hace 9 meses su propio negocio de venta de frutas y verduras con el cual pudiera mejorar sus ingresos y trabajar alternamente con su actividad de comerciante que realiza desde hace 10 años. El negocio es atendido medio tiempo por el señor Víctor y medio por una familiar. Con el ánimo de ampliar la oferta de productos ofrecidos en su negocio, el señor Víctor necesita de la compra de productos cárnicos y lácteos para vender a sus clientes. El señor Víctor debe trabajar arduamente para conseguir los recursos para suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia y sus padres quienes son adultos de avanzada edad.
texts.en: Victor, 27, is an entrepreneur who, 9 months ago, started his own business selling fruits and vegetables to increase his income.  He spends part of his time working in this business, and the other part working as a merchant, a trade that he has been involved in for 10 years.  Victor attends to this business half the time, and the rest of the time it is attended to by a relative.  In order to increase the products that he offers in his business, Victor needs to buy meat and dairy products to sell to his customers.  Victor has to work arduously to get the resources he needs to provide the basic necessities to his family and his parents, who are elderly.

loans.use: to stock up his store with meat and dairy products

loans.name: Lluvia Estrellas Tlacoachis Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "lluvia de estrellas Tlacoachis" las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre puesto que para ellos significa una lluvia de esperanza y oportunidades para mejorar su vidas, esta historia es acerca de la señora Noelia ya que es la representante de este grupo, ella cuenta con 27 años de edad y está casada con el señor sinforiano con quien tiene 3 hijos, Camila, Abel y Carlos quienes cursan cuarto y sexto año de primaria y tercer año de preescolar está en tercer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de manteles desde hacen 10 años.

Doña Noelia se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darle una muy buena educación a sus pequeños hijos, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de mas material como son: hilos, estambres, telas, cuadrille, por mayoreo, para así continuar con la elaboración de sus artesanías.

El sueño que ella tiene es el de construir un local para poner su tienda de ropa típica ahí mismo en su casa, y así continuar con sus ventas, tenerla mucho mas surtida y con más variedad de prendas, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ingresos, para con esto poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios ya que así tendrán una buena carrera profesional.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho, su vida y la de su familia también cambiara.

Las integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Juana- bordados, Magdalena-bordados, Sara-bordados, Noelia-bordados y Julia-bordados.
texts.en:
This group is called “Lluvia de Estrellas Tlacoachis.”  The group members decided on this name because for them it represents a downpour of hope and opportunities to improve their lives.

This story is about Noelia who is the group representative.  She’s 27 years old and married to Sinforiano; they have three children, Camila, Abel and Carlos who are in fourth and sixth grade in elementary school and in third year of preschool.  She has been making and selling tablecloths for ten years.

Noelia decided on this business because she says she wanted to find a way to improve her and her family’s quality of life and also give a good education to her little children.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies like: thread, yarn, fabric and quadrilles at wholesale to continue making her crafts.

The dream she has is building a locale at home to install her traditional clothing store in to continue with her sales, to have it much better stocked with more variety of articles of clothing because that way she’ll obtain more and better income to continue supporting her children with their schooling so that they can attain professional careers.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support from the loan she was granted because thanks to it her business will start to improve much; her live and her family’s life will change also.

The members of the group and the activities they carry out are the following: Juana-embroidery, Magdalena, embroidery, Sara, embroidery, Noelia, embroidery and Julia, embroidery.

loans.use: to buy clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El sr. Jhonny vive en la zona norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  vive en la  casa de sus padres con su familia que integra de sus dos hijos ya que esta separada de la esposa que por cuestión de trabajo esta de viaje el Sr.  tiene un taller de carpintería el tiene su taller  hace mas de 2 años y hasta la fecha le va muy bien,  no tiene crédito alguno en ninguna institución financiera, en este momento solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera ya que para fin de año tiene pensado exponer sus muebles en el taller que tiene un pequeña tienda motivo por el cual se solicita el financiamiento para la compra de madera para la fabricación de estos muebles, el sr. Jhonny es una persona muy trabajadora y muy amable, con el futuro desea poder tener una tienda mas grande y poder vender sus muebles a distintas ciudades y poder entregar por mayor según pedidos.
texts.en:
Jhonny lives in the north area of the city of Cochabamba. He lives in his parents' house, with his family, which consists of his two sons, as he is living apart from his wife, who is away due to work. 

He has a carpentry workshop, which he has had for more than two years, and up to now, it has gone very well for him. 

He has not had a loan with any financial institution. At this time, he is applying for a loan to purchase wood, as by the end of the year, he is planning to display his furniture at his workshop, which has a small store area. For this reason, he is applying for the loan to buy wood for making this furniture. 

Jhonny is a very hard-working person and very friendly. In the future he wishes to have a larger store, sell his furniture in various cities, and be able to fill wholesale orders.

loans.use: To buy equipment and wood.

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал, 23 года, не замужем, детей нет, живет с родителями. Она уже 3 года занимается разведением скота, стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря целеустремленности, настойчивости и трудолюбию, Гулжамал сумела развить бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 14,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулжамал есть: 2 коровы. В целях развития своего бизнеса Гулжамал обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Гулжамал планирует вложить в расширение поголовья скота, а также накопить средства на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Gulzhamal is 23 years old, unmarried, childless, and lives with her parents. She has been rearing livestock for three years, having started from a sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her goal-orientedness, perseverance, and hard work, Gulzhamal has managed to develop her business to a monthly income of 14,000 som (KGS). Today on the farm Gulzhamal has two cows.

With the view of developing her business, Gulzhamal has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy a cow. Gulzhamal plans to invest the funds from the loan in the expansion of her herd, and in saving funds for improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is 21 years old and deals in fish buying and selling to the local people in her home area. This is supplemented by selling cocoa oil plus cocoa growing for income generation. She is married with two child,both living in Bundibugyo Uganda, she started fish selling 7 years back to raise income to support the family’s increasing demands. Her family desire is to buy more land and increase cocoa growing and she also has a business dream of expanding fish business and be able make bigger sales and profits. Her business is affected mainly by high transport costs hindering her returns. She is requesting for a loan to buy fish and cocoa oils for selling.

loans.use: to buy fish and cocoa oils for selling

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is married with eight children. She lives in the village of Sogi is close to the CBD of the capital Apia, located on a thin strip of land which has on one side of it a tidal mangrove swamp. Fishing is the main activity in the village. Some of Aiga\'s sons fish for crabs in the mangrove. Usually they can make between USD 20 to USD 35 per day and they will catch about 20 to 30 crabs in a week.

Aiga is pictured in front of her house, with some of her children in the background. The house has no walls which is traditional in Samoa. It is elevated with a timber floor. She has accumulated alot of fill which is out of shot. With her next loan she will use this and cement to build a cement floor for the house. Over time (several years) the house will be further improved - walls, roofing, kitchen etc. It needs to be high because Sogi is low lying and prone to flooding in the wet season. Also high tides can also cause flooding.

Aiga is the secretary of her village lending group which has 18 women

loans.use: Buy Cement to put a cement floor in the house

loans.name: Sahaddin

texts.en:
Sahaddin has 4 years of experience in this business. He has his own cafe. He has many regular clients.He is very communicative person.
Sahaddin is a very good kabob maker.He is 42 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He married and has 3 children.
This business allows Sahaddin to support his family.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy equipment his for cafe.

loans.use: To buy equipment for cafe

loans.name: Rosa Lilia

texts.en:
Rosa started her business of selling footwear two years ago. She is married and has two young children who go to elementary school. She started her business in the need for an extra income because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the family’s expenses and their children’s education. The love to her children and the faithful commitment to her husband are the reasons that push her to work harder.

Now, she needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to supply a big order that she already has, and to continue in the preference of her clients. She promises to repay it over a period of 3 to 6 months. Now is a good time help someone in need, help her!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace dos años Rosa inició su negocio con la venta de calzado, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos que asisten a la escuela primaria, empezó su negocio ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra porque el sueldo que su esposo obtiene como empleado en una empresa es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo son los motivos más grandes que la impulsan a trabajar arduamente.

Ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir un pedido grande que tiene, y continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 51 and works as a day laborer. She also raises chickens and she borrowed $312.50 to grow 200 green dragon plants (for fruit). Phuong's children are in school. One is a student in higher education and other is in the 6th class. Their average income is $12 per month per person.

Phuong wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in her poultry micro-business so that she can get more income from it to pay for her children's schooling. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: raising chickens

loans.name: Sath

texts.en: Mrs. Sath P. is a 29-year-old wife and mother of two. She works as a farmer in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, earning US$3 a day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns US$7 a day. Mrs. Sath P. intends to use the US$500 loan to buy a new car for her husband, which will allow him to improve his transportation business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new car for a transportation business

loans.name: Iyabode

texts.en:
I sell drinks and wine, I need a loan of $400 to enable me buy more crates of drinks and all kinds of wine for sale, says Iyabode A., who lives in Ijanikin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 49 years old, married with 3 children
 nd  has been with LAPO for 3 years. She has 5 years' experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and wine for sale

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
So, how do you like your meat? On the hoof, or a table sized slab? Any way you like it, Hamida and her husband aim to please. Hamida is a mother of 12. (As I told you in another story, there were a lot of babies in Kiyinde.)

At any rate, I talked to him about the butcher business, which they have been in for 10 years. He told me that every week he goes to market to pick 3 cows and one goat for slaughter. He has to travel 200 miles to the north where the Ankole cattle are raised. These are the cattle with tremendous horns curving upwards three to four feet high above their heads. He goes with 5 other butchers from his region and they load up a truck with about 20 cattle.

At time of slaughter, they must sell all the meat within 2 days because there is no refrigeration. They can expect to get about 100 kg of meat on the bone from each cow. With their loan, Hamida and her husband plan to put the money back into their business. They are very friendly and I thoroughly enjoyed visiting with them.

loans.use: Hamida and her husband  will use their loan to buy more cows for their butcher business.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita runs a business selling fish from her home and in the streets.  She sells her fish to the population of Bellavista, San Martin.  The fish she sells includes local species and species from the coast which she buys from a wholesaler.  She is an experienced sales and business woman; she grew up running different businesses with her father.

Tomasita is married and has three children.  Her husband and children are supportive of her business and help with manual labor.  She started the business eight years ago to help her husband earn money and send her children to Universities.  Tomasita never had the opportunity to study but is determined to give all her children a brighter future.  She works very hard to balance her business and domestic work.  It’s not unusual if she gets out of bed at 3 a.m. to start preparing for the day.

A member of the community bank Las Vencedoras, Tomasita is requesting a loan of S/ 1000 to invest into her business, that she will pay off in 6 months.  With the loan she would like to buy the highest quality Tilapia, Badre, Toa, and Bochica.  These fish are favorites of the region and in high demand.  She will also seek to expand the variety of her products and purchase more fish from the coast.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice O. is 54 years old, is married with 5 children, and hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in business since 2000. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina has been a member of the communal bank "Santa Isabel de Acosvinchos" for one year. She is from the Acosvinchos district, which is two hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Josefina is married, 38 years old, and has four children. She bakes traditional regional breads such as the chapla. She performs this work using her mother's oven, and she sells the breads at her store. She runs this small grocery store, while at the same time raising and fattening animals.

Josefina needs a loan for $525 which she will invest in purchasing flour and sugar.

She will use her savings to purchase cattle and to meet any future needs. Josefina dreams of her children becoming professionals, of improving her home, and of growing her bakery business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Josefina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Isabel de Acosvinchos hace 1 año, Josefina es natural del distrito de Acosvinchos que esta ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Josefina es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Josefina elabora panes típicos de la zona como la “chapla”, actividad que realiza en el horno de su mama y lo vende en su tienda. Además tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, también se dedica a la crianza y engorde de animales.

Josefina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y azúcar.

Sus ahorros son para comprar ganado vacuno y alguna necesidad en el futuro. Los sueños de Josefina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su casa y que su panadería crezca.

loans.use: Purchase flour and sugar for her bakery.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
This client is a person who has worked in the public hospital in Managua for 10 years. She is an assistant nurse, is 56-years-old, and is married. Her children are adults and support her economically. Her husband is a taxi driver and also contributes to the financial well-being of their home.

Doña Lucila has a goal in life of seeing her house completed. She hopes that with the effort of everyone in her family and with the support of our institution, she can see this dream fulfilled and have a decent home. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the construction of a porch or terrace. This will allow her family members to have a pleasant place to rest at the end of each day's work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Esta clienta es una persona que labora en un hospital público de Managua desde hace 10 años, ella es enfermera auxiliar, tiene 56 años, es casada, sus hijos son mayores de edad y le apoyan económicamente, la profesión de su esposo es taxista, quien también contribuye con los gastos de la casa.

Doña Lucila tiene como meta de vida ver un día su casa de habitación terminada, espera que con el esfuerzo de toda su familia y el apoyo de nuestra Institución pueda ver realizado su sueño como es tener una vivienda digna. El préstamo que está solicitando Doña Lucila es para invertirlos en la construcción de un porche o terraza. Esto permitirá a sus familiares contar con un lugar agradable para descansar luego de la jornada de trabajo del día.

loans.use: To construct a porch on her home

loans.name: Kiwamirembe Women's Group

texts.en:
N. Jalia’s story is one that cannot go unnoticed. She is the treasurer of Kiwamirembe Women’s group in Mukono and has a retail shop in Kigombya that deals in selling clothes; Bitenge, the Nigerian wear, and suits for ladies that she buys from Kampala mostly on Thursday and Sunday. Her shop also has a fridge for selling sodas and beers.

Jalia is a widow with 4 children of her own as she cares for 3 orphans that have since become her own. These orphans are of no relation to her but she has decided to take them in after their parents (fathers), with the support of their stepmothers deserted them for death, and she does this with the awareness of the Police and the local authorities. She says she does this not for material gains but to help those in need considering what she went through as a child. This is not a story to bring sympathy but to let the world know that such big and kind hearted people still exist. The little she has is shared among themselves as she also pays for their school fees, except 2 children who are still 3 years old. This story is what inspires Jalia to work so hard and she would like to start up an orphanage since child neglect cases are so numerous in her area, and her husband left her enough land for that.

She would like a loan to help with buying 15 crates of soda with half of her loan and the other half for buying suits and bitenge for the shop.

loans.use: Namusoke Jalia  would like a loan to help with buying 15 crates of soda with half of her loan and the other half for buying suits and bitenge for the shop.

loans.name: Mursal
