texts.en: Mursal H. is a 27-year-old man who keeps a food market in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Bilasuvar region. He started the business in 1999, but also works as a policeman. Mursal's monthly salary is about $80 US. Mursal, who lives with his parents and younger brothers, provides the only income for his family. He is applying for $1200 US to expand the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: To increase the number of goods

loans.name: Hilda Senayda

texts.es:
Hello.  My name is Hilda M., and I am dedicated to selling dry, semi-dry and smoked cheese, and cheese curds.  I am 35 years old and I’m married with three children.

My husband is in the United states, which makes it more difficult for me to support my family.  I have sold cheese for three years, and it’s going well for me, but I need higher sales, so I am asking for a loan to purchase more products.  With the mney I earn I will be able to continue raising my children, which is the most important thing in my life.  I need help to move forward.  Thank you!
Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.
hola mi nombre es Hilda M. me dedico a la venta de quesos seco, semi seco, ahumado, quesillo, y cuajada, tengo 35 años de edad estoy casada con tres hijos, mi esposo esta en estados unidos por lo que me toca mas dificil a mi el sustento de mi familia, tengo 3 años de vender quesos y me va bien, pero necesito tener mayores ventas y por eso estoy solicitando credito para poder comprar mas productos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder seguir alimentado mis hijos que es lo mas importante en mi vida. necesito ayuda para poder salir adelante. gracias.

loans.use: Purchasing cheese

loans.name: Bimkubwa's Aman Na Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Bimkubwa is 31 years old. She is a married with two children, ages 7 and 10. She has been a bites (chapati) seller since 2003. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 (US Dollars) in sales.

Bimkubwa hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha.

loans.use: To expand her business by making more bites.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab L. is 38 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vanny Khim, is 40 years old. They live along national road number one, which is about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Moreover, they were married in 1993, and they have three sons, two of whom are enrolled in a local school.

Leab has been selling flowers since she was a young girl. In fact, she grows many types of flowers on her farm near the house to then sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Meanwhile, Vanny has worked as a mason ever since they married. At present, Leab transports her flowers to the market by motor taxi, so she wants to buy a motorbike to drive herself to the market. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase one motorbike to transport her flowers to sell in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle in order to transport her flowers to the market in Phnom Penh City.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria es madre soltera de dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad, los cuales ya están casados e independiente, tiene 50 años de edad, y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Monseñor Lezcano, doña Maria le ha tocado trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus hijos en sus necesidades, ella tiene una pulpería que desde hace veinte cuatro años administra,  comenzó con dinero propio ya que anteriormente solo vendía verduras ambulante, ahora con la facilidad del crédito ha invertido mas en su negocio. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar productos de consumos y así ofertar variedad de productos a sus clientes. A futuro es incrementar el volumen de ventas y así obtener mejores utilidades, como mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is the single mother of two children of 22 and 25 years of age, who are already married and independent. She is 50 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua that is called Monseñor Lezcano. Maria has had to work from a young age to support her children in their needs. She has a small grocery store that she has administered for the past four years. She started it with her own money as she had previously just sold vegetables as a travelling salesperson. Now with a loan she has invested more in her business. This loan request is to purchase consumable products and in this way offer a variety of products to her clients. In the future she wants to increase the volume of sales and through this obtain better tools as well as improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Tusabe Mukama Group

texts.en:
Resty S. is a 31-year-old married mother with two children, aged 8 and 10. She also cares for her deceased sister's four orphans and her brother's two children. Resty operates a hair salon in her home. Her specialty is applying braid extensions that she buys in bulk quantities each week in Kampala's wholesale markets. All of her business is earned through referrals by existing clients. Resty enrolled in vocational school four years ago to learn her new trade and fulfill her goal of becoming a hairstylist. She began with just a chair in her sitting room; now, thirteen loans later, she has a complete salon attached to her home. Resty uses the proceeds from her loans to purchase braids and other supplies for her shop. Resty services five women on average each week and makes a fixed profit of 10,000 UGX per client. By injecting her earnings back into her business, Resty is on her way to realizing her ambition of building a salon on her village's main street so she can attract more clients, and launching a wholesale hair and beauty distribution business.

Resty was elected chairperson of the Tusabe Mukama lending group because of her leadership skills, business acumen and friendly personality. With a family that includes two children and six orphans, Resty's household depends upon her income to pay for school fees, food and clothing.

loans.use: Purchase braids and other supplies for her shop

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Nanay Flordeliza I. is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Sitio Igcaputol, Tobias Fornier Antique. She is married to Ricardo I. and has two children. Currently, Nanay “Flor” is busy with her small business buying and selling tobacco just to earn the means of living every day. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center. 

Nanay Flor came from a very poor family; she was the sixth of ten children. She was the luckiest among her siblings to attend school because of her determination. Nanay Flor believes that education can lift you from poverty, and that’s why she is now a Day Care teacher who teaches the children to read and write.

Nanay Flor manages her obligation as a teacher and is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business; when she has enough capital, she adds more business in order to gain more income. She hopes to share this with her children and grandchildren. 

Nanay Flor got married at the age of 19, a marriage arranged by her parents. She did not want to marry, but she had no choice but to accept it in respect to her parents. Nanay Flor strives very hard so that what she experienced will not be experienced by her children and grandchildren in the future.

loans.use: Buy and sell tobacco

loans.name: Afosatu

texts.en:
Married with four children who are currently in school, 55-year-old Afosatu M. has produced palm oil, derived from palm nuts, the fruit of the palm tree, for 10 years. She supplies the oil to food vendors to prepare their meals. The driving force behind her hard work is the commitment to providing quality education to her children so that they can enjoy better life opportunities than she did when she was young. 

Afosatu is now requesting a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to enable her to produce larger quantities of oil. She believes this will help her expand her business, thereby raising more income to support her husband’s efforts in providing the children with quality education. She belongs to a community group called “Gyese wo bre” (meaning, unless you work hard) Trust Group, whose members support and guarantee each other’s loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Wossiratou

texts.fr: Wossiratou A. est âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Coiffeuse de profession, elle habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Pour offrir un service de qualité à sa clientèle, Wossiratou espère avec ce crédit acheter un séchoir, des mèches et aussi aménager son salon de coiffure. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de es enfants.
texts.en:
Wossiratou A. is 31 years old, married, and the mother of a young girl. A hairdresser by profession, she lives Lomé, the capital of Togo. To offer quality service to her customers, Wossiratou hopes to use this loan to buy a hair dryer and some hair extensions. She would also like to fix up her salon. This will enable her to earn more, so that she can provide for her children better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair extensions, and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke sells foodstuffs like dried yam and plantain. She hopes to expand her business. She requested a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Romoke is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of food to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Martha es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Martha tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del cementerio de la ciudad en donde vende comida oriental, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para su casa.
Los sueños de Martha son construir su casa y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Los Claveles (“The Carnations”) Cooperative Bank. Martha is married, 27 years old, and has one son. Martha has a restaurant in a rented space, located near the city cemetery. She works alongside her husband selling Asian food. Martha needs a loan of 1,200 soles to invest in the purchase of construction materials for her house. Martha’s dreams are to build her home and have another location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn S. is a villager in Am Pao Prey 2 village in Kandal province. She owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Shou Sien, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice. He faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and he does not have rice seeds to plant yet. Thus, Mrs. Norn S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds so that her husband can grow rice. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sonom

texts.en: B. Sonom lives with his wife and two children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son is unemployed and stays home, and his daughter is a high school student. Using his truck, B. purchases food products from local wholesalers.  He then sells the food by driving to local herder families who do not have everyday access to food markets. With his wife's support, B. launched his business in 2002 with $170 of capital. Since then his business capital has increased to $2000. In the future, B. hopes to live in an apartment with access to hot, running water. He requests a loan to purchase more food products to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Elias Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Elías Ernesto R., tiene la edad de 48 años, reside en el bario Villa Reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 3,16 y 17 años de edad, el se desempeña de albañil y destace de cerdo. El inicio con ayuda de su papa ya que le enseño el oficio para sobresalir adelante, el destace de cerdo ha sido otro ingreso para ayudar  a su familia. Con este crédito va a comprar llantas para su vehiculo ya que las que tiene están en mal estado, este vehiculo es de importancia para su negocio, por el acarreo de la compra de cerdo. Es te es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual es de mucho beneficios ya que gracias a estos prestamos ha podido hacer mejoras  a su casa, con el préstamo anterior pudo hacer el sumidero para instalar el inodoro y estar en mejores condiciones de higiene. Da las gracias a la institución por sus metas alcanzadas.
texts.en:
Elías Ernesto R., 48, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in Managua. He and his wife have three children ages 3, 16, and 17. He is a bricklayer and a pork butcher. He started with his father’s help. His father taught him the trade so that he could get ahead. Butchering pork has been another investment to help his family. With this loan he will buy tires for his vehicle. The ones he has now are in bad condition. This vehicle is important to his business in order to transport the pigs he buys. This is his fifth loan cycle with Afodenic, which is very beneficial. Thanks to these loans he has been able to make improvements to his house. With the last loan he was able to put in the drain to install the toilet and provide better hygienic conditions. He is grateful to the institution for the achievement of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle because the old tires are in bad shape

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 33 years old, married, and has four children aged 13, 10, 6, and 3. She owns a small hotel in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya where she works twelve hours every day. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to improve her business.

Rehema will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Hilda, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo venden ropa variada en la selva ayacuchana a donde viajan cada 15 días. Además Maria vende comida por las tardes en la puerta de su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido para la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar sus negocios e implementar un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank, Faith. Maria is 52 years old, and is married with four children. Maria and her husband sell clothing in the jungles of Ayacucho where they travel to and from every 15 days. Furthermore, Maria sells food at the font door of her house. Maria needs a loan of 900 Soles which is equivalent to $325 to buy various types of clothing. Maria's dream is to better her business and to one day start a new one.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various types of clothing

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en: Yangi R. is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. Yangi is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop and a bar. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Yav

texts.en: Yav S. is 27 and is a farmer. To earn a living, she raises many pigs in a pigpen next to her house, and she cultivates a rice crop during the rice-growing season. In addition, her husband works repairing vehicles at a store near their home. They have two young children who go to school. Yav S. started her investment  a long time ago because she saw that it is a profitable one and has provided many benefits to meet her family's needs. She proposes to use her loan to buy more pigs to continue breeding.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to continue breeding.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод Урунов 1984 года рождения . Работает мастером ремонтных работ. Ремонт проводит сам как частник.   У него есть также  работники которые помогают штукатурить и  проводить ремонты.  Кредит получает для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Он жениться, но накопленная прибыль не достаточно для проведения свадьбы. Родители часть покупки и  проведения мероприятия взяли на себя. НО этого было мало и он решил поучить кредит . Узнав что так ему удобно он получил кредит.

loans.use: weedding party

loans.name: Diénabou Messin

texts.fr: Diénabou Messin Sané, 33 ans, divorcée, est mère de trois enfants dont elle a entièrement la charge. Elle est mebre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 6 ans. Elle a une bonne expérience en matière de petit commerce pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plus de dix ans. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Diénabou Messin Sané, age 33, is divorced and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 for six years. She has good experience regarding small-scale commerce for having practiced it for over ten years. The profits realized from her business enable her to support her offspring and to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business selling palm oil

loans.name: Francisco Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Ramón M. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura el cuál se ha destacado en la siembra de maíz y frijol en su tierra y siendo esta la actividad que le permite llevar el apoyo económico a su hogar por lo que siempre requiere tener una buena cosecha.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertir en la siembra del maíz y del frijol ya que le es de necesidad invertir en ello para así continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde familia que tanto requiere de él.
texts.en:
Francisco Ramon M. is an agriculturer, sowing and harvesting corn and beans on his land. With this business he is able to financially support his family, and that is why it is so important that he always achieve a good harvest.

He has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to invest in his corn and bean plantation. He requires to invest so that he will be able to support his humble family that depends so much on him.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his corn and bean plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy soft drinks, vegetables, oil, lard, cheeses, tortillas, meat, pork and chicken and beef, juices,  churros, condiments, water, sauces, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock her supply of beans, cooking oil, and flour, and to build a stand.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a rice farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children. She wants to be a good mother to all her kids and works hard for their education. Short of financial support for her farming business, she joined CEVI to take advantage of its financial services. She is requesting to borrow Php10,000, which she will use to finance her farm.

Diosdada will be delighted if her loan is granted because she wants her crops to be healthy and produce quality harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is busy managing her store. She is 57 years-old and still has a strong determination in life. Beatriz is happily married to Fernando O.. Her husband cultivates their rice fields and also raises ducks in the village they reside in. The couple are blessed with six children and all of them already have their own families. She is thankful because her children are still helping her in her business. Beatriz wants to expand her store but lacks the capital to do so.  Therefore, she would like to ask for additional capital from KIVA lenders in order to expand and improve her business.  She is asking for Php 5, 000.00. This amount will be a big help towards sustaining their basic needs and for their future welfare. She hopes that she will obtain this amount.

loans.use: Additional capital for store expansion and improvement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, rice, salt, and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lourino Sergio

texts.pt:
Lourino Sérgio B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade. Fez 12ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa da mãe e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Maputo para a vizinha Republica da Africa do sul a procura de emprego em 2006, mais tarde regressa a casa e consegue um emprego como motorista numa das empresas em Boane. Aprendeu a 8 anos numa escola de condução em Maputo, faz um horário único das 7.30h as 15.30h. Para além do Salário, tem também um negócio próprio onde vende cervejas, refrescos e outros produtos. Deste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 500.00mt diário que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Já teve empréstimos no banco PROCREDITO e mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrigerantes, vinhos e outros) para aumentar o volume e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt e 10.500.00mt todos para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de voltar a estudar e solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua obra mobilar a casa e contrair o matrimónio.
texts.en:
Lourino Sérgio was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in the South of Mozambique. He is 31 years old, is single and the father of a 5-year old. He went to school until the 12th grade but didn't graduate due to lack of financial resources. He lives in his mother's house and supports two nephews who live with them.

In 2006, he left Maputo to neighboring South Africa to look for a job and returned home later. He found a job as a driver for a company in Boane. He learned to drive 8 years ago at a driving school in Maputo. He works from 7:30am to 3:30pm. Besides his salary, he has his own business where he sells beer, sodas and other products. His business makes 500.00mt a day which goes towards house expenses and his savings account.

He has requested loans from PROCREDITO bank but decided not to continue to. He came to know about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a member. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, is his third. He intends to purchase supplies (beer, sodas, wine and others) to increase and diversify his inventory. The previous loans were for 7.000.00mt and 10.500.00mt and were used for the same purpose.

In the future, he would like to go back to school and request more loans to finish his contruction, furnish his home and get married.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (beer, sodas and others)

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S. was born in 1982. She is a married woman and a humble mother caring for three young children.

Leng S. works as cleaning staff at the private school and earns a salary of $70 each month which she uses to feed her family. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Recently her husband can’t generate much income because his vehicle has often broken down and needs repair. Thus, Leng S. requested a loan to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky P. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Pinky is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Pinky owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling island souvenir like fish key holders, decorations and printed tshirts  in the local community. Pinky has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Pinky is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pinky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia E. is from the village of Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Alicia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport service. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: To earn a living, Susana D. buys and sells chicken. She is a 40-year-old married woman from Antipolo, Rizal. She and her husband are blessed to have five children. She has been in her business for three years. Susana is a very industrious woman, determined to achieve a better life. Despite hardships caused by poverty, Susana remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her husband makes her life quite meaningful. Susana joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008. She is a member of the Lower Buhanginan Center of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal West Branch. During the course of her membership, she has been noted to be an excellent performer with respect to regular attendance at meetings, loan repayment and projects. She is now seeking her third loan in the amount of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional inventory. With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, Susana is hopeful that her dreams of sending her children to university to complete degrees will be achieved. She also hopes to finish the building of their own house made of concrete. Susana’s desire to give her children a brighter future fuels her dedication to her business. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of chicken

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 35 years old and is married with seven children who are between 3 and 10 years old. She is well-known in the business of selling fruit which she starts very early in the morning, running until late in the evening hours. Claudine is very proud of her business as it allows her to provide daily food for her children.

Although Claudine has been in this business for about ten years, her original investment is still too low to earn enough profits which in turn can be used for further reinvestment in her business, improving her family situation, and saving for a better future. To end this, Claudine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which hopefully will help her to achieve a lot.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Sosorl

texts.en: Mr. Sosorl Y., 31, lives in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chanty Mou, are tailors and have a two-year old child. They have a problem because their house does not have gate. So, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Sosorl Y. is asking ask for a loan to construct a gate to protect his house.

loans.use: To construct a gate

loans.name: Rozbek

texts.en:
Rozbek is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Rozbek is a very hardworking and optimistic person. Rozbek worked as a driver between 1998 and 2004 for the Altain zam company. In 2004 he purchased a car and began to provide transportation services independently. 

During the spring Rozbek plants vegetables in Buyant district. Rozbek learned to plant vegetables from his parents at a very early age. He harvests his vegetables in the autumn, and uses them both to feed his family and to sell for a profit. Rozbek saves some of the vegetables in a warehouse to sell during the spring when they will command a higher price. 

His wife, Mongolhan, has been operating a cafe at a local market for nine years and has built a loyal customer base. Rozbek's oldest two daughters attend local secondary schools. Rozbek's family and businesses are important to him. Rozbek says, “I have been planning to improve our house and yard for my family. In addition, I am planning to save money for my three children's education fees. ” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase four tires and other necessary equipment for his car and to purchase new table and chairs for his wife's cafe.

loans.use: Tires and equipment for vehicle; table and chairs for cafe

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn  vive en la zona El Tejar, ubicada en una zona populosa de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es casada, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer propietario de un taxi y sus pequeños hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar

Trabaja  como comerciante de productos para el hogar, como ser edredones, camas y otros, los cuales lo adquiere en la frontera y lo vende en la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción para continuar con las mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, y así mejorar su calidad de vida. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro,  la  evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Evelyn lives in El Tejar, a densely populated neighborhood in La Paz. She is married and lives with her husband and school-aged children in their own home. Her husband drives his own taxi. Evelyn sells household items, including comforters and beds, which she buys at the border and sells in the city. She will use this loan to purchase construction materials to continue making improvements to her home and thereby improve her standard of living. This is her first loan with IMPRO, but she has been evaluated as being qualified to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed and labor

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina joined ASHI, a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2009. When she received her previous loan, she invested the money in her food-vending business and later expanded the business with more foods.

Now on her 2nd loan, Gina requested 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders at home.

Gina dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her ready-to-eat food to earn a much larger income. She hopes to have a successful business that can provide her with a good life that is moved out of poverty.

Gina is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her food-vending business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco López Chavarría es un señor de 42  años de edad quien vive con su esposa y su hija en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semi montañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio. 

Don Francisco  y su familia siempre se han  dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que la demanda es bastante grande alta en la comunidad, y hoy  sus productos se venden a buen precio en especial la Leche. Comenta que gracias a este negocio tiene la posibilidad de enviar a su hijo al colegio.


Actualmente don Francisco    desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢618.000 (seiscientos dieciocho    mil colones), para comprar  3  vacas para doble propósito, y compra los materiales necesarios para mejorar las condiciones de su corral, incluyendo alambre y semillas de pasto.

Don Francisco  es socio  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisco López Chavarría is a 42 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and daughter in the community of Canalete, which is located in the town of Upala in Alajuela Province. This place is semi-mountainous and the local business activities are mostly livestock breeding and agriculture. The community provides a great opportunity for developing and establishing microenterprises in the agriculture and retail sectors.

Don Francisco and his family have always engaged in livestock breeding for the purposes of producing meat and milk. He says this is a very good business to be in since there is high demand in the community. Today his products sell at a good price, especially the milk. Thanks to this business, he says he has the chance to send his daughter to college.

At the moment, Don Francisco wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 618,000 CRC so that he can buy three heads of cattle for meat and milk production. He will also buy materials needed for improving the conditions of his corral, including wire and grass seeds.

Don Francisco is a member of the Canalete Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He also plans to be an active participant of his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase three heads of cattle & materials for making improvements to his corral

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For pants, blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Mr. Hon Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Hon H. is a village bank president who is 29 years old. He was selected by fifteen people who make up a village bank loan. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for various ways to support their family located in Kampong Luong village, in Takeo province. Mr. Hon H. and his wife, Mrs. Chan Net Touch, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to rice to sell to support their family. Mr Hon H. is also a fisherman, while his wife is a pig breeder. His problem is that his wife’ piglets are too small to sell, but he did not have money to support them. So to improve this condition, Mr. Hon H. is asking for a loan to buy pig food. He is a father of three children, one of whom is enrolled in a local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia R. is from the village of Pobalcion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Lilia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as noodles, can goods, shampoo, sugar, food for snacks, vinegar, milo, candies,cooking oil and others in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim S., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She works in a garment factory and is able to make about 3.50 USD every day. Her husband stays at home, planting and selling trees. On average, he makes 2 USD per day. Since this couple earns a small income, on which they must support their family, Chim S. would like to take out a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with grow-up children. She sells women’s clothing at the central market in Kahovka town. Her main clients are women who wear large size clothing. Svetlana has been in this business for 16 years. She enjoys working in sales very much.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 8,800 Grivnas to increase her working capital. She hopes to earn additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Yadira Modesta

texts.es: Yadira tiene 42 años,  tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Ambos están estudiando en secundaria. La señora se dedica a la venta de artesanías, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, pese a que también las personas que ya la conocen llegan a su casa a comprar sus productos, sus inicios se dan hace 11 años, esto fue producto de la falta de trabajo y necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este crédito será para la compra de  compra de materia prima para su negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener su propio medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Yadira, 42, has three children in her care.  They are in secondary school.  She’s an itinerant crafts merchant although people who know her come by her house to buy her products.  She started out 11 years ago because of the lack of employment opportunities and the need to have a source of income to support her children.  With much effort she has managed to stay in business.

This loan will be used to buy raw materials for her business.  Her dream has always been to have her own means of transportation.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra  pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Sandra tiene 24 años y tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, piedra chancada y yeso. La puede encontrar a la socia todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la noche en su pequeño negocio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Sandra  es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca a delante a su familia. Con su próximo préstamo, Sandra  que espera recibir $ 500 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar materiales de construcción como bloquetas de construcción, ladrillos, arena, cemento, piedra chancada, etc.   
 
Sandra se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She lives in the same city. Cusco is a charming city that dates back to the times of the Incas and served as a base for the ancient Incan empire.

Sandra is 24 years old and has one child. Her business involves selling construction materials such as sand, gravel, and plaster. She can be found working at her small business between the hours of 7am and 6pm. Sandra has been in business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is a hardworking and responsible woman who wants to move her family forward. With her next loan, Sandra hopes to receive $500 USD to expand her business and purchase construction materials such as blocks, bricks, sand, gravel, and other products.

Sandra is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to sell such as blocks, bricks, sand, gravel, and other products

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a sus 3 hijos menores y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El arduo trabajo que Justina realiza en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, como: el cacao, café y hojas de coca, son llevados a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde obtiene buenos precios por ellos, en ese lugar tiene clientes fijos que siempre le compran su producción al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar en el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Lleva 39 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso y caro. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda ampliar la siembra de sus frutos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, asimismo comprará abono para aplicar en sus tierras.
texts.en: Justina, 55, is a happy, uncomplicated woman.  She lives in her own house with her 3 children and what she most wants is a carefree retirement.  The work that she does in her fields is hard, but she does the work to ensure a good yield when she harvests the crops.  She grows cacao, coffee and coca leaves and sells the crops in the Peruvian city of San Francisco where she can get the best price.  There are always wholesale buyers there who will buy whatever she has to sell.  What Justina most likes about farming is protecting her crops from the plagues of insects that can destroy her crops.  She's been farming for 39 years and what she finds most difficult about farming is getting her crops to market because it's expensive to move the crops, even when a means of transporting them is available.  In the future, she wants to purchase more land so that she can sow fruit crops.  This is Justina's third MFP loan.  She knows that she has to repay the loan in the agreed-upon time and is committed to doing so.  She is a happy and loyal member of her community bank.  She will use the thousand new soles loan to buy cacao and coffee seeds. She will also buy manure to apply to her fields.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For over ten years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her customers include her neighbours and town dwellers. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her beauty salon in the future. With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase hair oils for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to get educated on the various products available and to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair oils for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Berinicil

texts.es: Berinicil, de 28 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 39 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Berinicil ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Berinicil is 28 years old.  She is a very kind and humble woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 39 year-old Alberto, and her three beloved children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.  Through a lot of hard work, Berinicil has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  She takes her produce to the city of San Francisco to sell wholesale.

Berinicil's crops have given her the necessary income to support her family.  This is why she wants to put all her effort into making progress in her business.  What she most likes about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in the business for 10 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting her produce to the market since the sacks that she must carry are very heavy and tire her out.  In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thereby make better profits.

This is Bernicil's fourth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in making the repayments on her previous loans and she hopes to continue this.  Bernicil participates a lot in her community bank  and she is always up to date on the agreements that her group reaches.  She will use the 500 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticides

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 53 años D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su esposo don Ángel y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. comales, tiene más D. 20 años dedicándose a este oficio, su madre fue quien le enseño a trabajar con barro, hoy su horario normal es D. 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materia prima como barro, semillas D. nacazcol y loza cruda, con este préstamo otorgado tendrá acceso a la compra D. material y favorecerá su inventario para continuar en su oficio que por años le ha dado a su familia los ingresos para solventar diferentes situaciones.
Su propósito es cancelar este préstamo puntualmente, aumentar su producción D. ollas y comales, además D. aumentar también sus ingresos para poder algún día construir su casa y ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her husband, Ángel, and four children in Guatajiagua, located in the department of Morazán. She works making and selling comales (smooth, flat griddles maD. for cooking tortillas) and has been in this traD. for more than 20 years. Her mother was the one who taught her to work with clay. Today, her normal schedule is from 8am to 5pm.

She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials such as clay, nacazcol seeds (used for dye), and unfired earthenware. With the loan granted, she will be able to purchase material that will benefit her inventory in order to continue in the traD. that has provided her family with income to cover different situations for years.

Her intention is to pay off the loan on time, to increase her production of pots and comales, as well as to increase her income so that she can one day build her house and help her children in their studies.

loans.use: To purchase materials: clay, nacazcol seeds, and unfired earthenware

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is a married woman, who was educated through the junior high school level. Her husband is a mason. To earn a living, she sells cooked rice, eggs, canned tomatoes, and other food items in Abura. By doing so, she is able to assist her husband pay their utility bills and their children's school fees.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $225 to expand her business. She hopes to use the expected additional profits generated as a result of the loan to build a shop.

loans.use: To expand her cooking business and to ultimately build her own store

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela G. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three businesses: a general store, raising livestock and a mini-pharmacy. She lives in Poblacion Santander, Cebu. Adela has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.

Adela now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,400. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 in order to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Adela hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a twenty-five year-old married man with a child, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is longing to buy land and build a permanent house for his residence. For three years, he has been doing a number of activities, such as building, growing maize, and operating shops, which enabled him to live a modest life. He started with a retail shop but he now sells at wholesale.  He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation of agricultural produce.  His dream is to own an estate. Daniel needs the loan to prepare land and plant maize.

loans.use: Preparation of land for maize plantation.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mr. Mean U. is 39 yeas old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhan Chum, is 44 years old (pictured together).  They live about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married, two have full-time employment, one attends school, and one is still too young for school.

Mean is construction contractor. His wife sells Cambodian cakes.  She makes the cakes herself and sells them in the village. Mean is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials for his construction business.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction business

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esperanza es una mujer trabajadora para el bienestar familiar, de sus cinco hijos, que junto con su esposo, se esfuerzan para poder cubrir los gastos.
Su negocio es el alquiler de dos cuarto, como alquiler de teléfono, que ha venido dando mantenimiento con préstamo en Afodenic atreves de los financiamientos, de siete ciclos, lo que ha sido de gran beneficio económico en su vida personal.
Con este nuevo crédito, lograra la construcción de un nuevo cuarto, con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos, el cual espera terminarlo poco  a poco. Comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, quintales de hierro, piedra, cemento, madera, entre otros y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a woman who works hard for her family's well-being.  She has five children and, together with her husband, makes every effort to cover expenses.  

Her business is the rental of two rooms and a telephone.  She has been able to keep up maintenance with loans she's received through Afrodenic on seven occasions.  This has given her enormous financial support in her private life.

She will use this loan to build a new room, which she will finish little by little so she can increase income.  She plans to buy construction materials such as bricks, iron rods, stone, cement, wood, etc. and begin construction work.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build another rental room for extra income

loans.name: Mirian Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian  de 32 años, con dos  hijos, tiene ya 4 años dedicándose a la venta de carbón,  ella posee buenas ventas ya que entrega a las diferentes churrasquerías existentes por su domicilio transportándolo en una carretilla.  Vive en casa de sus padres con su marido que se dedica a la albañilería. Doña Mirian  también realiza comida para vender en la puerta de su casa algunos días de la semana. Ella  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que posee actualmente y necesita comprar carbón por sacos para poder empaquetarlo y poder obtener mayor utilidad. Posee un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Mirian is 32 years old, has two children and for 4 years has sold charcoal. She has good sales since she delivers her items to different churrasquerías (grilled meat restaurants) along her neighborhood by transporting them in a wheelbarrow. She lives in her parents’ home with her husband who used to work as a mason. Mrs. Mirian also makes food that she sells in her home some days of the week. She saw the need to get a loan from our institution since there has been an increase in demand for her items and needs to buy charcoal sacks to be able to package them and have more profits. She has a good credit history and is an old customer of the institution with good payments and is a very hardworking person. Mrs. Miriam is thankful to the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: buy charcoal by the sacks

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 33 years old and a mother of 5 children, all of whom attend school. She has been in mixed farming for over 10 years, producing tea and milk which she sells at the local market.  She depends solely on her farming for the family upkeep. 

Eunice has  requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to venture into the poultry business. She says this will enable her to have an alternative source of income to maintain the family’s general well-being. She is optimistic that she will be able to earner income much faster through than dairy and tea. She predicts growth for all her businesses.  She is, however, concerned with diseases, as outbreaks in poultry are common.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ordinary clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria Concepción es soltera trabajadora lucha por tener un futuro mejor y tener todo lo necesario siempre con la ayuda  del todo poderoso, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, compra los pollos recién nacidos y los vende cuando estas grandes además de eso se dedica a la venta de oro brasileño  ente ellas cadenas aretes  etc. ya que es muy vendible lo compra la mayoría de señoritas,  y es excelente asiendo güipiles se tarda un mes en sacar uno de marcadores valorado en 1,500.00 . ella Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos. lograr vender en estas épocas aretes para las señoras y señoritas que desean lucir bien y necesita comprar concentrado para seguir alimentando a sus animales. Su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Concepción  is a single, hardworking woman who is striving to have a better future and to support herself, always with the help of the Almighty.  She has a business raising chickens.  She buys the newborn chicks and sells them when they are grown.  In addition to this, she sells items made from Brazilian gold such as necklaces and earrings, because these are easily sold due to the fact that so many women buy them.  She is also very good at making güipiles (embroidered woven dresses typical of Guatemala.)  It takes her a month to make one of these dresses using the Marcador technique of weaving, and they can be sold for about $150.  Maria requests a loan to buy supplies to make her woven garments.  In the current season she will sell earrings for women who want to look good, and she needs to buy feed so that she can continue to raise her animals.  Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her woven garments, and to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Dagbozounkou Dénagan

texts.fr: Né en 1963 au Bénin, Dagbozounkou Dénagan est marié à un certain Houmè. Le couple a six enfants à charge dont cinq sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Dagbozounkou Dénagan n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Dagbozounkou Dénagan a appris le métier de maçonnerie ; métier qu’il exerce passionnément depuis près de vingt huit ans. De façon secondaire Dagbozounkou Dénagan fait de l’agriculture. Pour améliorer ses prestations et se faire plus de revenus, Dagbozounkou Dénagan à besoin de plus d'instruments de maçonnerie. Dagbozounkou Dénagan s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin, et fournit ses prestations sur plusieurs chantiers. En vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Dagbozounkou Dénagan sollicite pour une seconde fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu à été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1963, Dagbozounkou Dénagan is married to Houmè. The couple has six dependent children, five of whom are their own. Some of the children go to school. The couple provides for the household's various expenses together. Dagbozounkou Dénagan never went to school. To provide for his family, Dagbozounkou Dénagan learnt the trade of a mason; he has been practicing it with passion for close to twenty-eight years. In addition, Dagbozounkou Dénagan grows crops.
To improve his services and increase his revenues, Dagbozounkou Dénagan needs more masonry tools. Dagbozounkou Dénagan gets his supplies in Nigeria, a state adjacent to Benin, and offers his services on several sites. In order to better meet the demand from his customers, Dagbozounkou Dénagan is requesting ALIDé's financial support for the second time. The first loan he received was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows, trowels, etc.

loans.name: Khanim

texts.ru:
Khanim opened dental clinic for 12 years ago. She is 44 years old. She has a daughter who will enter to university in this year. She has no husband. Khanim grows her daughter by herself. Khanim and her daughter live in Baku region.
She wants to improve her dental clinic in order to improve the quality of services to her clients. 
Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy medicines for her work.
texts.en:
Khanim opened a dental clinic twelve years ago. She is 44 years old. She has a daughter who will enter the university this year. She has no husband. Khanim is raising her daughter by herself. Khanim and her daughter live in the Baku region.
She wants to improve her dental clinic in order to improve the quality of services she provides to her clients. 
Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy medicines for her work.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and is married, with seven children between the ages of 9 and 29 years. She sells vegetables, cooking oil, water, body lotion, etc. in her store. Her business is well-organized. She has one year of experience and she works from 6 A.M. until 10 P.M. every day. Josephine currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase a large quantity of vegetables, cooking oil, water, and body lotion to sell. With the profits, Josephine will reinvest in her business and will be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, cooking oil, water, body lotion etc. for her store
